title: Cyber Security Engineer
description:
What does Finalis do?

Finalis is the leading platform enabling the securities brokerage landscape to operate legally and compliantly. The firm delivers a white-labeled regulatory affiliation and compliance back-office solution that supports a wide range of private market dealmaking including M&A, capital raising, private placements, direct participation programs, fintech marketplaces, and alternative investment sponsors.

Finalis provides additional leverage to securities brokers with the Finalis Platform, which delivers a hassle-free deal management solution and a Marketplace that connects brokers with one another to gain insights and explore collaborations.

Launched in 2020 and growing rapidly, the SF- and NYC-based firm is on a mission to power dealmakers by building the world’s largest dealmaking platform.

Join us in disrupting the securities industry, for good.

How does Finalis work?

We are a fully-remote company with Finalists distributed between the time zones of Eastern... Standard Time and Eastern European Time .

If you’re located outside this time zone range, depending on the needs of your team, you may be requested to be available during specific hours.

Although we don’t have an official physical place to work, we promote gathering with your team or other colleagues whenever possible.

What about your team?

As Finalis continues to rapidly grow, we seek to bring on a skilled Security Cloud Engineer. Be part of the team harnessing the full power of the cloud to create extraordinary new value for the world 's leading organizations. From architecture professionals, data security specialists to software developers, you'll join the best in the industry, leveraging agile methodologies across the technology stack to drive 360˚ value for clients.

What will you be doing?
• Participate in compliance enforcing security standards such as SOC2 and ISO 27001.
• Contribute to design the infrastructure architecture and suggest recommendations on security aspects. Contribute to threat modeling and attack surface analysis.
• Assess security risks and their impact on applications and infrastructure using tools such as Nessus, Burp Suite, NMAP, OWASP ZAP, etc.
• Monitor and analyze system alerts to identify and block malicious behavior and activities.
• Execute incident response plans, identify root cause and drive mitigations to prevent future incidents.
• Document all actions taken as part of the investigation, such as work instructions.
• Continuously improve processes through automation and creation of tools using Python, Go or similar.
• Generate vulnerability, configuration, and coverage metrics and reports to demonstrate assessment coverage and remediation effectiveness for systems and infrastructure.
• Assist with the development of processes and procedures to improve threat and vulnerability management and security center operations
• Educate and advocate for improved security throughout the data ecosystem.
• Hardening Cloud infrastructure.
• Generate security incident reports, security assessment reports, security procedures.

Who are we looking for
• Graduated and/or student of careers related to Systems.
• A minimum of 3 years of experience.
• Hands-on experience hardening cloud servers, Docker Containers, and K8S.
• Knowledge of OWASP application security standards, CIS Benchmarks, etc.
• Experience in planning and testing for business continuity and disaster recovery
• Experience with network and endpoint security tools such as EDR, IDS, SIEM, WAF.
• Experience using AWS security tools.
• Understand vulnerability assessments and experience in red teaming and penetration testing used to identify weaknesses and mitigations.
• Security Event Management: Triage, analysis and response activities.
• Knowledge of scripting languages such as bash, Python, GO, etc.
• Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) as well as comfort and experience in delivering presentations.
• Ability to quickly adapt to changing priorities, demands, and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities.

Bonus Track!
• Security related certification such as CEH, CISM, CCSS, CCCA, CCCS, CompTIA Security+, CISSP, GSEC etc. (Desirable)
• AWS Infrastructure Certifications Desirable: AWS Solution Architect, AWS Security Specialist. (Desirable)
• Experience with Github Actions, CI/CD.

What do we offer?
• 100% Remote work (Work from wherever you want!)
• Competitive USD salary
• USD $20 per month for Internet expenses
• Generous Paid time-off (Vacation Time!)
• 17 Flex Days (to use in national holidays or personal matters)
• Professional Growth Benefit (take your skills to the next level!)
• People Team Partner (to target your roadblocks and customize an action plan for your career path)
• Buddy Program
• Virtual After-Office Activities
• Diverse Culture & Inclusive environment

Why work with Finalis?

We are a fast-paced startup which will enable you to develop skills quickly and work in an entrepreneurial culture where pushing limits and taking risks is everyday business. As we have Finalists from different countries and cultures, we encourage our team members to develop their soft skills, boosting their ability to adapt themselves to different backgrounds.

Finalis’ core values:
• We embody the trust we deliver
• We are extremely proactive
• We challenge conventional wisdom
• We’re passionate about our work
• We exercise stewardship with our users, investors and each other.

Finalis provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities

title: Technical Project Manager/Product Owner
description:
APPLY HERE: https://adr.to/oxza4ai

Summary

Hands-on Technical Project Manager/Delivery Manager

Description

Our client, Microsoft Gold Partner with technical expertise in Azure PaaS and 7 Microsoft Gold Competencies, is looking to add another Technical Project Manager (Product Owner) to their LATAM team. The arrangement is set up as team augmentation, meaning that it's a long-term, full-time, fully remote engagement without the end date. You should be willing to overlap up to 6 hours a day with PST time zone. B2 or higher level of English communication skills is required for this position.

We are looking for a technical project manager with experience working on Azure cloud related projects - applications or/and infrastructure. You bring technical expertise that enables you to foresee and manage challenges that arise at all stages of a software development project’s lifecycle. You have strong interpersonal skills and are adept at communicating with cross-functional teams. You are... comfortable working in hybrid (agile/waterfall) and not rigidly structured PMO environment.

What you will be doing:
• Ensure that software development projects meet client expectations in a timely manner.
• Serve as a touch-point between development teams and clients to provide insights into projects.
• Ensure the successful delivery of projects on time.
• Be the main point of contact for all projects, meaning you are knowledgeable about their status, scheduled timelines, budget, scope, risk, and client expectations.
• Communicate with development teams to assess problems and generate solutions.
• Communicate with clients to discuss timeline and/or development issues.
• Liaise with the development team in Latin America

Mandatory Requirements
• 5+ years of experience as a Technical Project Manager in enterprise level environments
• Azure/Microsoft environment experience is required
• Advanced understanding of the lifecycle of software development projects
• Proven experience delivering cloud applications/infrastructure projects
• Project Management certification(s), such as PMP or PMI
• Proven Ability to lead/oversee multiple small to medium size projects
• Hands-on experience with PM tools such as Asana, JIRA, bonus points for Azure DevOps
• Basic understanding of the cloud (tech-savvy)

Nice-to-Have Requirements
• Previous Big 4 experience
• Experience with cloud migration/applications is a big plus
• Being an architect/developer in the past would make it a winner

If you think the job is the right fit for you, please apply directly from the web:

https://adr.to/oxza4ai

While we strive to respond to all applicants, please understand that due to the high volume of applications we receive, it may not be feasible to provide individual feedback or responses to every candidate. Rest assured that your application will be carefully reviewed and considered. We appreciate your understanding and interest in joining our team.
To see all of our current positions, follow this link: https://devengine.ca/jobs.html
We also encourage you to join our Telegram channel here: https://web.telegram.org/k/#@DevEngine

Tipo de puesto: Tiempo completo

Salario: $4.500,00 - $5.000,00 al mes

Experiencia:
• Project Manager: 5 años (Obligatorio)
• Azure: 3 años (Deseable

title: IT Project Manager - con presencialidad en zona Microcentro
description:
En Infotema estamos buscando un profesional de sistemas con experiencia laboral previa como PM.

La búsqueda se orienta a un profesional con capaciadad de: Liderazgo, gestión y planificación de proyectos de desarrollo.

Tareas:

Planificación y seguimiento del equipo de trabajo (AF, DEV, QA ).

Generación de documentos funcionales y documentos técnicos.

Comunicación y negociación con las áreas de negocio.

Búsqueda continua de mejoras y práctica de metodología SCRUM.

Zona de trabajo: Microcentro.

Jornada laboral: Full Time.

Presencialidad: SI (4 días en oficina en función de la demanda del proyecto)

Zona: Microcentro (Diagonal norte y Maipu)

Home office: SI 1 vez por semana.

Se ofrece:

$500.000 pesos Netos (Facturación)

Ajuste salarial

Entrega de notebook

$2500 en concepto de conectividad a internet

title: Marketing Project Manager - Argentina
description:
Pleaseread the IMPORTANT section at the end of this posting.

About Very

Very is a fully distributed IoT technology firm led by expert problem-solvers to create efficient, scalable solutions that move commercial, industrial, and consumer IoT projects from pilot to production in record time.

We’ve built a collaborative, tight-knit team that thrives, whether we’re hanging out in person at our annual retreat or coordinating work across time zones. The results show that we’re doing something right — as we’ve won numerous workplace awards over the years. Most recently in 2021 we were certified as a Great Place to Work, and in 2022 we were listed again in Parity.org ’s list of Best Companies for Women to Advance.

We believe that everything we build — and the people we build it with — has the potential to change the world. Our client list includes numerous well-known brands determined to leverage the power of IoT to drive material outcomes — such as Vizio, Peloton, Clear, iHeart Radio and... Fellowes. Our goal, for each and every client we partner with, is to create high-value solutions through a collaborative and user-centered process.

About This Role

As a Marketing Project Management Specialist, you’ll work with the entire marketing team to ensure marketing programs run smoothly and efficiently. Reporting directly to the Chief Marketing Officer (CMO), you’ll populate and groom the marketing department’s project backlog, conduct project intake calls with external stakeholders, fill out creative briefs for each project, and ensure projects are not missing deadlines.

For this role, we’re looking for a candidate who takes initiative, has impeccable attention to detail, adds expertise to our team, and demonstrates a passion for marketing operations and project management. Some traits we are looking for include:

- Previous experience acting as admin or superuser for a project management tool (ClickUp preferred)

- Capacity to manage dozens of projects simultaneously

- Comfort working independently to manage projects

- Comfort enforcing adherence to process across the marketing team

- Ability to collaborate with marketing leaders to improve

processes

What You’ll Be Working On

Responsibilities

- Maintain documented project management processes

- Maintain best practices for ClickUp usage and serve as a ClickUp admin and superuser

- Evaluate new technology and add-on applications to improve marketing project management processes

- Align with cross-discipline team members to make sure that all parties are on track with project requirements, deadlines, and schedules across multiple projects

- Identify and develop new opportunities for off-team collaboration, creating new systems and processes

- Facilitate weekly OKR check-in meetings

- Schedule quarterly OKR planning meetings

- Schedule project kickoff calls

As a client services organization, travel may be required up to 10% of the time.

Outcomes

- Ensure on-time completion of all marketing projects. When this is not possible, alert the marketing leadership team early and collaborate on the best path forward.

- Ensure adherence to project management processes among all marketing team members.

Qualifications

Experience

- BA/BS in a related field (Marketing, Communications, or Business)

- 3+ years of relevant experience

Skills

- In addition to experience, these are the critical skills we’re looking for in this role.

- Communicates Effectively: Demonstrates expert-level communication skills. Can comfortably present information that is clear and concise (verbal and written).

- Collaborative Mindset: Effectively collaborates to reach positive outcomes with teammates on projects that vary in size and complexity.

- Flexibility: Experience working in a fast-paced, always-changing environment and comfort with ambiguity.

- Positive Attitude: Tackle challenges with resilience and optimism.

- Detail-Oriented: Ensures tasks are completed with precision and accuracy, ultimately contributing to the high-quality outcomes our team strives for.
• *Unfortunately, applicants who do not meet these criteria will not be considered.**

Ideal Additional Qualifications/Experience:

- Experience at a professional services firm or consultancy

- BA/BS degree in Design or a similar field

- Familiarity with the Internet of Things (IoT) space is strongly preferred

- Experience managing a dynamic, geographically diverse environment

Compensation

Base Compensation:

Between USD $35,000 and $45,000 per year, commensurate with experience.

Variable compensation:

Up to 5% of your base salary in the first year.

We also offer world-class perks:

- $2,500/yr continuing education stipend, upon one year of employment

- Udemy license for continuing education

- $1,000 annual Healthcare Stipend (to be used towards Health insurance premium)

- $600/yr towards Home Office Stipend (Limitations apply).

- $100/mo Monthly Communications Stipend (Can be used towards Cell Phone Data Plan, WiFi Plan, VOIP, VPN)

- Personalized ESL coaching and access to an AI-powered adaptive platform to take your English to the next level

- Annual company trip, all expenses paid.

- Loaned MacBook Pro

Why Work for Very

You are more than your job title. At Very, we prioritize talent development and professional growth with a human-first approach that caters to the unique goals each individual brings to the team.

Our core value, Invest in Our People, looks like collaborating with a cohort of talented people on a mission to get better every single day. It feels like working for a company that invests in you. And it means finding alignment with your career goals to get you where you want to be.

How do we bring our priorities to life? Of course we offer the typical world-class perks you would expect. Additionally, as a remote-first company (since 2011), we provide stipends for home office, telephone, and internet. Professional development funds and generous parental leave are also some of the benefits you can expect.

But a healthy company culture isn't just about perks. It's about creating an environment where our employees can thrive. Our work is fueled by smart, creative people whose lives are enriched by our experiences together. We learn together, we grow together, and we play together. Despite working across more than half a dozen countries, our teams connect regularly for work and for fun - on Slack, Zoom, and during an annual retreat. We’ve been remote-first from the beginning, so we know well what it takes to maintain a strong culture. #LI-Remote

IMPORTANT:

1. This job is to work for a US company. An advanced level of English is a must. Please refrain from applying if this is not your case.Resumes must be in English.

2. This job is remote but if you’re not located in the region or country mentioned in the post’s title, do not continue. Your application won’t be reviewed.

If you’re in Brazil, Bahamas, Barbados, Bolivia, Cuba, El Salvador, Haiti, Jamaica, Nicaragua, Panama, Suriname, Trinidad and Tobago, or Venezuela, we can’t accept your application at this time.

3. The region/country on the post's title is not related to the location of the clients we serve. It's a reference to the residence location of the applicant. All of Very's clients are North America-based.

4. Delivery team members may be required to travel up to 10% of the time. As a client services organization, this is expected.

Interviewing for a new company is a serious time commitment for all parties involved. Please take the time to read this and thoughtfully consider if we would be a good fit for one another. No contractors or agencies. Seriously. #LI-Remote

title: Project Manager (Argentina only) [Remote]
description:
ABOUT US:

Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.

ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:

When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.
• JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)
• LOCATION: Remote - Argentina only
• RATE: Our client is looking to pay $60,000 – $110,000/yr
• ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term
• BRAINTRUST JOB ID: 6620

THE OPPORTUNITY

Requirements
• Demonstrable problem-solving project management experience and skills
• A bachelor’s degree in project management, computer science, informational technology, or related fields may be recommended
• Knowledge of project management... methodologies such as DACI and best practices
• Strong interpersonal and team leadership skills
• Strong organizational, time management, and verbal and written communication skills
• Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools
• Proficiency in project management tools and software
• Experience with cloud-based hosting platforms and version control tools

What you’ll be working on

Our client is seeking a project manager to join their growing company. As a project manager, you will manage multiple projects simultaneously and ensure that all deadlines are met. You will also take the lead on projects, delegate tasks, and manage the productivity of your team. You will be responsible for assigning tasks to the right team members, checking on their progress, and ensuring that each project is completed on time and to the highest standard.

Below are some of the responsibilities:
• Manage and coordinate multiple projects to ensure they are completed on time and within budget
• Organize and plan project tasks and schedules
• Manage tasks by Project Management Institute (PMI) standards and those of the company
• Communicate project status to stakeholders and key project participants
• Stay aware of company goals and strategies to ensure projects align with business priorities
• Facilitate and encourage collaboration across departments to ensure projects are completed successfully
• Delegate work to team members based on skills and expertise
• Optimize project deliverables, schedule, and budgeting
• Work with proposal teams to develop cost estimates and project plans
• Create presentations and reports to communicate project status
• Keep the project team focused on the end goal

Apply Now!

C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.

Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
(PLEASE INCLUDE PORTFOLIO AND LINKEDIN IN APPLICATION)

ABOUT ONESEVEN

OneSeven is a US-based product development studio building apps for industry-changing startups and enterprises. We love building digital products and helping companies succeed in their market. Working at OneSeven is a great opportunity to put your current skills to the test, build new skills, and be an early employee at a growing startup. We are a fully remote workforce with headquarters in Tampa Bay, Florida and employees worldwide. Our services cover the spectrum for startups so we can help them plan, design, build, and support high-quality digital products.

Our founder, James, started OneSeven over five years ago after his experience hiring an offshore agency for his pre-seed Ed-Tech startup. The project was unsuccessful due to communication issues, conflicting time zones, and scope creep. Since then, he built OneSeven and tailored our services to support startup founders needing high-quality software... development.

ABOUT THIS ROLE

As a UX/UI Designer at OneSeven, you will take ownership of your products and be able to think strategically, as well as switch between holistic and detailed points of view. We are looking for someone who can operate autonomously while also knowing the value of team collaboration and design feedback within an agile environment. Being someone who asks a lot of questions, and then seeks the answers to those questions is the type of proactive person we are looking for.

Drawing on your knowledge and expertise of UX design, and UI Design, you will help craft innovative solutions for our clients, as well as work on internal projects that increase our efficiency.

WHAT YOU’LL DO
• Design mobile and web experiences for various client projects, which spread across different industries and product types.
• Be able to work on projects that start from scratch or improve existing applications.
• Assist with internal projects when there’s capacity, which can be anything from designing a OneSeven SaaS tool or building out a new design offering for startups.
• Work collaboratively with our strategy and development teams to scope out project requirements and deliver work.
• Get involved earlier in the sales process by doing quick mockups and rapid prototyping for leads in the pipeline to prove that we deliver value.
• Help the marketing team with occasional graphic design projects or new website pages.
• Own the entire design lifecycle from documentation to delivery of high-fidelity designs.
• Complete user and competitive research as needed to help influence design concepts and iterate design work.
• Engage in usability testing and perform design validation research.
• Present your designs with confidence, no matter what stage, and collect actionable feedback for iterating.
• Leverage data to make well thought out and educated design decisions.
• Interact and communicate effectively with key client stakeholders.
• Follow agile methodologies and processes to complete projects.

WHO YOU ARE
• 2-5 years of experience working in user experience design/research, interactive design, user interface design, graphic design, branding or a related field.
• Values data-driven and research-backed design decisions.
• A proactive go-getter who identifies problems and seeks solutions.
• Can work both autonomously and collaboratively in a team environment.
• Experience working with fast-paced startups from Pre-Seed to Series A
• Experience working closely with strategists, project managers, and developers in an agile environment (sprint backlogs, daily standups, etc).
• Passionate and looking to make an impact through design.
• The startup world excites you and sparks your entrepreneurial spirit.
• Strong communication and presentation skills
• Previous agency experience is a plus!
• Demonstrated written and verbal fluency in English (required)

BENEFITS/COMPENSATION
• Full-time position
• Monthly Salary: $1500-$3000 based on experience.
• Completely remote workforce (work anywhere in the world, as long as you can be available during our company hours 9am-5pm EST)
• Unlimited PTO policy and company-wide closures for major US Holidays.
• 2-5% Christmas Bonus (Based on employee performance and annual salary. Bonuses are distributed in December.)
• $500 annual education stipend you can use as a credit with OneSeven to purchase courses, materials, or other items to help improve your skills.

At OneSeven Technology, we don’t just accept differences — we celebrate them, we support them, and we thrive on them for the benefit of our employees, our customers, and our community. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. If you’re good at what you do, come as you are. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. OneSeven Technology is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
UI/UX Designer Linkedin Post:

Join the In-House Team of Virtual Latinos!

Ever dreamed of working from the comfort of your house while earning a much better wage than in your home country and helping other Latinos find their dream job? Well… you’ve come to the right place!

With over 800+ Latino Virtual Professionals already working with 650+ clients and counting, Virtual Latinos is the first American Company that connects amazing and talented virtual professionals from Latin America with small businesses & entrepreneurs from the US, Canada, and the world. New job positions open every week, allowing professionals to find great remote job opportunities.

Job Title: UI/UX Designer for the Internal Virtual Latinos Team

Pay Rate:

Full-Time Rate: $2,080-$2,320 per month
• The monthly salary range posted is stipulated as an average monthly income. However, all jobs at Virtual Latinos are hourly-based, and payments are calculated on the number of hours a person works daily. We pay our... Virtual Professionals every 2 weeks through third-party platforms. The hourly rate range of the position is $13-$14.50 per hour, depending on experience. Once a rate has been offered to you, it is non-negotiable.

Work Schedule: Monday-Friday, 9-hour shift with a 1-hour lunch break. The entire shift should fall between 7 am- 5 pm PST, preferred.

Additional Perks of Working Directly for the In-House Virtual Latinos Team:
• Long-term work relationships (this is not a project-based opportunity)
• Perks based on longevity within the job (such as PTO and medical stipends)
• An amazing team and company culture
• Generous training resources with the possibility of pay increases for courses taken
• Growth opportunities to move up within the company

How to Apply to this Specific Job:
• Click the "Apply" button on this post.
• Complete and submit the application form for the ‘UI/UX Designer’ position.
• You will be asked some general questions, be required to take a short English test, provide you internet speed and answer a few general questions as well as some specific ones for this job. Those specific questions are:
• How do you balance form and function in your design process? Can you provide an example?
• Tell us about a design trend that you are excited about currently. How would you incorporate this trend in your design process, if given a chance?
• When do you know that your design is "complete"? What criteria do you use to make this determination?
• Our team will process your application in 2-3 weeks to let you know if you are moving on to the next round. Due to the volume of applications, this response time may take a little longer.
• *Our communication efforts will be done primarily through email so please be on the lookout for emails coming from the @virtuallatinos.com handle. It's important that you also check your spam folder for our emails, depending on your privacy settings, or risk missing out on a fantastic career opportunity!

Deadline to Apply: Thursday, August 10th, 2023

Job Summary: We are seeking a talented and experienced UI/UX Designer to join our team. As a UI/UX Designer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining our web applications from the front end to the back end. You will work closely with our product team to ensure that our applications are scalable and user-friendly.

Job Tasks:
• Designing intuitive and user-friendly interfaces for web and mobile applications.
• Working closely with the product and development teams to ensure the seamless integration of the user interface with the underlying functionality.
• Creating high-fidelity wireframes, prototypes, and mockups for various devices and interfaces.
• Conducting user research and usability testing to gather feedback and iteratively improve the product.
• Creating user stories, personas, and storyboards to understand user needs and motivations.
• Participating in design reviews and ensuring compliance with design standards.
• Providing technical support and guidance to other team members.

Required Technical Skills:
• Strong proficiency in design software such as Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma, or similar.
• Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for rapid prototyping purposes.
• Understanding of user-centered design (UCD) principles.
• Experience in creating wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows, and site maps.
• Experience in conducting user research and usability testing.
• Familiarity with modern web standards and mobile trends.
• Experience in working with cross-functional teams to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences.
• Experience with responsive or adaptive design.

Preferred Technical Skills (not required):
• Experience with animation and motion design.
• Knowledge of accessibility and inclusive design principles.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
• 5+ years of experience in UI/UX design.
• Ability to work in a fast-paced and agile environment.
• Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
• Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
• Strong ability to work in a team environment.
• Ability to iteratively design and convey design ideas effectively.
• Passion for learning new technologies and keeping up-to-date with industry trends.
• Strong attention to detail and ability to work in a team environment.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

If all that sounds appealing and you’re interested in this role, apply today!

Hope to hear from you soon

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
About The Company

The Ridge crafts products made to last a lifetime through with simple, functional designs ready for anything and everything. Our materials are chosen with care and a thoughtful connection to the insights of our growing community - setting our North star as we strive to improve everyday. Together we can do more with less.

Ridge started with The Ridge Wallet as a Kickstarter project in 2013 and is now in the hands and pockets of over 3 million people worldwide! We currently operate around the globe selling in the US, Canada, the UK, EU, and Australia on Shopify and through other channels such as Amazon and Wholesalers. We have also expanded and continue to expand our product catalog to include KeyCases, Bolt Action Pens, Knives, Rings, Watches and we have plenty more in the works!

We are looking for people interested in positions with tremendous growth potential, but which come with high expectations of work rate and quality of work. We are a fully remote company... and utilize that to find the best talent around the world to join our team. Since we are a remote-first company, we always do our best to be as accommodating to a healthy work/life balance.

Benefits & Perks
• At this time, we offer pay on a weekly basis via PayPal or Wise.com, but preferability Wise.com for ease of payments.
• Starting 30 days after the working relationship has started, we offer Paid Vacation and Sick time depending on the number of days remaining in the calendar year. These pools of time will be reset at the beginning of each calendar year.
• For this position, we are offering a weekly salary range of $1000 USD depending on experience, with the expectation of a 40-hour work week. During training the first few week's hours may be lower, but the salary rate will remain the same. The total per month would then be $ 4,000 USD. For highly skilled applicants, this can be negotiated upon completion of the application!

The Role

Job Description: As an Ecommerce UI and UX Designer, you will play a key role in creating visually compelling and user-friendly experiences for our ecommerce platform. This position offers an exciting opportunity for a designer with some prior experience to work with a talented design team and contribute to the overall success of our online store. Your focus will be on designing intuitive user interfaces (UI) and optimizing user experiences (UX) to drive engagement, conversion, and customer satisfaction.Responsibilities:
• User Interface Design: Create visually appealing and intuitive user interface designs for various pages and elements of our ecommerce platform, including homepage, product listings, checkout process, and more.
• User Experience Optimization: Collaborate with the UX team to enhance user journeys, streamline navigation, and improve overall usability, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable shopping experience.
• Wireframing and Prototyping: Develop wireframes and interactive prototypes to illustrate design concepts and user flows, gathering feedback from stakeholders and iterating on designs accordingly.
• Visual Branding: Ensure that all UI designs adhere to our brand guidelines, maintaining consistency in color schemes, typography, and visual elements across the platform.
• Mobile Responsiveness: Design UI/UX solutions that are mobile-friendly and responsive, providing an optimal experience for users on various devices and screen sizes.
• Digital Design Experience: Leverage your experience in creating engaging graphics, banners, and promotional materials for our ecommerce platform and marketing campaigns.
• A/B Testing and Analysis: Assist in A/B testing various design elements and user flows to identify opportunities for improvement and conversion rate optimization.
• Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, developers, and marketing, to understand requirements and align design solutions with business goals.
• User Research: Utilize user research insights to inform design decisions and incorporate user feedback into the iterative design process.
• Industry Trends: Stay up-to-date with UI/UX design trends, best practices, and emerging technologies, bringing fresh ideas and innovative design approaches to the team.

Ideal Profile

Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in Interaction Design, Graphic Design, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), or related fields.
• 2+ years of experience as a UI/UX designer, preferably in an ecommerce or digital product environment.
• Portfolio: A strong portfolio showcasing UI and UX design projects, demonstrating creativity, problem-solving abilities, and attention to detail. Include examples of digital design work.
• Software Skills: Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite (Adobe XD, Photoshop, Illustrator) or Sketch, as well as familiarity with prototyping tools like Figma or InVision.
• Digital Design Experience: Experience creating graphics, banners, and digital assets for ecommerce platforms and marketing campaigns.
• Knowledge: Solid understanding of UI design principles, UX methodologies, information architecture, and usability best practices.
• Collaboration: Strong communication and teamwork skills, able to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
• Adaptability: Willingness to learn and adapt to new challenges and design requirements.
• Passion: A genuine interest in ecommerce, user-centered design, and creating exceptional digital experiences.

What's on Offer?
• Opportunity within company with a solid track record of success
• Flexible working options
• Leadership Role

We are looking for people interested in positions with tremendous growth potential, but which come with high expectations of work rate and quality of work. We are a fully remote company... and utilize that to find the best talent around the world to join our team. Since we are a remote-first company, we always do our best to be as accommodating to a healthy work/life balance.

Benefits & Perks
• At this time, we offer pay on a weekly basis via PayPal or Wise.com, but preferability Wise.com for ease of payments.
• Starting 30 days after the working relationship has started, we offer Paid Vacation and Sick time depending on the number of days remaining in the calendar year. These pools of time will be reset at the beginning of each calendar year.
• For this position, we are offering a weekly salary range of $1000 USD depending on experience, with the expectation of a 40-hour work week. During training the first few week's hours may be lower, but the salary rate will remain the same. The total per month would then be $ 4,000 USD. For highly skilled applicants, this can be negotiated upon completion of the application!

The Role

Job Description: As an Ecommerce UI and UX Designer, you will play a key role in creating visually compelling and user-friendly experiences for our ecommerce platform. This position offers an exciting opportunity for a designer with some prior experience to work with a talented design team and contribute to the overall success of our online store. Your focus will be on designing intuitive user interfaces (UI) and optimizing user experiences (UX) to drive engagement, conversion, and customer satisfaction.Responsibilities:
• User Interface Design: Create visually appealing and intuitive user interface designs for various pages and elements of our ecommerce platform, including homepage, product listings, checkout process, and more.
• User Experience Optimization: Collaborate with the UX team to enhance user journeys, streamline navigation, and improve overall usability, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable shopping experience.
• Wireframing and Prototyping: Develop wireframes and interactive prototypes to illustrate design concepts and user flows, gathering feedback from stakeholders and iterating on designs accordingly.
• Visual Branding: Ensure that all UI designs adhere to our brand guidelines, maintaining consistency in color schemes, typography, and visual elements across the platform.
• Mobile Responsiveness: Design UI/UX solutions that are mobile-friendly and responsive, providing an optimal experience for users on various devices and screen sizes.
• Digital Design Experience: Leverage your experience in creating engaging graphics, banners, and promotional materials for our ecommerce platform and marketing campaigns.
• A/B Testing and Analysis: Assist in A/B testing various design elements and user flows to identify opportunities for improvement and conversion rate optimization.
• Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, developers, and marketing, to understand requirements and align design solutions with business goals.
• User Research: Utilize user research insights to inform design decisions and incorporate user feedback into the iterative design process.
• Industry Trends: Stay up-to-date with UI/UX design trends, best practices, and emerging technologies, bringing fresh ideas and innovative design approaches to the team.

Ideal Profile

Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in Interaction Design, Graphic Design, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), or related fields.
• 2+ years of experience as a UI/UX designer, preferably in an ecommerce or digital product environment.
• Portfolio: A strong portfolio showcasing UI and UX design projects, demonstrating creativity, problem-solving abilities, and attention to detail. Include examples of digital design work.
• Software Skills: Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite (Adobe XD, Photoshop, Illustrator) or Sketch, as well as familiarity with prototyping tools like Figma or InVision.
• Digital Design Experience: Experience creating graphics, banners, and digital assets for ecommerce platforms and marketing campaigns.
• Knowledge: Solid understanding of UI design principles, UX methodologies, information architecture, and usability best practices.
• Collaboration: Strong communication and teamwork skills, able to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
• Adaptability: Willingness to learn and adapt to new challenges and design requirements.
• Passion: A genuine interest in ecommerce, user-centered design, and creating exceptional digital experiences.

What's on Offer?
• Opportunity within company with a solid track record of success
• Flexible working options
• Leadership Role"]}]

• Creación de Wireframes y Prototipos en Illustrator / Figma

Manejo avanzado de Illustrator / PSD / Figma

Valoramos conocimiento en HTML, CSS y manejo de Wordpress.

Es fundamental la creatividad, compromiso e iniciativa del postulante como la capacidad de trabajo en equipo y la buena onda.

Ofrecemos capacitaciones durante el horario... laboral

Full Time - 9.30 a 18hs. Belgrano - Con 2 veces a la semana Home Office

Incentivos en USD

title: Lead DevOps Engineer
description:
In Talently, with a single registration, you can access the best offers from the most important technology companies in the USA and Latam that are looking for tech talent like yours.

Job description:
• Lead DevOps Engineer
• Remote
• USD 3000 - 6000
• Full-time

As a Lead Server-Side Engineer, the company expects you to...
• have previous experience working with dev-ops, infrastructure-as-code and orchestration, and you are someone who can help build out the existing APIs and infrastructure as well as those of the on-premise customers.
• to work closely with the founders and be part of something that is scaling
• be passionate for developing things 'the right way', with demonstrable experience working on large scale web platforms.

You are the person they are looking for if...
• You have previous experience working with Docker, Kubernetes, Helm.
• You have strong Python skills.
• You have worked with REST APIs.
• You have knowledge with PostgreSQL.
• You have experience working with... AWS (especially ECS, Lambda RDS & DynamoDB)
• You are knowledgeable about Terraform

They will be more excited about you if you also...
• You have previous experience with OpenShift
• You have worked with Django / Django Rest Framework and also with JavaScript (ReactJS)
• You know about InfluxDB
• You are knowledgeable about OracleDB, MySQLDB
• You have worked with Pulumi, AWS Cloudformation, Azure Resource Manager etc.

Benefits:
• Payment in US dollars.
• Paid holidays and vacation.
• 100% remote.
• Other benefits.
Additional information: Employment type: Full-time

title: Software Support Technician
description:
WHO WE ARE
You know BarTender software's customers. They're the ones pioneering commercial space flight, developing and delivering vaccines to every continent, manufacturing energy

efficient cars, providing clean water to the world, putting wholesome food on your table and groceries in your cart - and they use our software to create the labels, barcodes and RFID that keep their supply chains moving, traceable and safe.
Our global, talented and diverse teams are passionate about what they do and its impact on everyone, everywhere. Join us and help shape the way the world works.

We are headquartered in Bellevue, Washington, with branch offices in Madrid, Taipei, and Tokyo. For more information about Seagull Scientific, seagullscientific/.

LOCATION

WHAT WE REQUIRE
Ability to speak German and English clearly and communicate effectively

Ability to quickly learn and work with new software

Problem
solving ability and Importante empresa listening skills

Excellent customer service... skills

Technical Support experience

Ability to successfully collaborate with different teams, as well as being self
motivated to work individually

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
A high level of proficiency in other European languages is a plus

Computer Science Degree or Technology Certification or self
taught

WHO YOU ARE

You are a strong team player who appreciates excellence, who is passionate about their work and fair in their interactions with people.

We consider our technical support to be a vital part of the product we sell, and we want Confidencial to be the best.
You are a self

motivated, hardworking professional who is dedicated to outstanding customer support, and are eager to learn new technical skills to make a real difference in a growing, international company.

WHAT YOU WILL DO
Working on our Technical Services team,you will help customers by phone, e
mail, and chat with our BarTender software and printer drivers. This will include high
level technical issues related to our Enterprise software and third

Provide support to customers by identifying, troubleshooting and resolving technical issues.

Seek assistance from senior technicians or pass the case to them as needed.

Research and answer questions from resellers and end users about our software's capabilities.

Contribute to our Knowledge Base and support articles by identifying and recording the issues that impact our customers.

Have the opportunity to take on special tasks and projects, such as report writing, product documentation, suggest improvements for our products and programming.
Above all, provide a World
Class customer experience.

In addition to your everyday duties, you will also have the opportunity to exercise out of the box thinking by taking on special tasks and projects, such as designing workflow procedures, product documentation, software testing, and even programming.
You will also work closely with other departments, including Engineering, Confidencial, Q and A and Sales.

Since our technicians are the first line of communication with our customers, you will also play a vital role in suggesting improvements to our product.

TERMS OF EMPLOYMENT
This is a full
time position with benefits.

Contrato Indefinido/ Permanent contract

You must be able to provide documentation that proves authorization to work in Spain upon hire.

Gross Base Salary
28,000,
Euros per year.

BENEFITS:

Work in an international, dynamic and passionate environment with a great company culture.

Join a growing and stable international Company.

Competitive salary and quarterly bonus based on performance.

Additional compensation supplement for European languages spoken at a high level.

Office locate

title: Data Analyst
description:
About Remote

Remote is solving global remote organizations’ biggest challenge: employing anyone anywhere compliantly. We make it possible for businesses big and small to employ a global team by handling global payroll, benefits, taxes, and compliance. Check out remote.com/how-it-works to learn more or if you’re interested in adding to the mission, scroll down to apply now.

Please take a look at to learn more about our culture and what it is like to work here. Not only do we encourage folks from all ethnic groups, genders, sexuality, age and abilities to apply, but we prioritize a sense of belonging . You can check out independent reviews by other candidates on Glassdoor or look up the results of our candidate surveys to see how others feel about working and interviewing here.

All of our positions are fully remote. You do not have to relocate to join us!
What this job can offer you
• Data Exploration & Quality: contribute to a culture of higher standards by discovering, documenting... and working towards improving the quality of our data.
• Data Modelling: collaborate with data engineers and other data analysts and contribute to building the modelling layer of our data warehouse.
• Data Analysis: support Operational Analytics team by creating an ad hoc data reports and dashboards.
• Collaboration: collect requests from stakeholders and translate them into meaningful data. Collaborate with data engineers and other data analysts to create high-quality reports.

Our current core data stack (among other tools) contains Metabase, Retool, dbt, Redshift, Meltano, Airflow and GitLab.
What you bring
• experience in statistics, data analytics, software engineering or a related field; ideally in a fast-paced environment.
• Strong ability to collaborate and build effective relationships with your colleagues.
• Excellent communication skills and ability to document processes for both business and technical audiences.
• A self-starter mentality and the ability to thrive in an unstructured and fast-paced environment.
• Strong experience in SQL and previous experience with dbt.
• Strong experience with Metabase or other data visualisation tools.
• Proficiency with Git.
• It's not required to have experience working remotely, but considered as a plus.
Practicals
• You'll report to: Manager, Data Analytics
• Team: Data
• Location : For this position we welcome everyone to apply, but we will prioritise applications from the following locations as we encourage our teams to diversify; Argentina, South-Korea, New-Zealand
• Start date: As soon as possible
Remote Compensation Philosophy
Application process
• Interview with recruiter
• Interview with future manager
• Async exercise stage
• Interview with team members (no managers present)
• Prior employment verification check (Read more at remote.com/employment-checks )

Benefits

Our full benefits & perks are explained in our handbook at remote.com/r/benefits . As a global company, each country works differently, but some benefits are for all Remoters:
• unlimited personal time off (minimum 4 weeks)
• flexible working hours (we are async )
• 16 weeks paid parental leave
• mental health support services
• stock options
• learning budget
• home office budget & IT equipment
How you’ll plan your day (and life)

We work async at Remote which means you can plan your schedule around your life (and not around meetings). Read more at remote.com/async .

You will be empowered to take ownership and be proactive. When in doubt you will default to action instead of waiting. Your life-work balance is important and you will be encouraged to put yourself and your family first, and fit work around your needs.

If that sounds like something you want, apply now!
How to apply
• Please fill out the form below and upload your CV with a PDF format.
• We kindly ask you to submit your application and CV in English, as this is the standardised language we use here at Remote.
• If you don’t have an up to date CV but you are still interested in talking to us, please feel free to add a copy of your LinkedIn profile instead.

We will ask you to voluntarily tell us your pronouns at interview stage, and you will have the option to answer our anonymous demographic questionnaire when you apply below. As an equal employment opportunity employer it’s important to us that our workforce reflects people of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences and this data will help us to stay accountable. We thank you for providing this data, if you chose to

reduce_description: to fortune 500's, we help information systems 5+ years of with salary: $4000 - $6000 $4000 - $6000 usd per
title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
Company Overview:

Blue Orange Digital is a cloud-based data transformation and predictive analytics development firm with offices in NYC and Washington, DC. From startups to Fortune 500's, we help companies make sense of their business challenges by applying modern data analytics techniques, visualizations, and AI/ML. Founded by engineers, we love passionate technologists and data analysts. Our startup DNA means everyone on the team makes a direct contribution to the growth of the company.

Position Overview:

Blue Orange Digital is looking for a Business Analyst to join our multi-disciplinary team to help drive the success of client projects. Success in this role will require someone that can not just analyze data, but understand and communicate the business context of that analysis to a range of stakeholders. We are looking for a candidate who is not just data-driven but is data-obsessed. Our teams build modern data platforms for our clients and help drive value through the... delivery of business intelligence and advanced analytics.
The Business Analyst role is a critical part of the ability to deliver high-value analytics for our clients. The ideal candidate is someone who is relentless at asking the questions needed to drive a project scope to a refined and actionable set of requirements. This person should be comfortable collaborating with technical team members as well as business stakeholders.

Job Responsibilities:
• Demonstrate strong multitasking abilities by efficiently working across multiple clients, effectively prioritizing and executing on competing priorities to meet deadlines and deliver high-quality results
• Collaborate with project sponsors to determine project scope and vision
• Create process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team
• Monitor project progress by tracking activity, resolving problems, and recommending actions to ensure timely completion
• Communicate client requirements effectively to technical teams, ensuring successful implementation of solutions
• Ad-hoc data exploration and analysis to uncover valuable insights and develop compelling stories that effectively communicate the value to clients
• Continuously learn and grow, proactively filling knowledge and skill gaps to contribute effectively to the team's success

Job Requirements:
• Bachelor's degree in business administration, finance, or information systems
• 5+ years of related work experience
• Extensive experience in data, including research and analysis processes
• Experience with SQL and Python is a plus
• Ability to work effectively with little oversight, proactively seeking clarity, and making well-informed decisions to drive progress and deliver results
• Experience using business intelligence tools to construct reports and dashboards
• Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with diverse teams
• Ability to identify and work with specific data that will be decisive in strategic business management
• Excellent research skills, with the ability to efficiently and effectively gather information
• Mathematical and statistical skills
• Skills with presentation platforms, spreadsheets, and report creation

Our Benefits Include:
• Fully remote
• Flexible Schedule
• Unlimited Paid Time Off (PTO)
• Paid parental/bereavement leave
• Worldwide recognized clients to build skills for an excellent resume
• Top-notch team to learn and grow with

Salary: $4000 - $6000 USD per month.

Blue Orange Digital is an equal opportunity employer.

Background checks may be required for certain positions/projects

title: QA Automation Engineer
description:
AttackIQ offers the first live remote testing platform that continuously challenges your security assumptions.

We are hiring the best and brightest in all fields. Our culture is simple. As a team we value clarity, speed, and effectiveness. As people we value curiosity, camaraderie, and respect. We have an immediate opening for a Quality Assurance (QA) Automation Engineer.

Summary of Duties:

Create test plans and test cases based on user stories. Execute tests, identify and communicate defects and risks.

As other developers release new features and fixes, it will be your responsibility to iterate the software through automated/manual testing and verify all requirements are met.

You will be responsible for understanding the effects of architectural and design decisions, taking a lead role in the implementation of test and automation frameworks, and directing the technical efforts of other QA engineers.

Responsibilities
• Design, develop, and maintain automation test scripts using... the Python programming language.
• Create and execute automated tests for the UI and API of our web applications.
• Collaborate with development teams to understand system requirements and specifications.
• Work closely with product owners and developers to ensure that automated tests are effective and address key use cases.
• Act as the owner of certain platform components and ensure the quality of their functionality over time.
• Participate in identifying and resolving quality issues in the software development process.
• Manage and maintain the test infrastructure using technologies such as AWS, Docker, Jenkins, Gitlab, and Git.
• Utilize project management tools such as Jira and TestRail to maintain a clear and organized record of tests performed and results obtained.
• Perform performance and security testing as needed.
• Collaborate with the team to continuously improve testing processes and automation practices.

Requirements
• Demonstrable experience in automating web application testing using Pytest/Selenium/Robot Framework/Playwright.
• Strong knowledge and experience in Python programming.
• Experience in managing and maintaining test infrastructure using technologies such as AWS, Docker, Jenkins, Gitlab, and Git.
• Familiarity with project management tools such as Jira and TestRail.
• Ability to work independently and take ownership of assigned components.
• Ability to effectively collaborate with other development team members and share information for growth and continuous improvement.
• Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to identify and resolve issues effectively.
• Strong oral and written communication skills.

$25 - $31 an hour

AttackIQ was founded to bring assurance to security. With years of experience in the cyber-security industry, we saw the rising corporate cost of vulnerability and knew that the approach to IT Security needed to change. The existing protocols were based on too many assumptions, it was now time to give data-driven assurances to this billion dollar industry

title: SAP SECURITY CONSULTANT /REMOTE/ - Hiring Immediately
description:
We are looking for an experienced SAP SECURITY CONSULTANT (REMOTE) to join our dynamic team at Empleos IT Argentina in Buenos Aires.
Growing your career as a Full Time SAP SECURITY CONSULTANT (REMOTE) is an amazing opportunity to develop useful skills.
If you are strong in decision-making, people management and have the right enthusiasm for the job, then apply for the position of SAP SECURITY CONSULTANT (REMOTE) at Empleos IT Argentina today!
• This is a remote position – candidates in any Argentina location will be considered *

At DXC we use the power of technology to deliver mission critical IT services that our customers need to modernize operations and drive innovation across their entire IT estate. We provide services across the Enterprise Technology Stack for business process outsourcing, analytics and engineering, applications, security, cloud, IT outsourcing and modern workplace.

Our DXC account teams advise, create, orchestrate, and drive value for customers by bringing the... best of DXC to our customers. Customers ask us to help them solve their most critical technology needs and we proactively share relevant ideas, insights, and experience to create a plan for addressing those needs.

About this role

DXC Technology is looking for a SAP Security Consultant. The position will be for a global SAP project in 8 countries.

What You’ll Do
• Designing and implementing SAP security roles and authorizations.
• Conducting security assessments and audits to identify vulnerabilities and risks.
• Developing and enforcing security policies and procedures.
• Configuring and maintaining user access controls.
• Troubleshooting security-related issues and providing resolution.
• Conducting user training and awareness programs on SAP security best practices.

Who you are

Candidates for this role must have:
• 5 years knowledge in SAP security

English proficiency, spoken and written (required).

Education: Bachelor's degree in Technology or related field.

Shift: Monday to Friday – 9 AM to 18 hs.

100% remote position.

DXC offers a great benefits package! DXC Argentina has a new benefit for our employees.

As of April 2023, DXC Argentina offers partial payment in US dollars.

Our 100% remote work model is valid for the entire Argentine territory, which means you'll have the flexibility to work from anywhere you want.

Additionally, we offer reimbursement for teleworking expenses to help you create the perfect work-from-home environment.

We know how important a comfortable chair and ergonomic elements are, so we provide an entry bonus for purchasing these.

If you speak a second language, we have a surprise! We pay you an additional amount for your language skills.

We also have a certification plan per role to help you develop your skills and a program of discounts in educational institutions.

Are you studying? Great! We offer 20 days a year for you to take your university exams.

Additionally, we have a private medical insurance plan for you and your family group with premium options, as well as a complementary life insurance plan of 24 salaries.

Our Wellness Program and Employee Assistance Program (PAE) on legal, emotional, and financial issues ensure that we take care of your physical and emotional well-being.

If you like to maintain a healthy lifestyle, our program of healthy conferences, workshops, and discounts is for you.

If you enjoy physical activity, we offer you GYMPASS.

Do you like to travel? We offer flexible vacations and 3 DXC extra days per year so you can enjoy your days off to the fullest.

And if you're just starting, don't miss our soft-landing and DXC rewards.

Join our team today!

Be part of a great team, and participate in projects around the world, always improving your knowledge and the possibility of making a career in a great company like DXC.

Joining DXC connects you to brilliant people who embrace change and seize opportunities to advance their careers and amplify customer success. At DXC we support each other and work as a team globally and locally. Our achievements demonstrate how we deliver excellence for our customers and colleagues. You will be joining a team that works to create a culture of learning, diversity and inclusion and is dedicated to strong ethics and corporate citizenship.

At DXC we put our people first. In managing COVID-19, our actions are focused on the health, safety and well-being of our colleagues and their families and our approach is to encourage and support masking, testing and vaccination. With our Virtual First strategy the majority of our workforce now works remotely and will continue to do so. We recognize that requirements and availability around masking, testing and vaccination vary by location, and we continue to monitor and conform with government regulations and customer requirements specific to each location.

Benefits of working as a SAP SECURITY CONSULTANT (REMOTE) in Buenos Aires:

● Company offers great benefits
● Continuous Learning Opportunities
● Advantageous package

● Remote Work opportunity

title: Full Stack Software Developer
description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: Argentina

This offer from "HireBoost" has been enriched by Jobgether and got a 77% flex score.

This is a remote position.

Job Description:

We are seeking a skilled Full Stack Software Developer to join our team and take on the responsibility of maintaining our SaaS product. As a Full Stack Developer, you will be working with a diverse tech stack and playing a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operation and continuous improvement of our software.

Responsibilities:
• Maintain and enhance our SaaS product, ensuring its stability, scalability, and overall performance.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including other developers, to gather requirements and implement new features. (3-4 people team)
• Ensure proper testing and quality assurance of the software.
• You will help the CEO to manage and collaborate with the main group of developers in India
• Develop and maintain server-side applications using Python and Django... ensuring clean and efficient code.
• Implement front-end designs using HTML, CSS, and Bootstrap, ensuring a seamless and user-friendly interface.
• Utilize Nginx as the server and Ubuntu as the operating system to optimize the performance and security of the software.
• Integrate and utilize various APIs such as Amazon SES, Gmail, Outlook, and Stripe to enhance product functionality and user experience.
• Deploy and manage the application on AWS, ensuring high availability and scalability.
• Perform code reviews, identify and fix bugs, and maintain proper documentation throughout the development process.
• Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies, recommending improvements to the tech stack and development processes.

Requirements
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
• 3+ years of proven experience as a Full Stack Developer, with a focus on maintaining and enhancing SaaS products.
• Strong proficiency in Python and Django for backend development.
• Solid understanding of front-end technologies, including HTML, CSS, and Bootstrap.
• Experience working with Nginx as a server and Ubuntu as an operating system.
• Familiarity with design tools such as Figma to effectively translate designs into functional user interfaces.
• Knowledge and experience in integrating and utilizing APIs, including Amazon SES, Gmail, Outlook, and Stripe.
• Previous experience with AWS for hosting and deployment.
• Ability to write clean, efficient, and well-documented code.
• Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
• Note: The developer is expected to have familiarity with the majority of the tech stack mentioned above.

If you are a passionate Full Stack Developer looking for an exciting opportunity to contribute to a growing SaaS product, we would love to hear from you. Join our team and help us shape the future of our software!

Benefits
• $2500 USD per month
• 100% remote from any country in Latin America
• Vacations (same as in your country)
• Holidays (same as in your country

title: Full-Stack Developer (Ruby on Rails / Javascript) LATAM
description:
Who we are

FullStackRemote is a network of expert-level remote workers around the globe. We specialize in offering top-tier software engineering talent along with product, digital marketing, sales, and operations support. We work with startups and small to medium-sized businesses that create game-changing products to solve fun challenges.

We help connect you to your ideal remote job and to work alongside other smart people. We believe in transparency and we seek people with ambition who are team players, collaborative, and who care more about building stellar products that impact the world than just a job.

Project Description

Our client, a fast-growing remote-first software-as-a-service company that builds web & mobile software for the property inspection industry, is looking for a Sr. Full-Stack Developer (Ruby on Rails/JavaScript) to be part of a small but rapidly growing team with big ambitions.

The platform helps home inspectors work more efficiently, allows agents to... streamline the inspection process, and empowers homebuyers to make better decisions.
This is the kind of company where you can rapidly accelerate your career if you have what it takes! A team of energetic, positive, and motivated individuals with track records of building successful companies. Good communication is highly valued, staying grounded, and taking care of everyone holistically. The company doubled in size (or more!) each of the past 3 years and just on the ground floor of where it will go.

Work-life balance: Our client believes in balance. They encourage walks, breaks, and exercise to break up the day. They typically work a 40-45 hours work week, with the occasional push depending on the sprint. They realize it's a marathon and not a sprint, so they don't think working to the point of burnout is a good practice.
Communication: Via Slack and Zoom chats, encouraging real relationships to be built.

Role & Responsibilities

Are you looking for a small but fast-growing team where you can make a large impact? Are you a driven self-starter wanting to focus on building great products with modern technology? Are you a great communicator that values a positive, healthy, and energizing company culture? We might be what you're looking for!

Work With Modern Tech: You'll love working in the tech stack, pushing modern tool adoption such as Flutter for mobile, Firebase for real-time syncing, and Vue for rapid web app creation. Using the Serverless framework and Lambdas to offload jobs, and create a more flexible and scalable microservice architecture. Join this amazing team to grow your skillset and help push their tech into the future of SaaS.

Our client is looking for a Senior Developer that can:
- Communicate well - internally and with customers, written and verbal
- Is self-motivated and eager to produce results
- Can rapidly task-switch between deep work building the next big feature and helping the Client Success team debug an issue
- Immediately get productive in the tech stack, which includes Ruby on Rails, Vue.js, Firebase, Google Cloud Functions, Postgres, Flutter, Heroku, AWS (S3, Cloudfront, & Lambda), Express, and jQuery.

Requirements

Must have:
• At least 5 years of professional experience with Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, VueJS, Express and Firebase,
• At least 3 years of professional experience with Google Cloud Functions, AWS (S3, Cloudfront & Lambda), Heroku, and Flutter.
• At least 5 years of professional experience with Postgres (PostgreSQL) and JQuery
• Advanced level of English and ability to communicate concepts clearly to clients.

Nice to have
• Previous experience with US companies is a plus
• Agile methodologies experience

Location

LATAM (Latin America) only.

Benefits
• Unlimited vacation policy, encouraging team members to take time off as needed to recharge. In practice, most team members take a week or two of vacation and occasional sick days or personal days as needed. Our client is a hard-working team that doesn't take off a lot of minor holidays.
• Work stipend

Testing

At FullStackRemote, we require that you go through a short coding assessment prior to our interview process. We prepared a tailored test for this role, and you will have enough time to complete it (2 hours maximum)

Type of Position
• Full-time role. Fully remote

Compensation

Salary is dependent on experience and abilities: Between $90.000/110.000 USD

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
About the Company:

OneSeven is a US-based product development studio building apps for industry-changing startups and enterprises. We love building digital products and helping companies succeed in their market. Working at OneSeven is a great opportunity to test your skills, build new skills, and be an early employee at a growing startup. We are a fully remote workforce with headquarters in Tampa Bay, Florida, and employees all around the world. Our services cover the spectrum for startups so we can help them plan, design, build, and support high-quality digital products.

Our founder, James, started OneSeven over five years ago after his experience hiring an offshore agency for his pre-seed Ed-Tech startup. The project was unsuccessful due to communication issues, conflicting time zones, and scope creep. Since then, he built OneSeven and tailored our services to support startup founders in need of high-quality software development.

The role: We are looking for a great Fullstack... developer who is proficient with React/Node.js/Typescript/AWS/PostgreSQL. Your primary focus will be on developing user interface components and implementing them following well-known React workflows (such as Flux or Redux). You will ensure that these components and the overall application are robust and easy to maintain. You will coordinate with the rest of the team working on different layers of the infrastructure. Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem-solving, sophisticated design, and quality product is important.

About You:
• Fluent in English (B2-C2 level is required)
• 2-5 years of experience building B2B/B2C software.
• Excellent code practices
• Excellent communication skills
• Strong mentoring and code review skills
• Agile + Scrum Methodology experience
• Ability to quickly adapt, learn, and problem solve
• Team player, willing to jump outside of their role to help the greater team.
• Ability to research as you work.
• Clear written communication, and the ability to quickly identify and share important discoveries and problems in your work with others on the team.
• Opinions about backend approaches and architecture, and a readiness to share them without being dogmatic.
• The ability to be accountable for your own time in a fully remote environment.
• The desire to contribute to a growing, dynamic team and help shape process, practice and operations.
• Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements
• We work in two-week sprints and monthly feature releases.
• The ability to follow common Agile practices (daily async standups, sprint groomings and retros). We’re always looking to improve on how we function as a team.

Role and Responsibilities:
• Building reusable components and front-end libraries for future use.
• Developing new user-facing features using React.js.
• Translating designs and wireframes into high-quality code.
• Optimizing components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers
• Familiarity with RESTful APIs
• Familiarity with newer specifications of EcmaScript
• 3+ years of experience with frontend libraries like React or React Native for mobile
• GIT + Github Experience
• Experience with Google Firebase is a must.
• Experience with typescript.
• Experience with PostgreSQL is preferred.
• Experience working with Docker is preferred.
• Experience with AWS is preferred.
• Experience with Node.js is preferred.
• Thorough understanding of React.js and its core principles.
• Knowledge of modern authorization mechanisms, such as JSON Web Token

Benefits/Compensation:
• Completely remote work as long as you can work between 9 am-5 pm EST
• Contract-based employment
• Starting at $2,000 - $4,000 USD - depending on qualifications
• Budget for education
• Christmas Bonus
• Unlimited PTO
• There are currently NO formal benefits packages available (health insurance, retirement plans
