reduce_description: travel for 2 to 4 2 to 4 weeks per up to 4 times a remotely since 2004! personal learning budget of 2,000usd per annum
title: Software Engineer - Data Infrastructure
description:
Canonical is building a comprehensive automation suite to provide multi-cloud and on-premise data solutions for the enterprise. The data platform team is a collaborative team that develops a full range of data stores and data technologies, spanning from big data, through NoSQL, cache-layer capabilities, and analytics; all the way to structured SQL engines.

We are facing the interesting problem of fault-tolerant mission-critical distributed systems and intend to deliver the world's best automation solution for delivering data platforms.

We have a number of openings ranging anywhere from junior to senior level. We will help you identify a suitable position depending on your experience and interests. Engineers who thrive at Canonical are mindful of open-source community dynamics and equally aware of the needs of large, innovative organisations.

Location: This is a Globally remote role

What your day will look like

The data platform team is responsible for the automation of data... platform operations. This includes ensuring fault-tolerant replication, TLS, installation, and much more; but also provides domain-specific expertise on the actual data system to other teams within Canonical.

This role is focused on the creation and automation of features of data platforms, not analysing the data in them.

• Collaborate proactively with a distributed team

• Write high-quality, idiomatic Python code to create new features

• Debug issues and interact with upstream communities publicly

• Work with helpful and talented engineers including experts in many fields

• Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions

• Work from home with global travel for 2 to 4 weeks per year for internal and external events

What we are looking for in you

• Proven hands-on experience in software development using Python

• Proven hands-on experience in distributed systems

• Have a Bachelor’s or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM, or a similar degree

• Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events

Additional skills that you might also bring

You might also bring a subset of experience from the following, which will determine the exact role and level we consider you for:

• Experience operating and managing data platform technologies like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, OpenSearch, Kafka, Yugabyte, Trino, Superset, Atlas, Ranger, and Redis

• Experience with Linux systems administration, package management, and operations

• Experience with the public cloud or a private cloud solution like OpenStack

• Experience with operating Kubernetes clusters and a belief that it can be used for serious persistent data services

What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation.

Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner.

• Fully remote working environment - we’ve been working remotely since 2004!

• Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum

• Annual compensation review

• Recognition rewards

• Annual holiday leave

• Parental Leave

• Employee Assistance Programme

• Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at ‘sprints’

• Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis.

We recruit on a global basis and set a

title: Ingeniero de Datos
description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: South America, Colombia, Argentina, Mexico

This offer from "Turing" has been enriched by Jobgether and got a 81.5% flex score.

Un motor de colaboración de datos con sede en EE. UU. que está ayudando a empresas y negocios a administrar sus conjuntos de datos a través de la API de Python, el catálogo web y el back-end en S3, está buscando un ingeniero de datos. El ingeniero seleccionado para este trabajo remoto será responsable de ayudar a la empresa a exponer su visión, desarrollando y manteniendo de manera efectiva sistemas/canales de datos para agilizar los esfuerzos de ingeniería e impulsar el crecimiento de la empresa. La empresa ayuda a las empresas a transformar datos dispersos y sin etiquetar en conjuntos de datos detectables y reproducibles en la nube. Esta empresa ha recaudado con éxito más de 4 millones de dólares en fondos semilla.

Responsabilidades:
• Evaluar los objetivos de la empresa y las necesidades comerciales... para construir sistemas de datos y canalizaciones
• Analizar y organizar datos para preparar informes
• Trabajar en datos preparados por modelos en estilos prescriptivos y predictivos
• Crear algoritmos y prototipos sostenibles
• Colaborar con el equipo interno, los científicos de datos y los arquitectos para lograr los objetivos de la empresa

Requerimientos:
• Licenciatura / Maestría en Ingeniería, Ciencias de la Computación (o experiencia equivalente)
• Al menos más de 3 años de experiencia relevante como ingeniero de datos
• Competente con Java, Python y Groovy
• Buen dominio de la comunicación en inglés oral y escrita

• Colaborar con el equipo interno, los científicos de datos y los arquitectos para lograr los objetivos de la empresa

Requerimientos:
• Licenciatura / Maestría en Ingeniería, Ciencias de la Computación (o experiencia equivalente)
• Al menos más de 3 años de experiencia relevante como ingeniero de datos
• Competente con Java, Python y Groovy
• Buen dominio de la comunicación en inglés oral y escrita']}]

title: Senior SEO Specialist - 14102062432
description:
🌎Fully remote, Only for LATAM ‼️

Position: Sr SEO Specialist

Working Hours: 9 am to 6 pm (Local Time Zone)

Salary Range: 1500 - 2000 USD

Type of Contract: Independent Contractor

Support Shepherd, is a headhunter agency hiring talented people across Latam for international clients!🚀

About the Company

A top-tier marketing agency that specializes in comprehensive marketing solutions. Our core belief is that rapid business expansion necessitates agile marketing strategies. We specialize in online marketing services catered to companies seeking to enhance their digital footprint and fuel their growth. Our expertise lies in maximizing tangible business results by employing effective search engine optimization, social media marketing, conversion rate optimization, and analytics. By partnering with us, you can expect customized approaches, prompt responses to your queries, and a wealth of industry knowledge and expertise.

Scope of the Role

As the Senior SEO Specialist, you will be... a vital member of our team, responsible for developing and implementing cutting-edge SEO strategies to drive organic traffic and improve online visibility for our diverse range of clients. Your expertise will be instrumental in analyzing performance data, executing SEO campaigns, and keeping abreast of the dynamic SEO landscape. By collaborating with other marketing team members, you will contribute to achieving our clients' digital marketing goals.

Duties and responsibilities:
• Strategy Development: Plan, execute, and oversee comprehensive SEO strategies tailored to each client's unique needs and objectives.
• Keyword Research and Competitor Analysis: Conduct in-depth keyword research to identify valuable opportunities and analyze competitor strategies to stay ahead of the competition.
• Performance Monitoring: Regularly monitor and interpret SEO performance metrics to measure the effectiveness of campaigns and make data-driven improvements.
• Collaboration: Collaborate with various marketing team members to ensure alignment of SEO objectives with overall marketing efforts.
• Project Management: Manage both offsite and onsite optimization projects, ensuring tasks are completed on time and within budget. Generate comprehensive performance reports for clients.
• Website Optimization: Oversee all SEO aspects of client websites, from conducting initial audits to ongoing optimization efforts, aiming to enhance organic rankings and user experience.
• Staying Current: Continuously stay updated on the latest SEO and digital marketing trends and best practices, incorporating innovative strategies into our campaigns.
• C1 English level: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively present complex information to stakeholders. (Must Have)
• 5+ years of proven experience as an SEO analyst/specialist or in a similar role or related field. (Must Have)
• In-depth understanding of SEO principles and best practices, with a track record of successful SEO implementations.
• Proficiency in using industry-standard SEO tools and Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMrush, Ahrefs, and/or Moz to analyze data and inform strategy.(Must Have)
• Proven experience in SEO reporting and conducting thorough SEO audits to identify areas for improvement.
• Excellent leadership skills with the ability to lead and mentor a team, coupled with strong organizational capabilities.
• A team-oriented mindset with a proactive approach to problem-solving and collaborative work.
• Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, information systems, or a related field is preferred

title: SEO Manager - 0087 - ARG
description:
About the client:

Our client is based in Florida, USA, and running a digital marketing agency and looking for an experienced SEO strategist to plan and execute organic growth strategies for a set of clients.

The client is mostly handling local service businesses seeking growth with Local SEO.

Our client has a policy of “no jerks” for both clients and team members and is looking to grow its client-servicing team with exceptional super-stars who are passionate about what they do and have the right attitude.

About the role:

We are looking for a result-driven SEO specialist responsible for delivering organic results for clients. The ideal candidate should have strong fundamental knowledge about SEO, local SEO, technical SEO techniques, content strategy, and a commitment to constantly improving key skills.

The SEO specialist’s responsibilities include working closely with the client servicing team to achieve SEO objectives, measuring SEO success, and informing the website's... architecture to ensure compliance with all the best practices and, ultimately, results.

We believe the right candidate is responsible, caring, pragmatic, and communicative (we consider these qualities necessary for success in the role).

The right candidate has a “happy to help“ attitude. We also hope that you sincerely believe that we work better together than alone – and that you can work in a cross-disciplinary team even if you do not physically meet.

What you’ll be doing:
• This role requires a deep level of knowledge of SEO, which includes overall SEO fundamentals, Local SEO, WordPress, On-Page SEO, and Technical SEO
• Strong understanding of search engine optimization (SEO) best practices and techniques
• Working on optimizing client websites and Google Business Profiles to rank higher in search results (maps, local pack, SERPs).
• Working on generating new client leads via Local SEO and conversion rate optimization.
• Maintaining client websites based on client requests (updating plugins, publishing content, editing pages, etc.).
• Ability to handle several accounts independently and demonstrate skills in internal linking, on-page optimization, and report analytics
• Experience creating and implementing SEO strategies
• Basic understanding of web development, including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
• Proven experience working with criminal defense attorney websites or other sensitive topics
• Strong written and verbal communication skills
• Strong understanding of SEO Algorithms and how search engines rank website
• Knowledge of SEMrush, Ahrefs, Google Search Console, Google Analytics, Google Keyword Planner, and other popular SEO Tools

Who are we looking for?
• 3+ years of proven experience in successfully developing and executing Local SEO campaigns
• Highly organized and detail-oriented, but you don’t get stopped by the details
• Extremely flexible and adaptable
• Great with moving parts and multiple balls in the air. Doesn’t drop the ball
• Good critical thinking and problem-solving skills
• Knowledge of Local SEO, technical SEO, and search engine ranking factors
• Notice errors, glitches, and things that may fall through the cracks
• Hands-on experience with SEO tools such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SemRush or Ahrefs, and WordPress

Position: SEO Specialist

Remote Status: Fully Remote

Preferred Location: Global

Working Hours: 9 am to 6 pm EST

Holidays: 20 PTO days per year (Can be used for US or local holidays, etc., accumulating over the year.)

Salary: USD 800 to USD 2,000 per month

Internal Job ID: 0087

title: Senior Mobile Developer
description:
Time zones: EST (UTC -5) CST (UTC -6) MST (UTC -7) PST (UTC -8) ART (UTC -3) UTC -4 UTC -4:30 UTC -3 UTC -2 SBT (UTC +11) GMT (UTC +0) CET (UTC +1) EET (UTC +2) MSK (UTC +3) AST (UTC -4) FKST (UTC -3) NST (UTC -3:30)

Get a remote job that you will love with better compensation and career growth.

We’re Lemon.io — a marketplace where we match you with hand-picked startups from the US and Europe.
Why work with us:
• We’ll find you a team that respects you. No time-trackers or any micromanagement stuff
• Our engineers earn $4k - $8k / month. We’ve already paid out over $10M.
• Choose your schedule. We have both full- and part-time projects.
• No project managers in the middle — only direct communications with clients, most of whom have a technical background
• Our customer success team provides life support to help you resolve anything.
• You don’t have to look for clients and or negotiate anymore: just do what you do best and leave us the rest.
Requirements:
• Fluent with mobile... software development (4+ years of exp)
• 2+ years of development experience with Android (Kotlin) development or with iOS (Swift and Swift UI)
• Solid understanding of the full mobile development life cycle
• Experience in publishing apps in the app store/play market
• Experience with cloud providers such as AWS/GCP/Azure is benefitial
• Good command of English, both written and spoken, as you’ll be communicating with clients directly
• Strong organizational skills — ability to work full-time remotely with no supervision
• Responsibility — we want to trust you
• Soft skills — we don’t ask you to find a topic for a small talk, but being just polite is OK

Apply today, and our team will get back to you within 2 business days!
Recruitment process:

First step: VideoAsk (about 10 minutes)

Second step: 30 minutes Screening call with our Recruiters

Third step: Technical Interview with our Developers

Feedback

Magic Box (we are looking for best project for you

reduce_description: working hours: 9 am to am to 6 pm est est holidays: 20 pto days salary: usd 1,000 to usd to usd 1,500 per month job id: 0088 anywhere
title: Facebook Ads Specialist - 0088 - ARG
description:
About the client:

Our client is based in Florida, USA, and running a digital marketing agency and looking for an experienced SEO strategist to plan and execute organic growth strategies for a set of clients.

The client is mostly handling local service businesses seeking growth with Local SEO.

Our client has a policy of “no jerks” for both clients and team members and is looking to grow its client-servicing team with exceptional super-stars who are passionate about what they do and have the right attitude.

About the role:

We are on the lookout for a driven, proactive Facebook Ads Specialist to join our dynamic team. This is a fantastic opportunity to become a part of our digital agency where we empower local service businesses, such as plumbing, HVAC, and painting contractors, to reach new heights. If you thrive in fast-paced environments, are passionate about driving business growth through Facebook advertising, and have a knack for crafting compelling ad strategies that engage... we want to hear from you!

What you’ll be doing:
• Designing, implementing and managing end-to-end Facebook ad campaigns for our clients in the local service industry.
• Analyzing campaign results and optimizing strategies to ensure maximum ROI.
• Conducting detailed audience research to target potential customers effectively.
• Crafting engaging ad copies and coordinating with our graphic design team for ad creatives.
• Collaborating with our sales and customer success teams to align ad strategies with business goals.
• Monitoring budget and adjusting bids to gain better ROI.
• Staying current with Facebook advertising policies, industry trends, and best practices to ensure the success of our campaigns.
• Reporting on campaign performance to clients and internal teams regularly.

Who are we looking for?
• Proven experience as a Facebook Ads Specialist, preferably in the local service industry.
• Excellent understanding of Facebook's advertising platform and experience managing ad budgets.
• Exceptional analytical skills and experience with reporting and data analysis.
• Proficient in crafting engaging ad copies and driving customer engagement.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse teams.
• Familiarity with the latest trends, technologies and methodologies in digital marketing, social media, web analytics, and industry best practices.
• Please note: A proven track record of success in managing Facebook ad campaigns for local service businesses is a must for this role.

Position: Facebook Ads Specialist

Remote Status: Fully Remote

Preferred Location: Global

Working Hours: 9 am to 6 pm EST

Holidays: 20 PTO days per year (Can be used for US or local holidays, etc., accumulating over the year.)

Salary: USD 1,000 to USD 1,500 per month

Internal Job ID: 0088

title: Freelance Job: Looking for a digital marketer for Facebook Ads for...
description:
I need a digital marketing expert who does Facebook Ads and join our company. We will pay you monthly for each client you service from our end managing the adverts, creating campaigns and setting up creatives (which we will help with). This includes a 20 minute setup call with each client however all details will be provided to use and other than this there is no other meetings required.

We are currently looking at providing £125-200/month per client which will require only a few hours of servicing a month. For example if you are servicing 10 clients with our company you will earn £1250/month! We will pay you more the longer you are with us as you become more experienced with dealing with our clients.

We require to see proof of results from past marketing campaigns and require a suitability meeting to see if you are the right person for the job. We want to provide a human relationship with our clients, like a family.

You must answer the short interview questions on this listing.

reduce_description: two ways: 1) team augmentation: daily basis. 2) design & looking for 3+ years of not required. 3+ years of development experience. 5+ years preferred consistently work 40 hours per
title: Ruby on Rails Engineer - Remote, Full-Time
description:
Are you an experienced software engineer with deep experience in building and shipping amazing products? Do you have high standards when it comes to code quality and user experiences? Are you the best developer on your team? Are you ready to work alongside the best engineers in the world for name-brand, industry-leading companies?

Bluelight Consulting is seeking a Ruby on Rails developer to join its growing team.

As an engineer at Bluelight Consulting you will help our incredible clients achieve their technical goals in one of two ways: 1) Team Augmentation: You will integrate yourself directly into our client’s team and work alongside their existing engineers on a daily basis. 2) Design & Build: You will work on a Bluelight Consulting development team to build and ship greenfield applications for our clients.

What We Are Looking For
• 3+ years of professional software development experience. 5+ years preferred but not required.
• 3+ years of professional experience working with... Ruby on Rails
• Meaningful experience working on large, complex systems.
• A four-year college degree is required.
• Ability to take extreme ownership over your work. Every day is a challenge to ensure you are performing to the expectations you and your team have agreed upon, both regarding estimates and the general process.
• Ability to identify with Bluelight's clients' goals and dedicate yourself to delivering on the commitments you and your team make to them.
• An understanding of best practices and a commitment to following them.
• Ability to work through new and difficult issues and contribute to libraries as needed.
• Ability to create and maintain continuous integration and delivery of applications.
• A positive mindset and can-do attitude.
• Forensic attention to detail.
• You're passionate about software development... it's not just your career, it's your hobby. You're constantly striving to learn new things and improve. You follow industry news, regularly tinker with new technologies, and read books and blogs to keep your skills current.
• Ability to consistently work 40 hours per week.

What You'll Be Doing
• Work as part of a small team, which will include other developers, a project manager, a QA professional, and a designer.
• Complete two-week sprints, participate in sprint retrospectives, and daily standups.
• Assist with building estimates.
• Interface with clients via Slack, Zoom, and email.
• Track your time throughout the day using Toggl.
• Work with modern tools including Jira, Slack, GitHub, Google Docs, etc.
• Be part of a community of developers that share knowledge and help each other as problems arise.
• Follow Bluelight's detailed development process.

Company Benefits
• Competitive salary and bonuses, including performance-based salary increases.
• Generous paid-time-off policy
• Technology / Office stipend
• Health Coverage
• Flexible working hours
• Work remotely
• Continuing education, training, conferences
• Company-sponsored coursework, exams, and certifications

Being a software consultant is a fun, challenging, and rewarding career choice for engineers. Your contributions are highly valued by clients, and the work you do often has a direct and significant impact on the client’s business.

You will have the chance to work on a variety of projects for our incredible clients, which will help you quickly improve as a consultant and software engineer. You will get to work with modern languages and frameworks alongside some of the best developers in the world!

So if you have the desire to be a part of an exciting, challenging, rapidly-growing software consultancy, please apply. #LI-Remote

reduce_description: *requirements**: - 6+ years of software development: 6 years (preferred) development. - 3+ years of on rails: 3 years (preferred) you: - 100% remote. - resumes._ *salary**: $5.00 - $5.01 $5.00 - $5.01 per month
title: Sr. Ruby On Rails Developer Remote
description:
If you want to make more of an impact with your work, bring in a product team with other talented product engineers, managers, and designers. Where on a day-to-day basis, you'll be collaborating with your engineering teammates helping to design and implement solutions that add value, carriers, and market dynamics with above-market benefits, perhaps this could be for you.

You'll likely gravitate to one area or specialty in the backend, but you'll be excited to learn and deepen your skill set in other areas growing quickly professionally within the company.

You will be working on different cross-functional teams on an agile-oriented VC-backed startup.
• *Requirements**:

- 6+ years of experience in software development.
- 3+ years of experience in Ruby or Ruby On Rails.
- Experience working in agile software development teams.
- Experience working in a product startup company.
- Full-time availability.
- Professional English Level.

Nice to Have:

- Experience designing and building... Rest APIs.
- Self-learning and proactive.

We offer you:

- 100% Remote.
- Welcome Kit.
- Medical Insurance.
- Continuous learning support from different courses and platforms.

If you are interested to be part of the next great global startup to contact us. Any queries please feel free to ask.
- We accept only English Resumes._
• *Salary**: $5.00 - $5.01 per month
• *Experience**:

- Ruby on Rails: 3 years (preferred)
- Software Development: 6 years (preferred)
• *Language**:

- Inglés (required

title: Fullstack Developer /Ruby on Rails/ - Hiring Fast
description:
We are desiring to recruit a focused Fullstack Developer (Ruby on Rails) to join our amazing team at OneSeven Technology (formerly 17 Web Dev) in Argentina.
Growing your career as a Full Time Fullstack Developer (Ruby on Rails) is an amazing opportunity to develop exceptional skills.
If you are strong in planning, attention to detail and have the right drive for the job, then apply for the position of Fullstack Developer (Ruby on Rails) at OneSeven Technology (formerly 17 Web Dev) today!

About the Company:

OneSeven is a US-based product development studio building apps for industry-changing startups and enterprises. We love building digital products and helping companies succeed in their market. Working at OneSeven is a great opportunity to test your skills, build new skills, and be an early employee at a growing startup. We are a fully remote workforce with headquarters in Tampa Bay, Florida, and employees all around the world. Our services cover the spectrum for startups so we can... help them plan, design, build, and support high-quality digital products.

Our founder, James, started OneSeven over six years ago after his experience hiring an offshore agency for his pre-seed Ed-Tech startup. The project was unsuccessful due to communication issues, conflicting time zones, and scope creep. Since then, he built OneSeven and tailored our services to support startup founders in need of high-quality software development.

The role: We are looking for a seasoned Fullstack Ruby on Rails developer to join our development team. We are a competitive agency that is looking for great talent in order to build even better products for our clients. You will be working within our development team to contribute to clients' web and mobile applications.

About You:
• Fluent in English (important)
• 2-5 years of experience building B2B/B2C software.
• Excellent code practices
• Excellent communication skills
• Strong mentoring and code review skills
• Agile + Scrum Methodology experience
• Ability to quickly adapt, learn, and problem solve
• Team player, willing to jump outside of their role to help the greater team.
• Ability to research as you work.
• Clear written communication, and the ability to quickly identify and share important discoveries and problems in your work with others on the team.
• Opinions about backend approaches and architecture, and a readiness to share them without being dogmatic.
• The ability to be accountable for your own time in a fully remote environment.
• The desire to contribute to a growing, dynamic team and help shape processes, practice, and operations.
• We work in two-week sprints and 1 month feature releases.
• The ability to follow common Agile practices (daily async standups, sprint groomings, and retros). We’re always looking to improve how we function as a team.
• You will need to provide your own workspace with reliable Internet service.

Roles and Responsibilities:
• Develop and deploy Ruby on Rails (monolith) backend code with our web and mobile applications. You'll be working closely to other fullstack developers.
• Share knowledge of the best software development practices
• Experience Ruby on Rails 6.1 or newer.
• Expertise writing and integrating REST API’s
• GIT + Github Experience
• Experience working with Linux OS is a must.
• Experience with mySQL is a must.
• Experience with PostgreSQL is preferred.
• Experience working with Docker is preferred.
• Experience with Terraform is preferred.
• Experience with unit testing (rspec) is preferred.
• Experience with AWS is preferred.
• Experience with CI/CD
• Thorough understanding of React.js and its core principles.
• Experience with typescript is required
• Experience with Material UI is required
• Knowledge of modern authorization mechanisms, such as JSON Web Token

Benefits/Compensation:
• Completely remote work
• Contract-based employment
• Starting at $2,000 - $4,000 USD - depending on qualifications
• Budget for Education
• Unlimited PTO
• There are currently NO formal benefits packages available (health insurance, retirement plans).

Benefits of working as a Fullstack Developer (Ruby on Rails) in Argentina:

● Company offers great benefits
● Opportunities to grow
● Attractive packageCompetitive Pay

● Remote Work opportunity

title: Data Analyst Home Office
description:
JOB DUCK IS HIRING A DATA ANALYST

Job Duck is a virtual staffing company that matches candidates to work from home for a single U.S.-based business, in most cases a law firm.

The data analyst works with the company to turn data into actionable information, that will give the insights needed to make wise business decisions. The Data Analyst will be responsible for developing analytical reports and dashboards, and for conducting a comprehensive life-cycle analysis to cover requirements, activities, and design. Moreover, the ideal candidate ensures that the necessary data is collected by various departments in order to monitor performance and develop quality control plans.

The starting salary is USD 900 per month.

Duties and responsibilities will include, but are not limited to the following:
- Serving as the SME for your assigned department
- Designing, creating, maintaining, documenting, and testing reports, dashboards, and KPIs
- Analyzing data using statistical techniques and... providing reports
- Identifying gaps and inconsistencies in data collection systems and datasets
- Acquiring and preparing data from primary and secondary sources while maintaining data integrity
- Identifying and interpreting trends or patterns in complex datasets
- Filtering and cleaning data
- Working with your team lead to locate and define new process improvement opportunities
- Ensuring proper adherence to Data Governance Policies

Requirements
- Experience with Excel, Google Sheets, and dashboard creation.
?Advanced or native-level English skills (written and spoken)
- At least 1 year of Data Analysis work experience.
- Any of the following professional certifications: CompTIA Data+, Google Data Analytics Professional Certificate, Power BI Data Analyst is required
- A related degree or diploma is preferred.
- Familiarity with SQL, Python, and JavaScript.
- Your own reliable and updated PC, a headset, and good internet speed(at least 30mb/s).

The schedule is as follows:
Monday to Friday from 8:30 am EST/EDT to 5:30 pm EST/EDT
• On the application form, Please select ?Data Analyst? from the drop menu titled "What position are you applying for?".

We encourage you to apply now! Are you looking for a work-life balance and a Great Place to Work (we?re certified!)? Duck for it!
Every candidate has to pass each step in our application process to become part of our team

title: Strategy & Insights Analyst
description:
At Aprende Institute, we are looking for a passionate analyst to join our Strategy and Insights Team. The successful candidate will work closely with different teams in the organization to deliver insights that drive engagement, profitability and growth. If you have strong analytical skills and enjoy working with different teams, this is the position for you!

Responsible for: • Data Collection and Processing:
• Gather relevant data from various sources and ensure its accuracy and completeness
• Perform data quality checks to identify and resolve inconsistencies or errors

• Dashboard Creation and Visualization:
• Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their requirements and design effective dashboards and visualizations.
• Utilize data visualization tools to create visually appealing and interactive dashboards.
• Present data in a meaningful and concise manner, highlighting key insights and trends.
• Ensure the accessibility and usability of dashboards for non-technical... users.

• Data Analysis and Interpretation:
• Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify patterns, correlations, and trends.
• Interpret analysis results and communicate findings to stakeholders
• Provide recommendations based on data-driven insights

Requirements

• A bachelor's degree in a field such as data science, statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related
• 2 or more years of related full time work experience
• Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools like Quicksight, Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.
• Solid understanding of data manipulation and analysis using programming languages such as SQL, Python or R.
• Familiarity with data cleaning, transformation, and preprocessing techniques.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to extract insights from complex data sets.
• Ability to design and create effective dashboards and visualizations that convey information clearly and intuitively.
• Understanding of data visualization best practices, such as appropriate chart selection, color coding, and layout.
• Good verbal and written communication skills to effectively convey insights and recommendations to stakeholders.
• Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and understand their data requirements.

Aprende Institute, the leading online education platform for vocational abilities in Latin America and the United States' Hispanic market, offers a wide array of online training and courses, allowing its growing community of 30,000 students to acquire high-demand skills. These skills empower learners to transform their interests into income by starting a new business or a new career. Aprende integrates technology and digital media with traditional instructor-led classroom activities, giving its students a flexible and personalized learning experience, accessible on any device, that monitors students' progress and encourages engaged learning, skill mastery, and course completion. Furthermore, Aprende's tech platform and tailored content solutions assist corporations training and motivating their workforce and clients with unique experiences.

Benefits

• Salary: USD.
• 15 days as PTO.
• Hybrid: attending twice a week to our offices in Buenos Aires.
• "Travel expenses

reduce_description: washington, dc $50,750 $62,422 annually dc $50,750 $62,422 annually the strategic innovation 3 5 years innovation 3 5 years of savings accounts 403(b) retirement plan, anywhere
title: Data Specialist
description:
Data Specialist, Environmental Investigations Unit
REMOTE – WASHINGTON, DC

$50,750 $62,422 Annually

The Pulitzer Center, a non-profit organization that supports independent global journalism, is seeking an experienced and versatile data specialist for the position of Data Specialist. The successful candidate will join the Environmental Investigations Unit and work closely with our Data Editor and Research Editor.

The Environmental Investigations Unit provides support to grantees and fellows across Pulitzer initiatives, including the Rainforest Investigations (RIN), Ocean Reporting Network (ORN) and Artificial Intelligence Accountability Networks. The first two networks seek to harness investigative reporting and cross-border collaboration to tackle stories at the intersection of climate change, corruption, and governance behind the destruction of our rainforests and marine ecosystems. The AI Accountability Network supports and brings together journalists investigating the impact of... AI with an accountability lens, and journalists seeking to use machine learning to augment their reporting capacity on big data projects. Most reporting projects conducted by journalists in the three networks are data-driven and leverage technical knowledge (such as scraping, data analysis, satellite imagery, API or machine learning) to create real-world impact. You will have the unique opportunity to support, mentor and collaborate with some of the world’s leading investigative journalists, designing and executing their investigation methodologies.

The Data Specialist will work directly with our editors to support fellows and grantees. We are seeking an enterprising and team-oriented professional who will learn from and contribute ideas and skills to the journalists’ projects in different parts of the world (with a focus on, but not limited to, Latin America, the greater Congo Basin, and Southeast Asia) and will work efficiently and collaboratively with diverse media outlets.

We are looking for a creative collaborator to perform technical tasks for journalists, demonstrate tools and train journalists how to use them and to mentor when needed. The person successful in this role will be an agile problem solver willing to support the project from start to finish.

A successful candidate for this position will be a resourceful action-taker who enjoys tackling new problems by knowing where to find solutions and acquiring the necessary knowledge or skills related to the three topics that we work on (rainforest, ocean and artificial intelligence). You are constantly learning and searching out the latest tools and resources, or scoping out and building new ones. You will have opportunities to share your solutions by publishing reporting recipes (toolkits), methodologies or the datasets to contribute to the advancement of investigative journalism. As the networks expand and reporting projects diversify, you will have a voice in shaping your role and responsibilities.
Responsibilities:

Research and support for fellows
• Researching tools and solutions for technical issues.
• Providing one-on-one training to fellows, including meeting regularly to provide advice, help troubleshoot projects’ methodologies, suggest the best technical tools and data, and perform technical tasks like scraping online databases and performing statistical analysis when necessary.
• Building tutorials/documentation for fellows on investigation tools and skills.
• Developing methodologies and documentation that can contribute to advancing data and investigative journalism in environment and AI.

Project management
• Facilitating and coordinating collaboration among fellows of the three initiatives.
• Contributing data and documents to in-house data intelligence platform.
• Coordinating and supervising the work of consultants and staff hired to initiatives aforementioned.
Qualifications:
• Fluency in oral and written English.
• Familiarity with other languages (especially from the regions of Latin America, Africa and Southeast Asia) strongly preferred
• Strong project management skills, experience prioritizing and managing multiple tasks without compromising quality.
• Creative problem-solving and strategic innovation
• 3 – 5 years of experience in journalism or related fields; you don’t have to be a journalist but experience working with journalists or in journalism is a plus, as the position requires:
• A deep knowledge of past journalistic data projects that inform your suggestions and problem solving.
• A good understanding of core journalistic values, including accuracy, independence, and fairness.
• The belief in the power of stories to make complex issues urgent and relevant, and inspire action.
• Strong technical skills, via academic or professional work, including:
• Data analysis with coding (e.g. Python, R)
• Data scraping
• API
• Building new datasets when they are unavailable
• Geospatial analysis (e.g. QGIS, GEE)
• Satellite imagery and mapping
• Designing experiments to learn how algorithms make decisions
• Statistical knowledge (e.g. when analyzing datasets and algorithms)
• Proven experience or familiarity working with data sources related to the environment and AI technologies, including:
• Freedom of Information (FOI) request
• Government procurement data
• Company listings and stock exchange
• Import/export and trade data
• Shipping data (e.g. IMO vessel registration, VMS, AIS)
• Ocean science data (e.g. sea level, temperature, ice melt, pollution, acidification)
• Forest and land use data (e.g. deforestation, indigenous communities, mining)
• College Degree preferred.
• Ability to produce data visualizations for storytelling preferred.

This position is fully remote. Global candidates encouraged to apply.

The Center uses an established compensation philosophy in administering compensation. Offers are determined based on candidate qualifications, related experience, internal equity, and the amount budgeted for the position.

Compensation for US-based employees: Salary range listed above is for US- based employees. Our benefit package includes paid time off (holiday, vacation, parental and sick), health care coverage (including medical/dental/vision), health savings accounts 403(b) retirement plan, transit benefit, parental leave, and Life & ADD/LTD/STD Insurance.

Compensation for non US-based employees: All non-US salaries are calculated using an international conversion index, which includes estimates for comparable positions in the country of residence and the estimated cost of health insurance. We do offer paid leave benefits which include hours in recognition of local holidays,vacation, sick, parental, and bereavement leave. We do not offer health or retirement benefits for employees outside of the US.
About Pulitzer

The Pulitzer Center is an equal opportunity employer. The Center is committed to fostering an inclusive environment where the individual differences among us, whether in terms of race, religion, color, age, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, physical challenge, or marital or family status, are (i) understood, respected, and appreciated, (ii) recognized as a source of strength, and (iii) valued as qualities that enrich the environment in which we work. See our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion statement for details.

For more information about the Pulitzer Center, visit pulitzercenter.org

title: Test Automation Engineer (Remote Latin America)
description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: South America, Mexico

This offer from "Affinity" has been enriched by Jobgether and got a 83.5% flex score.

Job Description:On behalf of our client in the US, Affinity International is looking for a Test Automation Engineer (C# .Net) to work closely with the product management and development teams to thoroughly understand project requirements, business objectives, and end-to-end testing efforts from design to implementation. You will work with an Agile scrum team to get stories to done status. This is a remote 6-month contract for candidates located in Latin America.

Responsibilities: - Meet during all regular team cadence calls (Scrum, Refinement, Planning, Retro, etc) - Review all stories assigned and provide feedback about story details to our product teams - Ensure alignment between Development and Test to ensure a story is completed - Help solve any deployment issues with Development and Devops - Perform manual testing on a... story as a first step - Provide feedback to development on any stories and ensure they get resolved - Automate Acceptance Criteria in Specflow framework - Coordinate with UAT to ensure stories are complete

Top Skills - C# .Net Automation Experience - Selenium/SpecFlow/BDD - API Testing - Postman - Experience in Agile Development

Qualifications - Experience in Agile Development - C# .Net Automation Experience - 4 to 5 years (This role can be a developer converted tester or a tester that learned to code) - Experience with C#/Selenium/SpecFlow/NUnit automation framework - Experience with API Testing (Postman) - Experience working with BDD Feature files for automation - Experience setting up and maintaining pipelines in Azure DevOps - Nice to have - Performance testing experience

Affinity Earn:Know someone who’s great for this, or any of our open roles? Earn up to $4,000/year for each successful referral through Affinity Earn. You can also earn up to $50,000 for helping us find new clients. Learn about our referral program at https://affinity-group.ca/earn/ or browse our jobs & follow us at https://www.linkedin.com/company/affinity-staffing/jobs/ About Affinity:Affinity Group is a full-service Information Technology services and staffing company. We believe recruiting is about creating long term relationships that foster a mutually beneficial partnership - an affinity. Bringing a new style of recruiting founded on five core principles: Transparency – Flexibility – Efficiency – Agility – Inclusivity. We teamed up with ClimatePartner on 2022 to offset our emissions and move toward being a more environmentally friendly company and we are proud to now be officially Carbon Neutral Certified. For more information on Affinity, please visit www.affinity-group.ca Job Number: 8755

title: HPC Automation Engineering Manager - Python & Linux
description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: South America, North America

This offer from "Canonical" has been enriched by Jobgether and got a 79.75% flex score.

HPC is an important and technically challenging compute domain, with specialised tooling and a very high requirement for precision, efficiency and automation. This role covers engineering management of a software development team we have created to deliver an outstanding HPC experience - from bare metal to public cloud - as part of the broader Ubuntu platform. We are looking for a range of skills and experience, but the heart of our effort will be Python software development for automation of key software in the HPC sphere.

To succeed in this application you must be outstanding at maths and sciences, and have built high quality software, learned about open source ideally by working on it directly, and be looking for an engineering management role with a company that makes mission-critical products for the global... market. You should also be familiar with the open source environment, and want to build products in partnership with a community.

As an engineering manager, you must also have excellent judgement about people - their motivations, abilities, developmental needs and prospects for success.

Engineering at Canonical requires hands-on code contribution and review, as well as architectural leadership. You will need to demonstrate insight into performance and quality engineering practices and ensure your team embraces effective disciplines on both fronts. You will need to be comfortable holding contributors accountable for work ethic and results. You must also have an understanding of security practices and principles and the impact that engineering choices have on product security.

We expect teams to deliver well-documented products and work with design professionals to shape the product experience. You should relish the opportunity to shape and direct and develop an engineering team that is happy and brilliant, and produces a product that will be a pleasure to use and to evolve.

For this role you must have deep experience with Python. Experience in HPC environments is a strong advantage. Familiarity with HPC hardware and software is also a strong advantage - delivering great experiences with Infiniband, RDMA, CUDA, MPI, Slurm, Lustre, Singularity and related technologies will be central to this team's work. It will also be advantageous to have experience with Docker image design and operations, and public cloud image design and operations.
What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.
• Fully remote working environment - we’ve been working remotely since 2004!
• Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
• Annual compensation review
• Recognition rewards
• Annual holiday leave
• Parental Leave
• Employee Assistance Programme
• Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at ‘sprints’
• Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events
About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004.​ Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

#stack

#LI-remote

title: Automation Engineer
description:
We're looking to hire a full-time, remote Automation Engineer (with Zapier & experience).

For this role, your primary focus will be collaborating with a team of developers to create and implement software applications and components.

You'll be able to choose your hours and work and learn with a team of world-class engineers and designers through a commitment to team collaboration, communication, and product quality.

Seniority Level:
Mid Level

Requirements

2+ years of Integromat ), Zapier, and Google Suite automation experience.
Solid understanding of how API works.
Knowledge in Oauth, JSON, XML, and Webhooks, Curl.
Must have experience with integrating Airtable, Slack, Google Suite, and Email Marketing tools.

Nice-to-haves:
Experience working with Python/JS
Experience with the first 50 most popular apps

A candidate should have their own computer and stable internet connection to apply. We want a full-time employee who only works for us and can commit to around 40 hours per... week. You are in charge of your own hours

About Us

Outliant is a fully-remote, US-based, digital product development and startup consulting company, with a team of culturally diverse creators whose exceptional skills and talents help conceive seamless digital products.

Our teams exhibit work-play energy that supports individual growth, as well as encourages the freedom of creativity and "thinking outside the box.
"

Why You Should Work with Us
As a full-time member of our team, you'll enjoy:

Work wherever you choose
Very flexible work hours
Unlimited PTO
Non-working holidays depending on which country you're in
13th-month bonus
Salary and salary increases
Financial support for online courses
Mental health and well-being programs
Fun and casual work environment
Employee engagement activities and virtual gatherings
We are a very diverse bunch

reduce_description: got a 72% flex score. by over 3,500 organizations and products benefits 4-6k usd monthly
title: Backend Developer / Service Architect
description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: Argentina

This offer from "Rotunda Software" has been enriched by Jobgether and got a 72% flex score.

This is a remote position open to applicants living in Argentina or Uruguay.

Would you like to work on meaningful, ambitious products with an exceptional team?

Rotunda is seeking an experienced backend developer / architect to help create a new generation of software tools for non-profits. Our flagship products are actively used by over 3,500 organizations and one million volunteers. The person who fills this position will be responsible for implementing a new service-oriented architecture that will be the foundation of future growth for these products. In addition to excellent technical and architectural skills, this position requires strong communication and organizational skills, and the ability to work well in a fast-paced, flexible, and ego-free environment.

Our modern backend stack is build on industry leading... technologies including node.js, Express, PostgreSQL, and AWS Lambda. We also leverage unique custom-built technologies such as an isomorphic JavaScript execution paradigm and a GraphQL-like query language that feeds data to a proprietary frontend framework. The individual who fills this position will have the opportunity to explore and innovate within this modern, creative environment. For example, we are currently building a hybrid relational / NoSQL persistence service that will handle millions of daily requests.

Rotunda is a talented, dedicated, international team, passionate about doing meaningful work and building extraordinary products that people love. Our mission is to help people do good things, and our unique culture is rooted in a set of shared values.

Responsibilities
• Participate in three week, self-regulated development sprints
• Learn, leverage, and create specialized application architecture
• Break down complex systems into purpose-oriented services
• Design and document services and their APIs
• Proactively identify and prioritize areas for improvement, large and small
• Carefully track action items to maintain the efficiency of the team

Requirements
• BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent working experience
• A proven ability to design and implement high-capacity web applications
• A facility for refactoring large systems into smaller, well-defined services
• Significant experience with microservice networking, deployment, and monitoring
• Intimate familiarity with the AWS eco-system, node.js, Docker, and Postgres
• A desire to do exceptional work on meaningful products

Benefits
• 4-6K USD monthly compensation and a performance-based annual bonus
• A freedom unique to self-funded, profitable companies
• A strong, closely-knit team
• A focus on growth including one-on-one mentoring and capacity building courses
• Work-life balance and a fully remote work environment done right
• Retreats (past destinations include Uruguay, San Francisco, Mexico, and Costa Rica)
• Paid sabbatical program

title: Backend Developers
description:
Sé el/la próxim@ Backend Developer en Globla66 en Buenos Aires, acompáñanos a mejorar la calidad de vida de las personas y empresas a través de productos y servicios financieros tecnológicos.
Somos una Tribu compuesta por más de 200 personas de diferentes nacionalidades, situadas en varios países (Chile, Argentina, Perú, Brasil y Colombia) Nos conectamos a través de un servicio que no cree en las fronteras, tenemos conciencia de grupo, nos apasiona lo que hacemos y celebramos cada logro como si ganara nuestro equipo favorito 💪.

Nos hemos propuesto construir el Neobanco Global de Latam y nada mejor que hacerlo con un gran equipo de trabajo, lleno de grandes talentos que se desafían todos los días para crear las mejores ideas, romper los límites de lo imposible y tomar riesgos que los lleven a lograr los resultados.
Tu próximos desafíos 🚀
• Desarrollo de Software de manera rápida y fluida utilizando nuestro stack tecnológico: Java Springboot
• Participar en instancias propias de... proyectos de software: Daily meetings, planificaciones de Sprint, etc.
• Brindar soporte a software productivo.
• Colaborar con las diferentes áreas de la empresa para definir requerimientos, diseñar soluciones y resolver problemas en sistemas de producción de forma metódica.

Beneficios

Somos un equipo de alto rendimiento, eso significa que estar aquí es ser de los mejores. Estamos orgullosos de representar a Global66 y de ser parte de esta tribu.

¡Valoramos la diversidad y sólo tenemos espacio para los que tienen hambre de crecimiento!

Algunos beneficios más:
• ¡Global66 te impulsa a la búsqueda de la excelencia y a sacar tu máximo potencial! Disfruta de cursos ilimitados a través de la plataforma de estudios de Udemy.
• Además te ofrecemos 300 USD al año para educación continua
• Cupón de descuento mensual en transferencias por nuestra app
• Dress Code libre
• Día libre de Cumpleaños
• Global66 te regala el computador a los 2 años

Y por si fuera poco… tendrás acceso a una App de beneficios de última generación,
• Fitness Virtual
• Telemedicina
• Nutricionista
• Soporte Psicológico
• App de Meditación

reduce_description: developer for 40 hours /
title: Backend Developer
description:
For our location in Tandil we are looking for a motivated Backend Developer for 40 hours / week to start immediately or as soon as possible.

We support you financially to move your place of residence permanently to Tandil (as we do not offer remote jobs).
Tasks
• You are responsible for the backend structure and persistent data storage in cloud security projects.
• You plan and develop new products in the area of cloud security.
• You create and maintain the related project documentation.
• You ensure together with your colleagues (in Tandil and in Germany) that development and quality goals are met.

Requirements:
• You are proficient in one or more programming languages, e.g. Python, Java or PHP.
• Ideally, you have already gained experience with the Django Framework.
• You have profound experience with data storage systems (MySQL, Elastic Search, MongoDB, SQLite, Redis).
• You feel at home in UNIX environments, especially Linux.
• You can abstract, think logically and you convince... through initiative and personal responsibility.
• You enjoy working in a team and are solutionoriented, reliable and resilient.
• You are fluent in English, both written and verbal.

Benefits:
• Free space for innovation and independent action in a fast growing international company with a promising future.
• Short decision paths and flat hierarchies in an open work atmosphere.
• Personal and professional development opportunities.
• Temporary Employee Exchange Program we support you to work at our global office locations and explore the world (e.g. Malta, Madrid, Montréal, Washington).
• Home-Office Option and flexible, trust based working time.
• No dress code you can come to work as you like.
• Delicious coffee, tea, soft drinks and fresh fruits every day for free.
• Free Book Policy we will order your reference books.
• Team events like Laser Tag, Escape Room or Get Together at our legendary beer truck let yourself be surprised.
• Be-Active Bonus we'll keep you healthy with an allowance to your membership in fitness and sports clubs.
• Additional Health Plan as healthy employees are important to us.
• Unlimited contracts we're looking for hornets to grow long term with us.
• Office Dogs are welcome you don't have to leave your dog alone at home
Do you want to help shape the growth and success of the Hornetsecurity Group

reduce_description: by over 30,000 people a compensation usd $55,000 - $75,000 anywhere
title: Lead Backend Developer
description:
Description

We are a talented, dedicated, small, international team, passionate about building great things. Our developers closely collaborate with other company departments to produce three outstanding products. Our company culture depends on strong interpersonal professional relationships, and is rooted in a set of shared values ( We embrace extreme innovation and take pride in the quality of our work. We don't have ego issues and are focused on results - ultimately, on serving our clients and having a positive impact on people's lives, while enjoying our own.

This role may be a good fit for you if you are:
• Detail oriented
• Have a passion for finding simple, elegant solutions to complex problems
• Are equally passionate about writing tests for said solutions
• Have experience and a passion for designing elegant APIs
• Have experience building web applications at large scale
• Have experience with node.js, express, Postgres, and AWS

Responsibilities

Rotunda's existing... products are depended upon by over 30,000 people a day, and the candidate who fills this position will be responsible for maintaining and optimizing the existing node.js backend infrastructure for those products.

In addition, our new communication tool, Unison, is in rapid development and has explosive growth potential. We are looking for somebody who can ensure that this new product can be used effectively by organizations with tens of thousands of members. For example, among other challenging projects, this role will work together with DevOps to implement a highly generalized and scalable map-reduce querying mechanism leveraging lambda functions.

Compensation

USD $55,000 - $75,000

reduce_description: up to 80 of the
title: Go Backend Developer
description:
We are increasing one of our developments team, and we want you to be part of it Do you accept the challenge

We are looking for new Go Backend Developers

People who joins us must have a get
it
done attitude, and be able to look proactively the best solutions and cooperate easily with the international team. On our side, you will see that fun, variety and lots of challenges to grow yourself and within the team are assured

What will you do

You will work in an international environment, together with our German and Madrid/Spanish colleagues
our headquarters are in Madrid but we are open to other locations

You will be part of our development team in charge of the transformation of one of the biggest online retail platform

You will development software in the Confidencial Cloud Platform (GCP)

You will ensure the software quality through code reviews, until tests and and end
to
end test cycles

What do we need from you

Strong experience in Golang Development, and interest in keep... learning and working with this language

Knowledge in VueJS.

Database experience (MongoDB would be ideal).

Software configuration management tools (GIT).

Experiences with agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban).

Good English skills, written and spoken.

Youhave a team feeling
we attach great importance to colleagues and a good working atmosphere

Nice to have
Experience working in Cloud environments (GCP).

Experience with Docker and/or Kubernetes.

Why choose us

Permanent contract

Flexible working hours (you decide how to organize your day to day)

Hybrid work mode (work from home up to 80 of the time, having the rest to meet you colleagues at the office)

You will be part of a fast growing company, being part of a great team

Competitive salary

Flexible retribution

Medical insurance

Agile working methods

Training and Development
we have a clear focus on technical innovation, but we dont forget the personal growth

About us

OSP (Otto Group Solution Provider) is an IT service provider for retail and logistics, within the Otto Groups business, so we share the values of our partner company and are committed to responsible trading, fairness, sustainability and diversity.
We stand for complete implementation of IT projects and practice
oriented software development for companies inside and outside of the Otto Group operating in omnichannel retail, logistics and e
and m
commerce.

OSP has locations in Germany, Spain, Thailand and Taiwan. We thrive in an international and trusting work environment. We are driven by the idea of working together as a team to achieve great things for our customers.

What are you waiting for Come and join us

In Talently, with a single registration, you can access the best offers from the most important technology companies in the USA and Latam that are looking for tech talent like yours.

Job description:
Senior Python Backend
Remote
USD 3000 - 4000
Full-time

As a Sr. Python Backend Developer, the company expects you will have:
• Solid experience in microservices creation.
• Experience working with large transaction volumes (+10M requests).
• Have worked with AWS (ec2, ecs, sqs).
• Solid knowledge of Docker.
Experience in web application development using Python and frameworks such as Django or Flask.
• Knowledge in relational and non-relational databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB).
• Ability to work in a team and communicate effectively.

Key Responsibilities:
• Lead from start to finish the developments you are involved in.
• Create and improve areas of the code to provide the best possible experience in each iteration.
• Decouple code using SOLID principles.
• Document and create... tests to ensure the quality of developments.

Benefits:
• Payment in US dollars.
• Paid holidays and vacation.
• 100% remote.
• Other benefits.
Additional information: Employment type: Full-time

title: Business Information Consultant Sr – Network Analytics
description:
Business Information Consultant Sr – Network Analytics in San Juan , Puerto Rico

Business Information Consultant Sr – Network Analytics

Job Family: Data Warehousing and Business Information

Type: Full time

Location:

CO, DENVER

National +50 Miles away from nearest PulsePoint, National +50 Miles away from nearest PulsePoint

Description

Business Information Consultant Sr – Network Analytics

Location : This position will work in a hybrid model (remote and office). The ideal candidate will live with 50 miles of one of our Elevance Health PulsePoint locations and be willing to work Eastern Standard Time to meet the needs of our clients.

The Business Information Consultant Sr is responsible for coordinating and completing various analyses to support local market network strategies.

How you will make an impact:

Establishes, improves, and optimizes the consolidating processes for forecast and month-end results.

Consolidates and prepares executive summary reports for various... business segments in the SBU for top management decision-making.

Analyzes and designs solutions to address varied and highly complex business needs.

May collaborate with businesses and technical areas to implement new or enhanced products.

May require strong knowledge of products as well as our internal business models and data systems.

May coordinate with external audits as appropriate.

Acts as the central contact with internal departments and external auditors.

Requires a BS/BA degree in Statistics, Economics, or Business Administration and minimum of 12 years of relevant experience; or any combination of education and experience which would provide an equivalent background.

Preferred Skills, Capabilities and Experiences:

Experience with relational databases and knowledge of query tools and statistical software is strongly preferred.

SQL and SAS experience highly preferred.

Ability to manipulate large sets of data strongly preferred.

Experience providing leadership in evaluating financial performance of complex organizations strongly preferred.

Excellent leadership, problem solving, organizational, planning, presentation and interpersonal skills strongly preferred.

Ability to work independently and draw up plans to address issues/concerns strongly preferred.

For candidates working in person or remotely in the below locations, the salary* range for this specific position is $103,440 to $186,192

Locations: California; Colorado; Nevada; Washington State; Jersey City, NJ; New York City, NY; Ithaca, NY and Westchester County, NY

In addition to your salary, Elevance Health offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). The salary offered for this specific position is based on a number of legitimate, nondiscriminatory factors set by the company.

The company is fully committed to ensuring equal pay opportunities for equal work regardless of gender, race, or any other category protected by federal, state, and local pay equity laws.

• The salary range is the range Elevance Health in good faith believes is the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. This range may be modified in the future and actual compensation may vary from posting based on geographic location, work experience, education and/or skill level. Even within the range, the actual compensation will vary depending on the above factors as well as market/business considerations. No amount is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable under the terms and conditions of the applicable policies and plans. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.

Please be advised that Elevance Health only accepts resumes

title: Business Consultant
description:
Business Consultant in San Juan , Puerto Rico

Business Consultant

Job Family: Business Support

Type: Full time

Location:

TN, BRENTWOOD

TN, MEMPHIS

TN, MEMPHIS

TN, NASHVILLE

TN, KNOXVILLE

National +50 Miles away from nearest PulsePoint, National +50 Miles away from nearest PulsePoint

Description

Business Consultant

• The ideal candidate will live near the middle Tennessee office but will consider highly qualified candidates from additional locations. This position will take part in Elevance Health's hybrid work model which includes remote work and 0-3 days in office per month. May be required to travel into the office once a quarter.

A proud member of the Elevance Health family of companies, Carelon Medical Benefits Management, formerly AIM Specialty Health, is a benefit-management leader in Illinois. Our platform delivers significant cost-of-care savings across an expanding set of clinical domains, including radiology, cardiology and oncology.

A proud member of the... Elevance Health family of companies, Carelon Post Acute Solutions, formerly myNEXUS, is the leader in health resource optimization, focused on transforming how healthcare is delivered and promoting the advancement of care for the people we serve.

The Business Consultant is responsible for translating moderately complex and varied business needs into product requirements. Possesses knowledge of most phases of systems and business analysis and is able to consider the business implications of the application of technology to current and future business environments.

How you will make an impact:

May lead teams of analysts assigned to complex projects.

Determines specific business product requirements to address complex and varied business needs.

Analyzes and designs products to address complex and varied business needs.

Consults with IT partners concerning application and implementation of technology.

• Requires a BA/BS and minimum of 8 years business analysis experience, which should include analysis and project management; or any combination of education and experience which would provide an equivalent background.

Preferred Qualifications

Knowledge of systems capabilities and business operations is strongly preferred.

Familiar with Product Lifecyle Management preferred.

Familiar with Software Development Lifecycle preferred.

Ability to create workflows/process flows preferred.

Experience using project management tools preferred (JIRA, VISIO, Azure DevOps, Excel)

For candidates working in person or remotely in the below locations, the salary* range for this specific position is $79,420 to $150,480.

Locations: California; Colorado; Nevada; Washington State; Jersey City, NJ; New York City, NY; Ithaca, NY and Westchester County, NY

In addition to your salary, Elevance Health offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). The salary offered for this specific position is based on a number of legitimate, non-discriminatory factors set by the company.

The company is fully committed to ensuring equal pay opportunities for equal work regardless of gender, race, or any other category protected by federal, state, and local pay equity laws .

• The salary range is the range Elevance Health in good faith believes is the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. title: Customer Success Consultant - Americas - Start Immediately
description:
We are on the lookout for a motivated Customer Success Consultant - Americas to join our incredible team at Adaptive Business Group in Rosario, Santa Fe.
Growing your career as a Full Time Customer Success Consultant - Americas is a fantastic opportunity to develop useful skills.
If you are strong in presentation, adaptability and have the right experience for the job, then apply for the position of Customer Success Consultant - Americas at Adaptive Business Group today!

Customer Success Consultant - Americas

#LI-AM1 #LI-Remote

Location: LATAM, Argentina preferably but open. (The role is remote)
Budget: Up to $40,000 USD per annum (base) - Depending on experience
• Are you interested in working for one of the world’s leading cloud-based enterprise Translation Management System?
• Have you got 2+ years of experience in a Customer Success role or Account Manager in the localization industry?
• Have you got experience with CRM Software such as Hubspot, Salesforce of Zoho?

If so, you... might be interested in what comes next.

We are assisting world leading Cloud Based Enterprise Translation Management System to find a Customer Success Consultant to join their team in Latin America.

As Customer Success Consultant, your main goal will be to develop and nurture strong relationships with customers, connecting with key business executives and stakeholders in order to drive customer renewals and identify new business opportunities among your existing customers.

If you would like to explore this opportunity in more detail, feel free to call me at: Ver el número de teléfono en click.appcast.io or please send your CV to: Ver el correo electrónico en click.appcast.io.

Benefits of working as a Customer Success Consultant - Americas in Rosario, Santa Fe:

● Learning opportunities
● Opportunities to grow
● Competitive salary

reduce_description: 201dq about the more than 4,600 employees located located in 28 countries, fti company generated $1.81 billion in fiscal year 2016. fti consulting to work 40 hours per
title: Document Reviewer - DC
description:
201DQ
About the Company:

FTI Consulting, Inc. is a global business advisory firm dedicated to helping organizations manage change, mitigate risk and resolve disputes: financial, legal, operational, political & regulatory, reputational and transactional. With more than 4,600 employees located in 28 countries, FTI Consulting professionals work closely with clients to anticipate, illuminate and overcome complex business challenges and make the most of opportunities. The Company generated $1.81 billion in revenues during fiscal year 2016.

FTI Consulting continually strives to offer employees and eligible dependents, including domestic partners and eligible domestic partner children, a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Please click here for more information.

FTI Consulting does not accept unsolicited resumes from external firms or agencies. FTI Consulting will not be responsible for placement fees associated with unsolicited resumes.

FTI Consulting is an equal opportunity... employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, protected veteran status, religion, physical or mental disability, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulation.

About Technology:

Our Technology practice helps clients manage the risk and cost of e-discovery. From forensic data collection to fully managed document review services we collaborate with our clients to deliver strategic solutions tailored to their unique legal requirements. With keen focus on the productivity and defensibility of document review, clients rely on our comprehensive portfolio of software, services expertise and to address matters ranging from internal investigations to large-scale litigation with global e-discovery requirements.

If you are interested in becoming part of a fast growing company and helping shape its future, read on.

About the Opportunity:

Acuity Managed Review is registering reviewers for document review projects based in our Washington, D.C. office. Reviewers should expect to work 40 hours per week in a fast-paced, deadline-driven work environment. No relocation assistance is provided and the position is not eligible for visa sponsorship. Compensation rates are competitive. At FTI, we like to get to know our document reviewers and have them work on multiple projects over time. To become a member of one of our document review teams, please apply.

Primary Duties:
• Review and code documents for litigation for relevance and privilege.
• Identify useful information in the reviewed documents and communicate that information to review managers.

Basic Qualifications:
• Must be an attorney licensed and in good-standing in at least one U.S. jurisdiction.
• Previous document review experience.

Preferred Skills:
• Prior Ringtail & Relativity experience.
• Prior privilege review, analytics review, and/or quality control experience.

FTI Consulting is an Equal Opportunity Employer
