title: Junior Management Consultant - Argentina
description:
Note before application :
• Please attach an English version of your CV.
• The entire recruitment process will be communicated using English.
• This is a full-time contractor role.
• This role is available in Argentina and the Philippines.
• The salary range is between US $1,000 - US $1,700 / month all in

Company Overview :

VargasAndrews is an international professional services firm specializing in business transformations and turnarounds.

To put it succinctly, we exist to transform lives. We passionately embody our values and our mission every day. We believe in 1) Teamwork and Comradery, 2) Hiring and Developing the Best, 3) Agility and Lean Thinking, 4) Customer Obsession, 5) Curiosity and Systemization, and 6) Ownership and Accountability

A lot of companies use their mission, vision,, and values as a poster, the difference is we live them. We are a why organization, not a what organization.

It is not what we do, it's why we do it that gets us out of bed every morning.

Our... vision is to become an international market leader in business transformations.

Summary of Primary Job Responsibilities :
• Project planning and design - Gantt charting, communications, follow-up
• Assist in preparing business proposals and presentations
• Carry out due diligence, research, and data collection to understand the organization. Analyze business structures to search for inefficiencies that may affect the company's bottom line
• Client interactions including emails, virtual meetings and presentations. Lead both internal and external meetings and scrums
• Project Management : manage client onboarding process and ongoing client engagements via BPM and Gantt, monitoring project deliverables and timelines, managing risks, and escalating issues.
• Financial analysis : understanding of basic accounting concepts and reading financial statements. Find excess spending and locate budget improvements that can increase company revenue
• Process mapping : creating value stream maps, putting together SOPs, developing approval matrices
• Lead and support internal special projects across departments that promote systemization and innovation
• Actively manage investment portfolio and use portfolio management software
• Conduct business and financial due diligence on investment opportunities
• Project planning and design- Gantt charting, communications, follow-up.
• Financial analysis- understanding of basic accounting concepts and reading financial statements.
• Process mapping- creating value stream maps, putting together SOPs, developing approval matrices.
• Client interactions including emails, virtual meetings and presentations.
• Project management.
• Carry out research and data collection to understand the organization.
• Analyze business structures to search for inefficiencies that may affect the company's bottom line.
• Find excess spending and locate budget improvements that can increase company revenue.
• Assist in preparing business proposals and presentations.
• Actively monitor investment portfolios
• Help complete executive summaries detailing performance
• Use portfolio management software to generate portfolio reports and analytics for monthly, quarterly and annual meetings

Typical Qualifications : (education, experience, knowledge, skills and abilities typically needed to perform this job)

Education (if beyond High School or equivalent) : Bachelors degree in Business Administration and Accountancy, Mathematics, Finance or equivalent

Experience Target (in this job or a related function / field) : 2-3 years prior experience working for one of the larger consulting firms I.

e., McKinsey, Accenture, etc.

Skills : (identify essential skills and qualitative skills required, and identify additional skills that enable success in performing this job) :
• Intermediate working knowledge of O365 Suite.
• Intermediate working knowledge of Excel skills (VLOOKUP, INDEX(MATCH) Function level).
• Interpersonal skills (Client facing).
• Strong numeric skills, research skills
• Good quantitative and Qualitative Analytical Skills,
• Exceptional problem-solving skills and analytical, innovative, and creative mindset.
• Well-developed core consulting skills of research, analysis, presentation, and attention to detail.
• The candidate must have the ability to provide leadership, vision, and direction to the evolving role of business transformation)

Knowledge / Abilities : (describe type and level of knowledge or ability needed to perform essential job functions and those that enable success in performing this job)
• Proven experience in process improvement.
• Ability to develop effective business relationships both internally and externally.
• Aptitude to grasp new concepts and effectively produce results.
• Ability to influence others and present a positive company image.
• Collaborative work style essential.
• Background in investments

Special Certifications (if appropriate identify if required to perform the job or just preferred) : CFA is an advantage

Travel Required ( % of time, scope of travel (in country, international), transportation mode, special issues) : Limited - based on regional ramp needs.

Other : (if appropriate, list anything especially challenging or unique about this position that is needed to be successful in performing this job that is not covered in other areas above) Willing to work on a flexible and shifting schedule, depending on client time zones such as PST / EST

title: QA Automation Engineer
description:
APPLY HERE: https://adr.to/jooq4ai

Summary

Automation engineer to build out testing process from scratch

Description

We have an opportunity for an experienced QA Automation Engineer to join a Canadian client in the banking/financial services industry. They're rebuilding their customer portal from scratch (and other projects too!) and need someone who can help build an automation testing framework from scratch.

The successful candidate can be located anywhere in Latin America, but you'll need to be available for up to 6 hours of overlap with the PST time zone. You'll need to have good communication skills (B2 or higher) for this role. The successful candidate will be prepared to work in a small startup-like team but within a larger mature and established organization.

Our client is still in the early stages of building the dev team and defining the technology stack, but it’s starting to take shape: React and Node.js on AWS. We are seeking a skilled and motivated engineer who can... play a vital role in ensuring the quality and reliability of client’ applications by developing and executing automated test scripts.

Key responsibilities may include:
• Develop and execute automated test scripts using industry-standard frameworks and tools.
• Collaborate with the development team to understand project requirements and design effective test strategies.
• Identify, analyze, and report software defects to facilitate efficient bug resolution.
• Contribute to the creation and maintenance of test plans, test cases, and test data.
• Set up and configure testing environments and test automation frameworks.
• Perform various types of testing, including functional, integration, regression, and performance testing.
• Participate in Agile ceremonies, providing insights and feedback to improve product quality.
• Work closely with developers to ensure proper integration and test coverage for new features and enhancements.
• Continuously enhance and optimize test automation frameworks and processes.
• Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies related to automation testing.

Requirements:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
• Solid experience in automation testing, with a focus on web applications.
• Experience setting up new applications and configuring testing environments.
• Strong understanding of AWS services and experience testing applications deployed on AWS.
• Familiarity with Agile methodologies and experience working in Agile development environments.
• Experience with test automation frameworks such as Cypress, Selenium, or Puppeteer.
• Strong knowledge of software testing principles, techniques, and best practices.
• Proficient in writing clear, concise, and comprehensive test cases and test scripts.
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.

Of Note:You will be required to prove you own laptop, basic software tools, and cell phone.
Completed background checks will be required prior to the start date if you are selected as a winning candidate.

If you think the job is the right fit for you, please apply directly from the web:

https://adr.to/jooq4ai

While we strive to respond to all applicants, please understand that due to the high volume of applications we receive, it may not be feasible to provide individual feedback or responses to every candidate. Rest assured that your application will be carefully reviewed and considered. We appreciate your understanding and interest in joining our team.
To see all of our current positions, follow this link: https://devengine.ca/jobs.html
We also encourage you to join our Telegram channel here: https://web.telegram.org/k/#@DevEngine

Tipo de puesto: Tiempo completo

Salario: $15,00 - $20,00 la hora

Experiencia:
• Selenium, Cypress o Puppeteer: 3 años (Obligatorio)
• AWS: 3 años (Obligatorio

title: Director of Software QA
description:
We make elegant iOS-based photo booths connected to peripherals like printers, DSLR cameras, and LEDs. Our iOS app and React web-based product are both powered by a Node API, MongoDB database, and several microservices.

If you are a kind, respectful, and thoughtful Director of QA who wants to help increase the quality of both our software and leadership of our engineering organization, we're looking for you!

You'll be leading of three manual QA testers, collaborating with product and development teams, and improving our processes, metrics, and transparency so we can deliver outstanding, bulletproof products. We're looking for your guidance and experience to help us improve our products, as well as guide and mentor the team of QA engineers.

We are a data-driven department and company, so you'll be expected to back up your recommendations with evidence of their effectiveness.

You'd be working in a collaborative, remote-first environment, but we respect the need for independent and... heads-down deep work, so we don't have a lot of meetings or bureaucracy. If you are looking for a workplace that respects you as a person, and will both expect and help you to perform at your best, we are the place for you!

Salary Range: $120K - $200K USD
Responsibilities
• Help us build great software!
• Work with other QA and engineering team members to improve overall software quality.
• Recommend and implement QA process improvements. Tools, methodologies, automations, etc. We're looking for you to use your brainpower and figure out what makes sense at this company and team.
• Improve transparency of our software quality to the engineering team and the whole company. What's our test coverage across our product suites? How long does it take us to fix bugs? How many defects do we find at various phases of development? We have lots of questions that we'd love to have answered.
• Provide technical guidance for other QA engineers.
• Provide technical oversight for our manual and automated test suite.
Requirements
• Most importantly, you MUST be kind, respectful, and thoughtful. Strong opinions are very welcome. Jerks are not.
• Secondly, you must be willing to work in the context of a team. We're not looking for a lone wolf or a dictator.
• Experience and a solid track record of helping a growth stage SaaS company implement QA best practices.
• Ideally you have both manual and automated QA experience at some point in your career.
• Track record of helping teams QA high-quality, battle-tested software.
• Experience with all the basics: Agile PM tools like Trello, Asana, Shortcut, Jira; communication tools like Slack, etc
• We are a remote-first company, but you need several hours of overlap with Pacific Time so you can collaborate synchronously with the team. You will need to confirm that you reside within GMT-8 to GMT-3.
Benefits

🏥 Health Benefits

👴 401K

📚 Education Stipend

💰 Bonus Plan

🏝️ Annual Retreat

✈️ Generous PTO and Holiday Schedule

💼 Quarterly Financial Meetings

📊 Open Book Management

💪 Intimate Team

title: IT Support Specialist
description:
This is a 100% Remote Working Opportunity for a US IT Firm.

We help our customers become more agile, efficient, robust, and secure.

We provide enterprise-level services to customers all around the world. Along with safeguarding against destructive attacks like ransomware and data exfiltration, it also helps businesses decrease expenses, simplify their infrastructure, and improve the user experience by eliminating stacks of internal processes.

Job Description
• Provide deployment advisory services, such as best practice design advice, and configurations, among other things.
• Assist clients with testing and troubleshooting during the deployment process. As needed, escalate to higher levels of help.
• Replicate client concerns in order to validate problems and document methods to duplicate for the Support, Engineering, and Operations teams
• Other duties or projects, as assigned

Qualifications
• Technical bachelor's degree and/or similar work experience are the very minimum... requirements.
• Perform network modeling and analysis, enforce policies for standardizing systems
• Develop and execute test plans to check infrastructure and system performance
• Implement local area networks (LAN), wide area networks (WAN), intranets, extranets, and other data networks
• Knowledge of network debugging tools such as Wireshark, tcpdump, Traceroute, and MTR, as well as practical experience with them

What You Can Expect From Us
• You will be working in an atmosphere where you will be exposed to cutting-edge technologies and architectures.
• A workplace that is enjoyable, enthusiastic, and collaborative.

Why Doit Security?

People that succeed at Doit Security are intelligent, driven, and committed to our core principles. Consider the following question: Do you wish to collaborate with the greatest talent in the industry? Do you want to be a part of the development of disruptive technologies? Do you thrive in a fast-paced, changing environment? Do you value a workplace culture that fosters individual and collective success while also acknowledging and celebrating accomplishments? If you answered yes, we'd be delighted to speak with you about being a member of our award-winning team.

Doit Security is an equal opportunity workplace committed to diversity. We value and celebrate diversity, and we are dedicated to providing an inclusive atmosphere for all of our workers and customers.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $800.00 - $1,000.00 per hour

Language:
• Conversational Level English (Preferred

reduce_description: working hours: 9 am to am to 6 pm est est holidays: 20 pto days salary: usd 1,500 to usd to usd 2,250 per month job id: 0090
title: CRM Specialist - 0090 - ARG
description:
About the client:

Our client is based in Florida, USA, and running a digital marketing agency and looking for an experienced SEO strategist to plan and execute organic growth strategies for a set of clients.

The client is mostly handling local service businesses seeking growth with Local SEO.

Our client has a policy of “no jerks” for both clients and team members and is looking to grow its client-servicing team with exceptional super-stars who are passionate about what they do and have the right attitude.

About the role:

We are excited to announce an opening for a dedicated CRM Specialist with deep expertise in Go High Level. In this critical role, you'll drive our digital agency's client relations by developing and implementing robust CRM strategies for local service businesses such as plumbing, HVAC, and painting contractors. If you are passionate about fostering client relationships, love to use data to inform strategy, and are an expert at leveraging Go High Level to its... fullest potential, we would love to hear from you.

What you’ll be doing:
• Implementing and managing Go High Level for our clients in the local service industry.
• Customizing the CRM to fit each client's specific needs, ensuring a seamless user experience.
• Analyzing and interpreting client data to drive strategy and improve customer relationship management.
• Collaborating with sales and customer service teams to align CRM strategies with business goals.
• Training internal teams and clients on the use of Go High Level and encouraging its adoption.
• Identifying opportunities for CRM system improvements and recommending enhancements.
• Keeping up-to-date with industry trends, Go High Level updates, and best practices.
• Regularly reporting on CRM performance and insights to internal teams and clients.

Who are we looking for?
• Proven experience as a CRM Specialist, with extensive experience in implementing and managing Go High Level.
• Exceptional understanding of CRM best practices, with the ability to customize and optimize Go High Level for diverse needs.
• Strong analytical skills, with the ability to analyze and interpret complex data and use it to inform strategy.
• Excellent communication and training skills, with the ability to drive CRM adoption among diverse teams.
• Collaborative team player with a passion for improving customer relationships through effective CRM use.
• Keeps updated with the latest trends and changes in CRM technology and digital marketing.
• Please note: Expertise in Go High Level implementation and management is a non-negotiable requirement for this role.

Position: CRM Specialist

Remote Status: Fully Remote

Preferred Location: Global

Working Hours: 9 am to 6 pm EST

Holidays: 20 PTO days per year (Can be used for US or local holidays, etc., accumulating over the year.)

Salary: USD 1,500 to USD 2,250 per month

Internal Job ID: 0090

reduce_description: dynamic, web-based, b2b applications love vue.js (vue 3), typescript and php to vue3 respond to vue.js (vue 3) typescript scss php to vue3 respond to php to vue3 respond to typescript scss html5 if you full-time position. 40 hours per globalmente remoto 6521-5-02082023 anywhere
title: Sr. FullStack Developer (Vue.js/Node.js/TypeScript) (7408 USD/Mes...
description:
About The Position

The client is looking for a passionate, experienced Sr. FullStack Developer (Vue.js/Node.js/TypeScript) that can jump into a large, dynamic, enterprise-grade application and begin contributing. You love developing, seeing your work put to action and knowing that everything you work on will be used by real customers around the world. You are eager to be involved in a company that is moving a global industry to a more connected, scalable future.

You will be expanding our hands-on, small and mighty, senior software development team. You will have your hands in many projects, both big and small. You thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic and rewarding environment.

The job is remote, but highly collaborative. You’ll feel immersed and connected with our senior team and our customers.

Overview of you and the role:
• Have significant experience and expertise in Vue.js, TypeScript and Node.js and have used it to build dynamic, web-based, B2B applications
• Love building and... writing quality code, and can do it fast and well
• Love weaving through complex applications and programming and finding efficient and simple ways to build them
• Have a an obsession for great user experiences
• Experience in other modern front-end and/or back-end technologies is a plus
• Are looking for a long-term, full-time position with a fast growing company
• Love working in fast-paced, start-up like environments
• Can get ramped up in a new environment quickly

Your skills

You are a front-end developer that is very strong and experienced with Vue.js (Vue 3), TypeScript and Node.js. Preferably, you have experience building other complex SaaS-based applications in vue.js. If you alternatively have equivalent experience in React.js, and are interested in, and able to quickly learn Vue, that can work too.

Your development skill set also includes Typescript on the front. You have proficiency in scss, and have an eye for seamless and engaging user experiences. If you have experience with php, MariaDb and node.js, that is a huge plus. If you are knowledgeable about other modern API tools and frameworks, like Firebase, Graphql, etc., that's a plus too, as we like it when people can expand our skillset and bring new ideas to the table.

You are highly self-motivated, take a high degree of pride and care in your work. You are a developer that is productive and thorough; you excel at writing high quality code fast. You are a high value contributor that goes beyond just writing the code; you can lead and come up with new and better ideas. You meet deadlines and thrive in a dynamic environment. You are eager to build and deploy amazing things.

You also see the bigger picture, from the user’s perspective, and design and build to make their experience easy, intuitive and engaging. You have an innate desire to always be learning and improving. You can really understand the user’s experience, workflows and value propositions, and then carry this understanding into building, advancing and deploying even more spectacular back- and front-ends.

We are looking for someone eager to dive into our front-end that can really understand the user’s experience, workflows and value propositions, and then carry this understanding into building, advancing and deploying even more spectacular back- and front-ends.

Some of our solutions include:
• Secure, permission-based, online document management systems and data rooms
• Advanced user management systems
• CRM systems
• Management, centralization, digitization and visualization of data
• Electronic transactions in private investments
• Collaboration and communication tools
• Dynamic, do-it-yourself digital dashboards of structured and unstructured data
• White-labeling, theming and DIY customizations
• Advanced portfolio analytics
• API integrations
• Full life-cycle investor journeys
• Fundraising and investor servicing solutions
• AML/KYC applications
• Email systems

What's unique is that as a truly all-in-one platform, all of our solutions work with each other. We combine them in ways that create more value and new possibilities for everyone.

Things you will be working on

Our development team is extremely agile. You will become a core part of our core team, working on multiple tasks and projects, and often shifting between things based on priorities. Your week could include helping to:
• build and release new features, applications and workflows
• enhance existing features
• migrate certain areas of the application from php to vue3
• respond to customer needs
• accelerate revenue opportunities
• implement and own certain API integrations
• work with our technology partners on seamless integrations

Remote, but collaborative

Our team is NY based, but we live in different locations. We work remote, but are close and enjoy an open, transparent and highly collaborative environment. We stay in communication throughout each day. We use Slack to chat, video conference and screen share to keep everyone updated, work on things together and brainstorm new ideas. You will become part of this flow. This type of interaction comes naturally for you.

Primary Technologies - Required
• Vue.js (Vue 3)
• Typescript
• scss
• html5

If you have extensive experience in React.js, and can pick up Vue.js, we would love to hear from you too.

Technologies that are a plus
• PHP
• MariaDB

Other

We are aiming for you to quickly become an active, ongoing and contributing part of our team. This opportunity is a full-time position.
• 40 hours per week
• Willing or able to work on, or have substantial overlap with, Eastern time zone hours
• We are in New York
• Fluent in English
• You have your own computer that runs fast with high-speed Internet
• You have video conferencing capabilities

Other Benefits
• Opportunity to work on a big, disruptive platform

This company does a lot! We serve and bring together participants on all sides of our industry, giving each audience the advanced, yet highly intuitive workflow tools they need. Then we bring it all together. You will be involved in all of it :)
• Opportunity to work directly with the founders

You will become part of the core development and innovation team, working directly with the CEO and the Head of Development. You will learn a ton (and you will have an opportunity to teach us too!).
• Opportunity to make a difference

Everything you do will be used by our customers around the world. Not just that, but we are transforming an entire industry, moving it to an online, centralized state. You will be involved in this migration.

Requirements

None

Benefits

Vacaciones / Flexibilidad de Trabajo
• Trabajo Remoto: Globalmente remoto

job_highlights:
[{'items': ["About The Position

The client is looking for a passionate, experienced Sr. FullStack Developer (Vue.js/Node.js/TypeScript) that can jump into a large, dynamic, enterprise-grade application and begin contributing. You love developing, seeing your work put to action and knowing that everything you work on will be used by real customers around the world. You are eager to be involved in a company that is moving a global industry to a more connected, scalable future.

You will be expanding our hands-on, small and mighty, senior software development team. You will have your hands in many projects, both big and small. You thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic and rewarding environment.

The job is remote, but highly collaborative. You’ll feel immersed and connected with our senior team and our customers.

Overview of you and the role:
• Have significant experience and expertise in Vue.js, TypeScript and Node.js and have used it to build dynamic, web-based, B2B applications
• Love building and... writing quality code, and can do it fast and well
• Love weaving through complex applications and programming and finding efficient and simple ways to build them
• Have a an obsession for great user experiences
• Experience in other modern front-end and/or back-end technologies is a plus
• Are looking for a long-term, full-time position with a fast growing company
• Love working in fast-paced, start-up like environments
• Can get ramped up in a new environment quickly

Your skills

You are a front-end developer that is very strong and experienced with Vue.js (Vue 3), TypeScript and Node.js. Preferably, you have experience building other complex SaaS-based applications in vue.js. If you alternatively have equivalent experience in React.js, and are interested in, and able to quickly learn Vue, that can work too.

Your development skill set also includes Typescript on the front. You have proficiency in scss, and have an eye for seamless and engaging user experiences. If you have experience with php, MariaDb and node.js, that is a huge plus. If you are knowledgeable about other modern API tools and frameworks, like Firebase, Graphql, etc., that's a plus too, as we like it when people can expand our skillset and bring new ideas to the table.

You are highly self-motivated, take a high degree of pride and care in your work. You are a developer that is productive and thorough; you excel at writing high quality code fast. You are a high value contributor that goes beyond just writing the code; you can lead and come up with new and better ideas. You meet deadlines and thrive in a dynamic environment. You are eager to build and deploy amazing things.

You also see the bigger picture, from the user’s perspective, and design and build to make their experience easy, intuitive and engaging. You have an innate desire to always be learning and improving. You can really understand the user’s experience, workflows and value propositions, and then carry this understanding into building, advancing and deploying even more spectacular back- and front-ends.

We are looking for someone eager to dive into our front-end that can really understand the user’s experience, workflows and value propositions, and then carry this understanding into building, advancing and deploying even more spectacular back- and front-ends.

Some of our solutions include:
• Secure, permission-based, online document management systems and data rooms
• Advanced user management systems
• CRM systems
• Management, centralization, digitization and visualization of data
• Electronic transactions in private investments
• Collaboration and communication tools
• Dynamic, do-it-yourself digital dashboards of structured and unstructured data
• White-labeling, theming and DIY customizations
• Advanced portfolio analytics
• API integrations
• Full life-cycle investor journeys
• Fundraising and investor servicing solutions
• AML/KYC applications
• Email systems

What's unique is that as a truly all-in-one platform, all of our solutions work with each other. We combine them in ways that create more value and new possibilities for everyone.

Things you will be working on

Our development team is extremely agile. You will become a core part of our core team, working on multiple tasks and projects, and often shifting between things based on priorities. Your week could include helping to:
• build and release new features, applications and workflows
• enhance existing features
• migrate certain areas of the application from php to vue3
• respond to customer needs
• accelerate revenue opportunities
• implement and own certain API integrations
• work with our technology partners on seamless integrations

Remote, but collaborative

Our team is NY based, but we live in different locations. We work remote, but are close and enjoy an open, transparent and highly collaborative environment. We stay in communication throughout each day. We use Slack to chat, video conference and screen share to keep everyone updated, work on things together and brainstorm new ideas. You will become part of this flow. This type of interaction comes naturally for you.

Primary Technologies - Required
• Vue.js (Vue 3)
• Typescript
• scss
• html5

If you have extensive experience in React.js, and can pick up Vue.js, we would love to hear from you too.

Technologies that are a plus
• PHP
• MariaDB

Other

We are aiming for you to quickly become an active, ongoing and contributing part of our team. This opportunity is a full-time position.
• 40 hours per week
• Willing or able to work on, or have substantial overlap with, Eastern time zone hours
• We are in New York
• Fluent in English
• You have your own computer that runs fast with high-speed Internet
• You have video conferencing capabilities

Other Benefits
• Opportunity to work on a big, disruptive platform

This company does a lot! We serve and bring together participants on all sides of our industry, giving each audience the advanced, yet highly intuitive workflow tools they need. Then we bring it all together. You will be involved in all of it :)
• Opportunity to work directly with the founders

You will become part of the core development and innovation team, working directly with the CEO and the Head of Development. You will learn a ton (and you will have an opportunity to teach us too!).
• Opportunity to make a difference

Everything you do will be used by our customers around the world. Not just that, but we are transforming an entire industry, moving it to an online, centralized state. You will be involved in this migration.

Requirements

None

Benefits

Vacaciones / Flexibilidad de Trabajo
• Trabajo Remoto: Globalmente remoto

6521-5-02082023"]}]

title: Senior Backend Developer (Node.js)
description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: South America, North America, Europe

This offer from "MasterBorn Software" has been enriched by Jobgether and got a 75% flex score.
We are currently developing a team of world-class Backend Developers obsessed with Node.js.
Your challenge will be to build a modern, scalable web application using Node.js frameworks (sometimes with TypeScript flavour!) and (No)SQL technologies mostly on AWS Cloud.

You will work (in the Polish time zone!) for one of our US-based clients: Payments.ai, TrueWill, or Tentacle.

We're a team of top performers. 100% of our clients and referrals are from the high-end American IT market.

Salary: PLN 17.000 - 24.000 + VAT (B2B)
• Required skills: at least 4 years of commercial experience in Node.js, experience in SQL and NoSQL DBs, a vast knowledge of at least one JS framework (Express.js preferred), SOLID and KISS in your veins, solid knowledge about design and architecture patterns, knowledge about basic... AWS services, basic dev-ops skills (Docker, GitHub Actions), a very good command of written and spoken English (CEFR B2+) and Polish (C1)
• Nice to have: knowledge of Scrum and Agile methodologies, open-source contributions, Serverless experience, experience in TypeScript and various BE frameworks
• Perks and Benefits: +6 000 PLN / year training budget, + 1500 PLN / quarter for health insurance and sports, Mentoring Program, work on site, hybrid or fully remote
• B2B/UZL: + paid days off

About the role - Technical:
• Writing readable and easy to maintain JS code with OOP flavor
• Have technical involvement in the product - finding ways to improve it
• Being partially responsible and involved in design and modification of the DB structures
• Writing documentation for delivered code

Tools you’ll use:
• Slack, GSuite
• GitHub
• Jira, Confluence, Miro
• Apple MacBook Pro

About the role - Non-Technical:
• Improve and reuse the company’s knowledge base
• Communicate with the team to efficiently translate business complexities (user stories/tasks) into solutions (results/estimations)
• Being a natural leader in terms of Backend - staying on top with trends/news, sharing them, teaching others and aiming for best quality solutions
• Being part in our Phase0 (Discover - Define - Design process for startups and MVPs)

We'll be happy to see that you:
• Know JS - been there, done that - understands most of the concepts, knows how and why JS works as it does, is able to pass this knowledge to others easily
• Have a deep knowledge of at least one Node.js backend framework (Express.js - prefered) - knows APIs/functions/features, thoroughly used them in abstract constructions/utilized keeping good practices, was working on at least 2 projects involving such technologies, have commercial experience in it
• Have knowledge and experience in utilising OOP, keeping good practices, data structures, SOLID, DRY and design patterns
• Have worked with SQL databases (integration and design-wise) utilising ORM or query builder tool (ie. Sequalize, Knex)
• Potentially worked with NoSQL databases and/or in-memory databases and utilized them as a data store
• Worked within AWS stack - used S3, Cognito, SNS, SQS, others
• Have basic experience in Serverless - was running some applications in "the Serverless way"
• Have usage experience with Docker - knows how to prepare and debug the environment and connect things up to work locally
• Open-minded to new challenges (TypeScript, frameworks other than Express, etc)
• Have Minimum B2 English - documentation/tasks/other reading/writing
• Have Polish level C1 minimum
• Know why MVP is important and regardless of quick delivery times, wants to do a good job at a high quality level

Meaningful projects, top-notch experts and value-driven workplace
Sound good?
Apply now

title: Business Analyst I
description:
Business Analyst I in San Juan , Puerto Rico

Business Analyst I

Job Family: Business Support

Type: Full time

Location:

FL, TAMPA

National +50 Miles away from nearest PulsePoint, National +50 Miles away from nearest PulsePoint

Description

Business Analyst I

Location: REMOTE

The Business Analyst I is responsible for assisting with the translation of business needs into application software requirements. This is the entry-level in a career progression.

How you will make an impact:

Participates in developing and/or modifying requirements, business design specifications, user training and documentation.

Researches and documents business issues.

Translates business requirements to technical staff to ensure that requirements are incorporated into system design.

Tests and documents solutions. Serves as liaison between users of the software and technical staff.

Requires a HS diploma or equivalent and minimum of 5 years related health care experience that includes work flow... design, data analysis, and/or systems automation and testing; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.

Preferred Skills, Capabilities and Experiences:

BA/BS degree preferred. Understanding of business processes and systems capability strongly preferred.

For candidates working in person or remotely in the below locations, the salary range for this specific position is $20.60 to $34.

Locations: California; Colorado; Nevada; Washington State; Jersey City, NJ; New York City, NY; Ithaca, NY and Westchester County, NY.

In addition to your salary, Elevance Health offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). The salary offered for this specific position is based on a number of legitimate, nondiscriminatory factors set by the company.

The company is fully committed to ensuring equal pay opportunities for equal work regardless of gender, race, or any other category protected by federal, state, and local pay equity laws.

The salary range is the range Elevance Health in good faith believes is the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. This range may be modified in the future and actual compensation may vary from posting based on geographic location, work experience, education and/or skill level.

Even within the range, the actual compensation will vary depending on the above factors as well as market/business considerations. No amount is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable under the terms and conditions of the applicable policies and plans.

The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.

Please be advised that Elevance Health only accepts resumes from agencies that have a signed agreement with Elevance Health. Accordingly, Elevance Health is not obligated to pay referral fees to any agency that is not a party to an agreement with Elevance Health.

Thus, any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Elevance Health.

Be part of an Extraordinary Team

Elevance Health is a health company dedicated to improving lives and communities – and making healthcare simpler. A Fortune 20 company with a longstanding history in the healthcare industry, we are looking for leaders at all levels of the organization who are passionate about making an impact on our members and the communities we serve.

You will thrive in a complex and collaborative environment where you take action and ownership to solve problems and lead change. Do you want to be part of a larger purpose and an evolving, high-performance culture that empowers you to make an impact?

We offer a range of market-compe

reduce_description: salariales trimestrales. 10 dias habiles semana redbee, 5 dias off
title: Sr Business Analyst
description:
Buscamos Business Analyst curiosos, jugadores de equipo, apasionados, que quieran crecer, innovar y aprender de las últimas tecnologías.

Hacemos diferente, tenemos una cultura A.C.T.I.VA y nuestro propósito es ayudarte a elegir el mejor camino para que la rompas.

¿Qué hacen los Business Analyst en redbee?
• Analizan y documentan las diferentes features de un producto, considerando tanto aspectos de negocio como técnicos.
• Conocen y aplican buenas prácticas al momento de definir un backlog y documentar historias de usuario
• Facilitan y participan activamente en reuniones de entendimiento de requerimientos.
• * Trabajan codo a codo con el equipo de desarrollo.
• Ayudan al cliente y al equipo a trabajar el alcance dentro de un marco ágil, siempre con foco en el objetivo del producto.
• Actualizan las prioridades del product backlog según el roadmap, negociando con el Product Owner.
• Atienden las dependencias que puedan impactar en el objetivo del proyecto.
• Incentivan al equipo a... tomar un rol activo en los refinamientos.
• Conocen el concepto de esfuerzo relativo y participan de las estimaciones aplicando el mismo.
• ¿Qué esperamos de vos?
• Que tengas experiencia documentando y definiendo historias de usuario, diagramas UML.
• Que facilites reuniones y ¡sean efectivas!
• Que sepas lo que es un servicio y puedas testearlo a través de una herramienta.
• Que sepas lo que es un modelo de datos y puedas hacer consultas a los mismos.
• Que puedas entender la arquitectura de un sistema a alto nivel.
• Que la descosas realizando el slicing de una funcionalidad.
• Que tu capacidad analítica y skills de negociación nos sorprendan.
• Que conozcas técnicas, como story mapping, impact mapping, bocetado, etc.
• Que conozcas el concepto de esfuerzo relativo y sepas cómo aplicarlo.
• Que tu análisis impulse entregas de valor iterativas e incrementales.

¿Qué esperamos de vos?
• Que tengas experiencia documentando y realizando historias de usuario, diagramas UML.
• Que moderes reuniones y ¡sean efectivas!
• Que tengas un gran entendimiento de la definición de un servicio y puedas testearlo a través de una herramienta.
• Que puedas entender la arquitectura de un sistema es una gran ventaja.
• Que la descosas realizando el slicing de una funcionalidad.
• Que tu capacidad analítica y skills de negociación nos sorprendan.
• Que conozcas técnicas, como story mapping, impact mapping, bocetado, etc.

¿Qué ofrecemos?
• Ajustes salariales trimestrales.
• 10 días hábiles de vacaciones.
• Semana redbee, 5 días off extra para que te tomes cuando quieras.
• Días off a demanda: tu cumpleaños, el civil de un amigo, tu graduación, etc.
• Licencias extendidas
• Trabajo remoto y horario flexible.
• Prepaga para vos y tu familia.
• Reintegro de internet.
• Saldo mensual en PedidosYa u otra plataforma.
• Clases de inglés.
• Plataformas de e-learning.

¿Quiénes somos?

Somos redbee, una empresa que aporta innovación con tecnología. Nuestra esencia es transformar clientes, industrias, metodologías y personas. Ideamos, construimos y lanzamos productos de software.

Si estás buscando formar parte de un equipo que crea productos tecnológicos de calidad, ¡sumate al panal! Si querés saber más, acá tenés más info para que nos conozcas

title: Business Analyst | (K64)
location: buenos aires ville autonome buenos aires argentine
description:
At Inclusion The Cloud Company, a business that offers tech solutions and services worldwide, we are looking for an operations & business analyst to join our team.

Their main goal will be working with the Operations team in order to manage and provide useful information for decision-making.

Main responsibilities: Reporting to stakeholders (Operations, Finance and Human Resources) on the status of requirements and project progress, engaging in the management of necessary project and service milestones Pipeline management and analysis to support proper planning and resource needs Generate project progress reports (execution, planning, and economic performance) Participate in the monitoring and evaluation of results and achievement of goals Act as internal consultant or mentor for project teams on topics such as: strategic alignment, project and team performance, methodology, technology and tools implementation and risk management.

Collaborate in the monitoring and control of the... processes of the Quality Management System.

Analysis of new business opportunities Project evaluation Accompany and monitor the status of key projects Requisitos: Recent graduate or advanced student of Engineering, Systems Analysis, Business Studies, or related fields Proficient in Excel, Power

Point, and Share

Point More than two years of experience in the management of businesses and/or budgets Three or more years of experience working in S&OP; or Business Planning areas, in technology companies (preferred) Outstanding written communication skills Demonstrated ability to solve business problems, with experience in managing commercial / technological information and relationship with business decision-makers Great analytics skills, attention to details and multitasking Experience in project management software (Jira) Intermediate or advanced English level Beneficios Swiss Medical Group Plan for the entire family group.

Training and development: Courses and certifications provided by the company.

English classes (refund up to $ 2500).

Special paternity and maternity leaves.

Physical training with virtual classes

reduce_description: tampa national +50 miles away pulsepoint, national +50 miles away minimum of 5 years related position is $20.60 to $34. $20.60 to $34. locations: california; purchase and 401k contribution (all disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock a fortune 20 company with growing top 20 fortune 500 vaccinated against covid-19. if you work in 2022, has been of the 2023 worlds most 20 fortune 500 company. to or call 1-877-204-7664
title: Business Analyst I | (ZW-124)
description:
Business Analyst I in San Juan , Puerto Rico

Business Analyst I

Job Family: Business Support

Type: Full time

Location:

FL, TAMPA

National +50 Miles away from nearest PulsePoint, National +50 Miles away from nearest PulsePoint

Description

Business Analyst I

Location: REMOTE

The Business Analyst I is responsible for assisting with the translation of business needs into application software requirements. This is the entry-level in a career progression.

How you will make an impact:

Participates in developing and/or modifying requirements, business design specifications, user training and documentation.

Researches and documents business issues.

Translates business requirements to technical staff to ensure that requirements are incorporated into system design.

Tests and documents solutions. Serves as liaison between users of the software and technical staff.

Requires a HS diploma or equivalent and minimum of 5 years related health care experience that includes work flow... design, data analysis, and/or systems automation and testing; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.

Preferred Skills, Capabilities and Experiences:

BA/BS degree preferred. Understanding of business processes and systems capability strongly preferred.

For candidates working in person or remotely in the below locations, the salary range for this specific position is $20.60 to $34.

Locations: California; Colorado; Nevada; Washington State; Jersey City, NJ; New York City, NY; Ithaca, NY and Westchester County, NY.

In addition to your salary, Elevance Health offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). The salary offered for this specific position is based on a number of legitimate, nondiscriminatory factors set by the company. The company is fully committed to ensuring equal pay opportunities for equal work regardless of gender, race, or any other category protected by federal, state, and local pay equity laws.

The salary range is the range Elevance Health in good faith believes is the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. This range may be modified in the future and actual compensation may vary from posting based on geographic location, work experience, education and/or skill level. Even within the range, the actual compensation will vary depending on the above factors as well as market/business considerations. No amount is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable under the terms and conditions of the applicable policies and plans. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.

Please be advised that Elevance Health only accepts resumes from agencies that have a signed agreement with Elevance Health. Accordingly, Elevance Health is not obligated to pay referral fees to any agency that is not a party to an agreement with Elevance Health. Thus, any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Elevance Health.

Be part of an Extraordinary Team

Elevance Health is a health company dedicated to improving lives and communities – and making healthcare simpler. A Fortune 20 company with a longstanding history in the healthcare industry, we are looking for leaders at all levels of the organization who are passionate about making an impact on our members and the communities we serve. You will thrive in a complex and collaborative environment where you take action and ownership to solve problems and lead change. Do you want to be part of a larger purpose and an evolving, high-performance culture that empowers you to make an impact?

We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, and incentive bonus programs (unless covered by a collective bargaining agreement), medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock purchase plan, life insurance, wellness programs and financial education resources, to name a few.

The health of our associates and communities is a top priority for Elevance Health. We require all new candidates in certain patient/member-facing roles to become vaccinated against COVID-19. If you are not vaccinated, your offer will be rescinded unless you provide – and Elevance Health approves – a valid religious or medical explanation as to why you are not able to get vaccinated that Elevance Health is able to reasonably accommodate. Elevance Health will also follow all relevant federal, state and local laws.

Elevance Health has been named as a Fortune Great Place To Work in 2022, has been ranked for five years running as one of the 2023 World’s Most Admired Companies by Fortune magazine, and is a growing Top 20 Fortune 500 Company. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at careers.ElevanceHealth.com. Elevance Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, citizenship status, color, creed, disability, ethnicity, genetic information, gender (including gender identity and gender expression), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other status or condition protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact *******@icareerhelp.com for assistance.

EEO is the Law

Equal Opportunity Employer / Disability / Veteran

Please use the links below to review statements of protection from discrimination under Federal law for job applicants and employees.

EEO Policy Statement

Know Your Rights

Pay Transparency

Privacy Notice for California Residents

Elevance Health, Inc. is anE-verify Employer (https://www.e-verify.gov/sites/default/files/everify/posters/EVerifyParticipationPoster.pdf)

Need Assistance?

Email us (**************@icareerhelp.com) or call 1-877-204-7664

title: Senior iOS Developer - (Video and Photo Editing Application) ...
description:
ABOUT US:

Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.

ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:

When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.
• JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)
• LOCATION: Remote-Work from anywhere
• HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $70 – $100/hr
• ESTIMATED DURATION: 30h/week - Short term
• BRAINTRUST JOB ID: 7086

THE OPPORTUNITY

Requirements
• 4+ years of experience working on mobile applications on iOS
• Robust experience using Swift
• Must have strong experience with Core Image and AVFoundation. Experience with Metal is also a plus.
• Expertise in photo and video editing on... iOS
• Experience collaborating closely with design and product
• A willingness to wear many hats and work on a small team with massive growth potential
What you’ll be working on

About Tezza:

The Art of Life. That's what we're all about. Empowering everyone to discover their inner artist, unlock their creative potential, and make their life their art. Tezza has grown tremendously with this mission in mind since launching in July of 2018, quickly rising to the forefront of the photo and video editing space with 3 million monthly active users and over 15 million downloads. We are building the ultimate platform for creative expression, bringing the worlds of art, design and fashion together in one beautiful space.

What You'll Be Doing:
• Working with a small team of developers bringing the full creative vision of Tezza to life.
• Building Studio - our robust video editing feature. This will allow users to cut, trim, splice together photos and videos, add music, and apply effects.
• Building out dynamic photo and video effects:
• Vintage film emulation
• Animated frames
• Lens flares, dust, textures, etc.
• Write clean and maintainable idiomatic code
• Collaborate with design and product in creating, testing, and implementing new features
• Build out your own creative ideas when it comes to video and photo creation. We want someone who has their own vision of how to make beautiful photos and videos!

Apply Now!

C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.

Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status

title: iOS Developer
description:
TheFork, a TripAdvisor Company, is the European leader in online restaurant booking.

We are an innovative and fast-growing company building a unique community to transform the way people eat out TheFork's goal is to become the #1 app for online restaurant booking world-wide.

The Team

The TheFork Payment Team is a group of talented people passionate about tech products that have the target to bring the world of digital payments into the TheFork company.
We deal with digital payments transactions in the form of 4 main products:
• Prepayment on bookings;
• Credit Card Guarantee on bookings (a sort of reservation insurance);
• Pay at The Table after having a meal;
• Giftcards payments after having a meal;

We are looking for an experienced engineer to join our team to achieve the goal of laying the foundations for the TheFork Payment Platform to create and develop new amazing payment features in the next 5 years.

Some Numbers
• 100k Bookable Restaurants Worldwide
- ~30 Countries
• 35M... Active Users
• 100k Payments Processed

The Role
• Writing clean, concise code in Swift
• Working with other engineers through discussions, code review, guilds and pair programming
• Collaborating with designers, product managers, and other engineers to iterate on new features
-
Your profile
• Passionate about software development
• You look forward to joining a company with technical challenges due to high traffic & everevolving business
• Experience working on iOS development (2 years minimum) and familiar with iOS design principles, patterns, and best practices
• Experience working with Swift or similar language
• Ability to think of the customer and the business in order to solve problems and get stuff done
• You are enthusiastic, proactive and stimulated by teamwork
• You are a real team player and care about your teammates
• You are willing to engage in a long term, nonexclusive relationship with a codebase
• You are comfortable writing and speaking in English
• One way or another, you're curious about food

Nice to Have
• You are comfortable with Clean Architecture principles
• You are able to make autonomous decisions based on product requirements
• You are used to writing Unit tests, integration tests
• You are able to build your UI programmatically
• You are able to manage complexity in a large project, and incur technical debt only after considering the tradeoffs
• You have experience using GraphQL APIs
• You have experience in working with remote teams

About our i

OS App:
• Swift (80%), Redux Architecture, PromiseKit, Apollo GraphQL
• Fastlane, Quick & Nimble
• Github Actions, Firebase
• Compatible with iOS 12+
• Crash Free : 99,8%
• 4,7 Stars on AppStore

Benefits
• Chance to make an enormous
impact in a rapidly
growing Tech Company
• TripAdvisor
stocks
-
3 weeks vacation
-
OSDE Medical Coverage
• 15% discount on
Viator (offers tickets for tours and activities)
-
LinkedIn Learning (Full access to the E-learning Platform)
-
Hertz's Gold Plus Reward membership
-
Office Food (coffee, milk, cookies, cereal, etc)
-
Happy fridays on the office*-
Fun times: Team buildings and day out to have fun with your team
• Lifestyle benefit 400€ or equivalent a year
• Flexible working policy for 2022 with allowance
• Life and long term disability insurance
• Parental leave 30 days
• Employee assistance plan & worklife (Optum)
• Calm app access
• Meal Vouchers
• Paid Time Off

title: Developer Support Engineer
description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: South America, North America

This offer from "RevenueCat" has been enriched by Jobgether and got a 87.75% flex score.
About us:

RevenueCat makes building, analyzing, and growing mobile subscriptions easy. We launched as part of Y Combinator's summer 2018 batch and today are handling more than $2B of in-app purchases annually across thousands of apps.

We are a mission driven, remote-first company that is building the standard for mobile subscription infrastructure. Top apps like VSCO, Notion, and ClassDojo count on RevenueCat to power their subscriptions at scale.

Our 60 team members (and growing!) are located all over the world, from San Francisco to Madrid to Taipei. We're a close-knit, product-driven team, and we strive to live our core values: Customer Obsession, Always Be Shipping, Own It, and Balance.

We’re looking for a Developer Support Engineer to help provide a great experience for developers integrating the RevenueCat... SDK into their apps. As a member of our support engineering team, you’ll work directly with Engineering and Product to create an excellent developer experience and achieve our mission of helping developers make more money.
About you:
• You have at least 2 years experience in an engineering or technical role.
• You have an understanding of the mobile development and release process.
• You have experience in either iOS (Swift / Objective-C) or Android (Java / Kotlin)
• You have an interest in "wearing many hats," doing what it takes to help developers every day.
• You have experience debugging code issues utilizing stack traces. You will be identifying why apps aren’t working, often with limited information.
• You have excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills: You will be writing, presenting to and speaking with developers and colleagues daily.
• You have empathy for developers and their development/learning process: we usually hear from developers at their lowest and need to be understanding.
• You have a demonstrated creative problem-solving approach and strong analytical skills.
• You’re able to overlap your core working hours with Central Time Zone.
• Bonus points if you’ve used RevenueCat before or have shipped your own app.
In the first month, you'll:
• Learn the common frustrations our customers have, and help them ship their apps
• Make improvements to our docs and support articles
• Work with engineering to untangle complex tickets
Within the first 3 months, you'll:
• Make product suggestions that will improve the developer experience and reduce support
• Build internal apps to test and reproduce issues
• Work directly with customers to assist with onboarding and solution engineering
Within the first 6 months, you'll:
• Identify key problem areas for developers and make targeted improvements that help developers
• Improve and create internal tools and dashboards for support and other internal processes
• Make significant contributions to the support process that helps you and your teammates be more efficient
Within the first 12 months, you'll:
• Develop a super-hero like intuition for the root causes of tickets and become an expert troubleshooter
• Interview, hire and mentor additional support engineers
• Discover new and unexpected ways to delight developers with our support experience
What we offer:
• $107,000 USD Salary regardless of your location
• Competitive equity in a fast-growing, Series B startup backed by top tier investors including Y Combinator
• 10 year window to exercise vested equity options
• Fully remote work environment that promotes autonomy and flexibility
• Suggested 4 to 5 weeks time off to recharge and focus on mental, physical, and emotional health
• $2,000 USD to build your personal workspace
• $1,000 USD annual stipend for your continuous learning and growth

USD Salary regardless of your location • Competitive equity in a fast-growing Series B startup backed by top tier investors including Y Combinator • 10 year window to exercise vested equity options • Fully remote work environment that promotes autonomy and flexibility • Suggested 4 to 5 weeks time off to recharge and focus on mental physical and emotional health • $2000 USD to build your personal workspace • $1000 USD annual stipend for your continuous learning and growth

reduce_description: magic leap 2 platform, including in c/c++ (5+ years) able salary range $123,000$172,000 usd anywhere
title: Senior, High Performance Embedded Software Engineer
description:
Title:Senior, High Performance Embedded Software Engineer
Location: Remote (US and Canada based only)
Job Description

In this position, you will work with Magic Leap’s Computer Vision Software Architecture team developing and optimizing cvengine – the software that drives all perception algorithms on the Magic Leap 2 platform, including head pose, eye tracking, and more. You will help provide the perception algorithm teams new features, improve cvengine test coverage, enhance data collection and visualization tools, and contribute to performance analysis and optimizations.
Responsibilities
• Design, implement, document, test, and integrate features for cvengine
• Debug issues across the software stack to understand the root cause. Propose, code test, and integrate fixes for these bugs. If multiple solutions are available, analyze and articulate the trade-offs between the various solutions.
• Analyze and optimize the software stack in a heterogeneous computing environment, utilizing... the features unique to the architecture in efficient ways
• Help drive the integration and development of necessary tooling and automation. (profiling, testing/verification, monitoring, etc) that allows the team to move faster and more confidently
Qualifications
• Strong programming skills in C/C++ (5+ years)
• Able to work with a remote team, with members in different time zones
• Strong CS fundamentals, data structures and algorithms, problem-solving
• Able to produce high quality code consistent with the goals and constraints in an embedded development environment
• Experience with high throughput, low latency or real time systems or simulations
• Multi-process and/or multi-threaded development experience
• Experience with source code practices like git, repo, and code reviews
Preferred / additional skills:
• Willingness to support developers working on top of the team’s APIs
• Interest in build systems, automation, metrics collection and/or data analysis
• Experience with GPU programming platforms like CUDA or high performance architectures like VLIW, SIMD
• Experience analyzing and optimizing large systems against multiple competing performance criteria
• Experience with computer vision, sensors (cameras, time-of-flight), or image processing
• Working knowledge of Python
Education
• BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience required
Additional Information
• All your information will be kept confidential according to Equal Employment Opportunities guidelines

Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location. In addition to salary, Magic Leap offers a discretionary bonus, equity, and a fully comprehensive benefits package for eligible employees.
US Base Salary Range
$123,000$172,000 USD

title: Data Scientist
description:
Multiple Locations - Remote

UTC -03:00 — UTC +03:00

More details

Permanent / Contractor - 24 months

Gross annual salary: €30.000 - €90.000

Data Scientist

At least 5 years of experience - Senior

Requires work permit

Language(s): Required English

SKILLS

Must have:

Data Science

NLP

Machine Learning

Other Required:

Big Data

Python

DESCRIPTION

We are expanding our data science team!

We are looking for a brilliant NLP expert / Data Scientist to join our team and work on solving the most challenging issues in the travel industry.

In this position, you will be part of building machine-learning models that identify relations within the data and identify the relation between them.

Responsibilities

Create new ML & NLP Models and improve the current models

Pre/processing of un/structured data and identifying patterns and identifying valuable insights.

Thinking of new ideas on how to improve the company's performance

What is Pruvo?

Hotel prices tend to drop after... reservations are made.

Pruvo is an innovative, award-winning hotel price monitoring service that helps travellers & travel companies reduce hotel booking prices by rebooking when the hotel price drops.

www.pruvoai.com

REQUIREMENTS

The following requirements are a must:

NLP EXPERT!!!

VertexAI

Python

ML, and other models

Proven experience as a data scientist and data mining with strong mathematical skills

Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering or similar.

REMOTE DETAILS

To apply for this job you must be willing to work in the time zones between UTC -03:00 and UTC +03:00.

i

This job also accepts contractors

A contractor is someone who works as an independent worker or through their own company to provide services to 1 client at a time on a mid to long-term project basis. This is a great option to work remotely to companies from abroad.

SHOW ME JOBS THAT ACCEPT CONTRACTORS

reduce_description: by over 3,500 non-profits and at least 5 years of minimum usd 5k + bonus anywhere
title: Full Stack JavaScript Developer
description:
This is a remote position open to applicants living in Argentina or Uruguay.

Would you like to work on meaningful, ambitious projects with an exceptional team?

Rotunda is seeking an experienced Full Stack JavaScript Developer to help create a new generation of software tools for non-profits. Our flagship products are actively used by over 3,500 non-profits and one million volunteers. The person who fills this position will contribute to these robust, well-established products while also architecting brand new tools to help non-profits make the world a better place. In addition to excellent technical skills, this position requires attention to detail, and the ability to work well in a fast-paced, flexible, and ego-free environment.

Our proprietary, modularized frontend framework is built using open source tools developed at Rotunda in conjunction with James Halliday (a.k.a @substack), and our sophisticated backend infrastructure is built with technologies that include node.js... Express, PostgreSQL, and AWS Lambda, and an isomorphic JavaScript domain layer. The individual who fills this position will be able to learn, leverage, and curate these unique and powerful tools.

Rotunda is a talented, dedicated, international team, passionate about doing meaningful work and building extraordinary products that people love. Our mission is to help people do good things, and our unique culture is rooted in a set of shared values.

Responsibilities
• Participate in three week, self-regulated development sprints
• Learn and leverage our specialized frontend and backend frameworks
• Implement elegant, intricate, and responsive user experiences using JavaScript
• Write well structured, polished HTML and SCSS for pages and components
• Help design, develop, and test backend application logic using Node.js
• Carefully track action items to maintain the efficiency of the team
• BS in Computer Science or equivalent work experience
• At least 5 years of working experience with JavaScript, HTML & CSS
• Experience with Node.js, Express, relational databases, and AWS
• Professional Working Proficiency in English
• A love for simple, elegant solutions to complex problems
• Attention to detail and a love for polished user experiences
• The ability to work well in a service-focused, ego-free environment
• A desire to do great work on meaningful products
• Salary determined by experience, minimum USD 5K + bonus
• Flexible working hours
• A freedom unique to self-funded, profitable companies
• A strong, closely-knit team
• A focus on growth including one-on-one mentoring and capacity building courses
• Work-life balance and a fully remote work environment done right
• Retreats (past destinations include Uruguay, San Francisco, Mexico, and Costa Rica)
• Paid sabbatical program

title: Senior Software Engineer (Java, Angular) - Op0882
description: Join Dev.Pro - a US-based outsource software development company that has been delivering exceptional software experience to our clients since 2011. We invite a Software Engineer to join our company and contribute to the enhancement of a large enterprise project. You will work on a system that supports merchants through offering a secure channel for various types of transactions. The system has components that are responsible for data collection, fraud detection, authentication, transaction authorization, validation, and more. What's in it for you : Dev.Pro delivers full SDLC. We follow agile processes and use Scrum and Kanban Numerous opportunities and challenges: discovering customer problems, designing solutions, and working on various integrations You will be able to validate your ideas and become a part of the collective mind Is that you? 4+ years' Java experience delivering backend services Experience with frameworks and tools like J2EE, Hibernate, Jenkins, Git, Java module... system, Gradle, Docker Experience with Kubernetes Hands-on experience with JavaScript (Angular) Creative problem solving, strong debugging and troubleshooting skills Readiness to take responsibility for tasks, focus on business needs and final goals Good communication and presentation skills Hands-on experience with databases (OracleDB is preferable) and data integration Hands-on experience with AWS or at least one of Cloud providers (GCP, Azure) Knowledge of and practical experience with different architectures, patterns, and programming paradigms Intermediate English level or higher Key responsibilities and your contribution to Dev.Pro Be responsible for developing, discussing, approving technical decisions and having them implemented Actively participate in the preparation of architecture, technical design, proposals and diagrams Perform integrations with different 3rd party services, work in tailored SCRUM-driven team Communicate and cooperate with engineering teams, internal and external project stakeholders Build an admin functionality for monitoring & limiting user's access to funds to be compliant with regulations What's working at Dev.Pro like? Here, we appreciate your contribution and value you add to projects. We are a diverse, mature company with an ambitious and creative mindset. Joining Dev.Pro, you'll feel what it's like to grow with professionals who support your journey. Grow by learning: you have a chance to shift your career path, access English practicums, online training programs, webinars, and workshops. We cover courses that move your career forward Make sure compensation matches your efforts: we provide payments in US dollars and cover overtimes Join fun online activities and team-building events Maintain work-life balance with 30 paid rest days per year, including paid holidays Get continuous remote HR and payroll support Our next steps : Intro call with a Recruiter —Interview —Offer Pay: $21,000.00 - $29,000.00 per month

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Senior software engineer (full-stack) | Remote

This is a remote full time role and can be held from anywhere in the world. We are fully remote from day one. Our team is spread across UK, India and Australia.

About the role

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer at Chronicle to join the founding team and shape a product that will impact millions of users.

Our user experience is one of the most crucial parts of delivering a game-changing tool. We are looking for a strong and motivated developer who has a passion for building delightful productivity tools and wants to build for the future of work.

We use NodeJs + Typescript for our main backend service and React (with NextJs) + Typescript for our frontend codebase. We use GraphQL as a bridge between our frontend-backend. PostgreSQL is our main relational database. We have an in-house state management library that maintains the client-side state and a custom solution for Real-Time Collaboration using Socket.io

What you’ll do... at Chronicle

In 30 days you will
• Be paired with a chronicle companion, who will help you take on board our stack and get you to know Chronicle better
• Be a part of our sprint planning & review, monthly retrospectives, and start taking ownership of some tickets as you navigate through Chronicle’s codebase and understand the overall architecture
• Begin contributing towards product feedback by creating decks using chronicle

In 60 days you will
• Take full ownership of a feature from start to end. Plan the time and efforts for the tasks and subtasks. Collaborate with the design team and flag any potential issues with the feature. Run any necessary research spikes before we start building the feature.
• Chime in on new ways that you think can improve our flow and process. Pitch in with new tools or programming libraries/frameworks that can enhance our current build

In 90 days and beyond you will
• Own a complete module/subproject and ship multiple features in it. Set up a test framework for the module and handle code reviews for software patches that have an impact on it
• Participate in product brainstorming sessions and help design the longer product roadmap
• Discuss personal goals for learning and development and come up with a plan along with the team to accomplish them
• Be a part of refining and conducting the hiring process and help in growing the team
• Take mentorship responsibilities – help fellow team members to reach their goals
• Contribute to the overall engineering culture- in terms of how we build, communicate and test the product
• Grow with us — whether as a product leader, an engineering manager, or an individual contributor, we’ll invest in you

You will be a good fit if you
• Have 6+ years of extensive experience in full stack development, preferably seen a product scale and been a part of the 0-1 journey
• Have strong knowledge of SQL (preferably PostgreSQL) and NoSQL databases
• Can design API services using either GraphQL or REST
• Can write kickass code in NodeJS and ReactJS
• Have experience in building microservices and designing event-based architecture
• Passionate about building frontend libraries for Web 2.0
• Are comfortable picking up new stacks and choosing the right tool to get the job done

We’d love it if you
• Have experience in building creation tools
• Made any open source contributions to frontend tools
• Have any kind of DevOps experience; preferably AWS
• Have experience building Real Time Collaboration (RTC) in a digital product
• Have strong opinions but are not ideologically tied to specific technologies; naturally curious and willing to take a step to learn something you don’t have experience in
• We’re looking for people who are excited about what we’re doing — if you believe that presentations are up for a radical disruption and are motivated to build a meaningful, delightful solution – this is the role for you

Why join us

We are solving a very interesting problem that will impact millions of users changing the way people craft and tell powerful stories every day. We are passionate to help anyone deliver presentations that are not just bearable, but enjoyable.
• We are a diverse and fast-paced and energetic startup team. We offer an opportunity to build the next big productivity tool with some of the smartest people in the space.
• We are learners at heart and we provide you free books of your choice every quarter, have regular lunch, and learn with the best leaders in tech
• Competitive salaries with ESOPs, performance-based bonuses, and raises
• We are remote from day one and support you to work from wherever you want by covering your home office expenses, hooking you up with the latest technology (think M2 chip Macs)
• We offer complete remote work, flex hours, and lots of wind-down opportunities, our be-well program offers $1000 per year that you can spend on whatever keeps you well
