title: Project Manager - Tech Startup 🚐 - 🚩 Remote
company_name: Prometeo Talent | High-quality HR & recruitment services
description:
Prometeo Talent | High-quality HR & recruitment services company opens jobs for Project Manager - Tech Startup 🚐 - 🚩 Remote positions in the Brazil region. The type of work we provide is Full-time.

The criteria for the employees we need are having Project Management and Information Technology skills with Entry level experience, as well as employees who are honest, disciplined and responsible.

The estimated salary offered by this company is quite competitive around R$ 1.200 - R$ 2.500 (per month). However, the salary can go up or down depending on the company that decides it.

The Headhunters company itself is engaged in Staffing and Recruiting, of course if you are interested in applying for this company, you can register immediately.

Job Info:
• Company: Prometeo Talent | High-quality HR & recruitment services
• Position: Project Manager - Tech Startup 🚐 - 🚩 Remote
• Region: Brazil
• Job Function: Project Management and Information Technology
• Seniority Level: Entry level
•... Salary: BRL 1.212 - BRL 2.500 per Month
• Employment Type: Full-time
• Industry: Staffing and Recruiting

Job description

About the company:

RoverPass, a startup in the RV park and campground industry, is revolutionizing the way campgrounds and RV parks drive business. With a property management system and marketing services, they help campgrounds and RV parks attract more customers. As a small and hungry team, they’re looking for hands-on individuals to join them.

We are a small team and require a hands-on and hungry approach.

https://ww.youtube.com/watch?v=RaycWHRyof8

Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly organized and proactive Product Project Manager to oversee the successful go-live of our premium website product. The ideal candidate will have excellent project management skills and the ability to coordinate with various stakeholders, including customers, the SEO team, and writers. This role will involve a combination of onboarding duties and project management tasks to ensure seamless execution and customer satisfaction.

Responsibilities:

Customer Onboarding and Support:

Serve as the primary point of contact for customers throughout the onboarding process, providing a high level of support, guidance, and assistance.

Conduct onboarding sessions with customers, understanding their requirements, goals, and timelines for website development.

Coordinate with customers to collect necessary information, such as content, images, and branding guidelines, to ensure a smooth website building process.

Address customer inquiries, concerns, and technical issues promptly, providing clear and concise explanations and resolutions.

Collaborate with the customer support team to ensure a positive customer experience and resolve any post-launch issues.

Project Planning and Coordination:

Collaborate with the SEO team, writers, designers, and developers to define project requirements, deliverables, and timelines.

Create and maintain project plans, outlining tasks, dependencies, and milestones to ensure successful project execution.

Allocate resources, including team members, tools, and budget, to meet project objectives.

Regularly communicate project progress to stakeholders, including customers, management, and cross-functional teams.

Identify and mitigate potential risks and issues that may impact project delivery or customer satisfaction.

Foster effective communication and collaboration among team members, ensuring alignment and efficient workflow

Content Management and SEO Integration:

Coordinate with writers to ensure timely delivery of high-quality content aligned with customer requirements and SEO best practices.

Collaborate with the SEO team to integrate relevant keywords, meta tags, and optimization strategies into the website content.

Review and provide feedback on content drafts, ensuring they meet quality standards and align with customer expectations.

Oversee the implementation of SEO techniques to enhance website visibility, search engine rankings, and organic traffic.

Quality Assurance and Testing:

Establish quality standards for website development and ensure adherence throughout the project lifecycle.

Collaborate with the development and design teams to conduct thorough testing of website functionalities, usability, and responsiveness.

Identify and resolve any bugs, errors, or inconsistencies in collaboration with the development team.

Conduct user acceptance testing (UAT) to ensure the website meets customer requirements and provides an optimal user experience.

Project Documentation and Reporting:

Document project scope, requirements, and specifications, ensuring clarity and alignment among all stakeholders.

Prepare regular project status reports, highlighting achievements, challenges, and key performance indicators (KPIs).

Present project updates, deliverables, and milestones to management and stakeholders during meetings and presentations.

Conduct post-project evaluations to identify lessons learned, best practices, and areas for improvement.

Requirements:
• Proven experience as a project manager, preferably in the software development or technology industry.
• Strong understanding of project management methodologies, tools, and best practices.
• Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills to effectively collaborate with team members, stakeholders, and customers.
• Problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities to address project-related challenges and make informed decisions.
• Proficiency in project management software and tools.
• Familiarity with website building and SEO concepts is a plus.
• PMP certification or similar credentials are desirable but not mandatory.

🏆 Potential for Growth

This role has the potential for growth within the company, with opportunities for advancement based on performance and company needs.

🌞 Work-Life Balance & Benefits

At RoverPass, they believe in a strong work-life balance and offer flexible working hours and 100% remote work opportunities. They also offer a comprehensive benefits package, including:
• Flexible Working Hours 🤸🏻⏰
• 100% remote work 🏡
• Competitive USD salary 🤩
• Paid Time Off / vacations 💪🏻🏝
• Local Holidays 🗓
• Paid Maternity/Paternity Leave 🐣

Benefit
• Comfortable environment
• Taught when starting work
• Salary bonus if there is overtime

title: Commercial Construction Project Manager
description:
Click here to watch the video from the President of Fiorilli Construction:

At Fiorilli Construction, the team are dedicated, passionate, creative, hard-working commercial construction professionals who believe in providing outstanding services along with a great built environment product. They love the construction industry, are exceptional at what they do, and provide S.M.A.R.T. solutions to their clients' construction anxieties within 24 hours.

They have integrity in all they do and believe in contributing to an amazing work environment by utilizing cutting-edge cool services. They live by the philosophy of work hard, play hard. The team are passionate about their lifestyle and creating the "Fiorilli Family" experience for both their co-workers and clients.

At the end of the day, B uilding S ynergistic A uthentic R elationshipsTM (BSAR) is their #1 priority. Working at Fiorilli Construction is not just a job, but a passion and they bring that to each project that they do.

Right... now, Fiorilli Construction is looking for a Commercial Construction Project Manager. In this role, you would contribute to continuous growth for the greater good, whilst working with an amazing company and professional and fun team.

The company's primary goal for your position is to utilise your skills as a Project Manager for all variations of projects, large or small, timing with other assignments permitting. Your position will require you to manage a large flow of multiple projects at times, including job site visit travel, depending upon the workflow company-wide as determined at the discretion of the company.

More specifically, you will be responsible for:
• Project Management; you will:
• be responsible for project relationships, profitability, and cost controls for assigned projects i.e. production, scheduling, procurement, monitoring, and enhancement for construction projects that are assigned to you
• deliver projects on time and within the budget, whilst enhancing relationships
• maintain scorecards with escalation procedures
• Assist and support subcontractors with ProCore requisitions including inquiring about payment
• Assist in the tombstoning of a project to ensure all subcontractors and vendors are paid in full.
• Project Process Management; you will:
• Vet new corporate vendors
• Review all intended scopes and costing with ownership and the FCI team for any project before release/commencement
• Resolves issues effectively by seeing real problems, being comfortable with conflict, calling out the problems, and solving the problems practically
• Reporting and Forecasting; you will:
• Maintain reporting scorecards
• Oversee and check monthly billing projections
• Provide project status reports and profit projections
• Summarise and document progress, gross profit, and net income on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis
• Project Assignment; you will:
• Own the start date and all requirements needed for job start-up
• Manage, schedule and forecast all subcontractors for the projects with your manager
• Oversee the scheduling of assigned projects to ensure quality, efficiency, and safety control
• Collaborate with your manager on the status of your project
• Update the Project List repository weekly
• Client/Sub Relationship Responsibilities; you will:
• Identify possible subcontractors eligible for early payment discounts
• Evaluate the financial impact on gross profit and cash flow for eligible payment discounts for subcontractors.
• Lead interface to include a relationship with clients, subcontractors, and co-workers on all assigned construction project activities
• Effectively collaborate and stay on the same page with the team
• Uphold the core values of the company

Although the company counts on your experience and expertise, you will have two weeks of orientation and initial training which will entail reviewing all company systems and roles so that you familiarise yourself with the company.

To excel in this role, you need to have:
• 2 - 3 years of experience working in a large-scale professional commercial construction environment
• Strong accountability, problem-solving for the greater good, and the ability to maintain solid relationships
• Attention to detail in conjunction with excellent communication skills
• Ability to learn new software quickly; you are tech-savvy

Brownie points for:
• Experience in EOS Worldwide
• Experience in Jonas Premier cloud-based software for project management and estimating
• University degree in Architecture or a related field

What's in it for you?
• Monthly salary of $3500 - $4500*
• Full-time and fully remote role
• Flexible working hours with some overlap with the US time zones
• Paid Vacation Time Off (PVTO) up to a total of 80 hours PTVO time as accrued is available annually
• Paid Sick Time Off (PSTO) up to twenty-four (24) hours of sick time is available annually, with rollover
• Eligibility to enrol immediately in Fiorilli Construction's "Gain Share" Incentive Pay plan
• Concentrated Time Off (CTO) Work Shifts (aka '8.5/80' Plan). The team follow a 2-week Work Shift (80 hours, 10 working days) that incorporates 8.5-hour days, Monday through Thursday (adding 2 hrs weekly), with every other Friday requiring only a 4-hour shift (1/2 day). That's approximately 26 Friday afternoons OFF
• Holiday pay - all major holidays including Christmas & New Year's Eve if falling on weekends
• Professional growth opportunities
• Please note that this is a gross salary and that you are responsible for any tax-related procedures in your country of residence. We kindly ask you to apply only if you are happy to work remotely as an independent contractor.

As they grow as a company, it has become more and more important to explicitly define the core values from which they develop its culture, brand, and business strategies. These are the five core values that we live by

The Fiorilli Construction team has local professionals as well as international employees and virtual employees. The company offers in-person, hybrid, remote, and flex work policies that allow for maximum flexibility in today's work environment to get the results that are needed for everyone's success.

They leverage great vision, core values, metrics that are measurable in each role, accountability for all, core values, right people in the right seats, great problem solving, systems and processes that are followed by all at what they call 80% strong to achieve the maximum results for the greater good, understanding that the whole is greater than the individual and " we are greater than I" .

This position will be closed as soon as we find the perfect match . So, make sure to read the description carefully and take your time to submit a high-quality application that stands out.

If you apply, JobRack will respond promptly and keep you updated throughout the process.

As part of the hiring process, please then expect the process to include:

1 - Filling in the application form once you click "Apply"

2 - Being invited to record a short video to introduce yourself

3 - Completing test tasks, if short-listed

4 - Attending video interviews where you will have the opportunity to talk more about your previous experience and the new role

Applications are only accepted through JobRack . Fiorilli Construction has specifically requested that you do not contact them directly. If you have any questions please contact us using

To make sure you receive updates on your application please add to your email address book. Got questions about working remotely? Check out JobRack's FAQ for answers to everything you might want to know

title: Ux Researcher Specialist (Remote)
description:
100% remote job

Ux Researcher Specialist | Digibee | Brazil

About Digibee

Digibee enables organizations to build flexible, highly scalable integration architecture. Founded in São Paulo, Brazil, in 2017, our team is based throughout the Americas with offices in Florida.

Our platform allows enterprises to compete and excel in today’s rapidly changing digital environment. Ten times faster than other systems, Digibee is the preferred e-iPaaS solution for 250+ corporate customers, including Accenture, B3, Carrefour, Payless, Santander, and others.

Integration is our Foundation. Everything is connected. Humanly, socially, and technologically – we rely on complex networks and ecosystems to live our lives. Digibee is one small part of this, building bridges with people, processes, and technology to help our customers unlock their true potential.

About The Role

The mission of the UX Design team at Digibee involves conducting research, studies, planning, interaction design, prototyping... performing validations and documenting results. We are focused on having the best impact on the business and the user experience, and for that it is expected that the members of the research team have critical thinking, business vision and a solid foundation in methodologies.

Here we are not afraid to experiment, be it tools, processes, techniques or methodologies. We seek excellence, willpower and a desire to always deliver the highest added value, which is why we are looking for a very capable User Researcher, full of energy to take us to new heights, ready to face challenges and not afraid of a highly technical product.

On a typical day, you will…
• Collaborate with leadership, strategic team, product management, product designers, and analytics to analyze and understand our target user, the context, and the competitive landscape.
• Define the experience vision for Digibee’s capabilities, and the related evolution of existing product experience.
• Working with different behavioral data tools and technical market research.
• Lead the end-to-end research process: from the construction to the delivery of insights. You will often be asked to bridge the gap between theory and tangibles in a creative way.
• Support the construction of our research repository, user base and the no notion course page.
• Being able to work flexibly on top of studies and stakeholders. Migrating from a holistic view to a funneled view in domains and vice versa (hybrid research team).
• Help to grow our research team, improve processes, participate in broader research topics and activities – cultural and technical.
• Coach other members of the team in your specialty

What You’ll Need To Bring
• Strong technical knowledge in research methodologies, construction of agile studies, being of urgency, combined with a passion for complex problem solving
• Strong product-thinking and decision-making skills, and an ability to connect business goals and user needs, supported by a user-centric and data-driven approach
• Exceptional systems thinking with an ability to scale information in to valuable insights.
• Experience in product research, data analysis, repository and complex journeys of different users.
• Experience working closely with product teams and strategic teams
• Advanced English

Nice to have
• Be unafraid of challenges that require technical acumen (superficial software engineering knowledge)
• Have worked on B2B environment

Location

Brazil / Remote

Our Perks And Benefits
• We’re remote first, with a flexible working schedule
• Health care
• R$ 1.200,00/month on Caju card (for food and meal allowance, mobility, home office supplies, culture, health, and education)
• Life insurance
• Child care assistance
• Gympass
• MacBook setup to work (Product roles)
• English course: we have a partnership for group classes for R$100 monthly

Our culture

We believe in a highly collaborative work environment in order to foster constant development and exchange between teams. We encourage learning, sharing knowledge, and using new technologies to create disruptive ideas – we want to create something great together!

At Digibee, we know it’s our people who make the difference. We embrace and value diversity and are dedicated to encouraging a supportive and respectful culture in our community.

We are interested in every qualified candidate eligible to work remotely in the country of this job posting. However, we are not able to sponsor visas for this position.

Exibir mais

Exibir menos

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Oportunidade para trabalhar em uma equipe com pessoas experientes na área de desenvolvimento, atendendo projetos com foco em qualidade.

A Blite é uma empresa que foca em trazer sinergia entre as pessoas, que sempre um possa contar com o outro e assim o ambiente ser mais saudável, construtivo e produtivo.

Algumas informações sobre a vaga: Buscamos uma pessoa para atuar como UX/UI no desenvolvimento de usabilidade e design, como protótipos, layouts, plataformas e wireframes.

Responsabilidade e atribuições:

• Criação de interfaces de produtos e plataformas digitais e fluxos de navegação em sistemas

• Documentar processos, boas práticas de acessibilidade e comportamentos dos elementos de interface

• Ser a ponte entre times para garantir soluções padronizadas.

Requisitos e qualificações:

• Experiência UX/UI na criação de interfaces de produtos e plataformas digitais e fluxos de navegação em sistemas

• Domínio de ferramentas de prototipação de interfaces e de design

• Perfil... questionador, conciliador, proativo e mão na massa, que gosta de fazer acontecer, ser flexível e cumprir o combinado

• Forte habilidade visual e de design

• Experiência em prototipagem em baixa e alta fidelidade

• Fornecer orientações sobre usabilidade e design

• Experiência em UI e portfólio

Informações Adicionais:

• Contrato PJ

• Pagamento mensal fixo

• Notebook

• Folgas Remuneradas

• Home office (segue home após pandemia)

• Horário 09:00 as 18:00

• Gympass

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Why join us

TRACTIAN is reimagining industrial systems so that every frontline maintenance worker can realize their full potential. We're building software and hardware in one place—disrupting long-standing institutions with products and experiences that better serve the ambitions of our clients.

Working at TRACTIAN allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Our team members have the autonomy needed to accomplish challenging goals. We are a growth-stage startup and you will work directly with the founders, helping to define the vision, product and user experience.

Product at TRACTIAN

The Product organization identifies and scopes out the most impactful opportunities for Tractian to tackle. Our Product team have a deep understanding of the business and are responsible for aligning cross-functional teams across the company around key decisions. They work most closely with the Engineering, Data and Design... teams to set a well thought-out product strategy and define a roadmap that ensures Tractian's products continue to evolve for the benefit of our customers.

What You'll Do

As an UI Designer you must have in-depth experience with product designs, high visual standards, and the user journey. The person who fills this role should also be experienced working cross functionally with key groups such as engineering, customer success, etc. Design areas will include focus on user needs, navigation, interaction design, and business/user process engineering.

Responsibilities

Lead products in Tractian's solution, including areas like condition monitoring, asset management, etc. Working closely with stakeholders across the organization

Develop and manage digital guidelines and requirements in alignment with overall brand for a variety of technologies (web, mobile, etc.)

Adhere to visual guidelines, CSS standards, UI library components and defined language for the web, and communicate, rationale and decisions supporting UI/UX collaboration

Design UI experiences and ensure consistency across all our digital properties (web, email, landing pages, etc.) and technologies (web, mobile, etc.)

Partner with engineering, operations and data teams to define new products and features and launch them

Requirements

At least 2-3 years of demonstrated ability as a User Experienceer involving human interactions.

Knowledge of UI and prototyping with a history of successful project execution and the ability to and build personas.

Knowledge of responsive grid systems in layouts

Must understand constraints such as browser capabilities, media types, platform differences, and operating systems.

Strong ability to craft a clear narrative and paint a vision that communicates and aligns teams

Quick learner with exceptional prioritization skills to deliver on multiple projects simultaneously.

Bonus Points

Experience With Figma Or Other UI Builders

Basic coding skills and programming logic!

Compensation

Competitive salary and stock options

R$800/mo for you to use with food in supermarkets, restaurants and delivery

GymPass so you don't sit/work all day

Optional fully funded English / Spanish courses

30 days of paid annual leave

Education and courses stipend

Earn a trip anywhere in the world every 4 years

Day off during the week of your birthday

R$200 a month for remote work allowance

Mental health support: we cover 40% of the cost of your therapy

Health plan with national coverage and without coparticipation

Dental Insurance: we help you with dental treatment for a better quality of life.

Sports Incentive: R$300/mo extra if you practice activities

Up to R$5.000 bonus for referring new Blue Caps

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Responsibilities:-
• 7+ years’ experience in Dev-Ops.
• 5+ years of Linux experience (CentOS). Windows server administration experience is a plus.
• Some development experience with a high-level language, preferably C# or Python.
• A strong understanding of infrastructure-level resources (networking, storage, I/O, computing) is necessary.
• Experience with modern application deployment models, such as blue/green and canary, is a must.
• Hands-on Azure experience - other cloud providers a plus.
• Experience with Hashicorp products (nomad, vault, terraform, consul, and packer).
• Kubernetes (K8s) is a plus.
• Hands-on experience working with Git (we use stash).
• Hands-on experience with Jenkins and/or GitLab.
• Working knowledge of Docker and containers.
• ElasticSearch management is a plus.

Qualifications:-
• Collaborate with our architecture, infrastructure, and core CRM development teams to automate operations for the development teams.
• Provide emergency incident response and... investigation.
• Deliver self-service tools for activities such as provisioning test environments.
• Configure dashboards and advise development teams on application instrumentation needs to support monitoring and capacity planning needs.
• Develop build pipelines and release management/continuous integration plans with tools such as Jenkins and Docker.
• Troubleshoot failed builds, collaborating with the appropriate development team when needed.
• Ensure the availability and recoverability of applications.
• Orchestrate applications (We use Nomad and Kubernetes).
• Write code to automate the provisioning of new infrastructure (we use Terraform and Ansible).
• Willingness to research and implement continuous improvements to processes and technologies users

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: From R$21,268.35 per month

title: Senior DevOps Engineer - IDP
description:
Why join us

TRACTIAN is reimagining industrial systems so that every frontline maintenance worker can realize their full potential. We're building software and hardware in one place—disrupting long-standing institutions with products and experiences that better serve the ambitions of our clients.

Working at TRACTIAN allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Our team members have the autonomy needed to accomplish challenging goals. We are a growth-stage startup and you will work directly with the founders, helping to define the vision, product and user experience.

Data at TRACTIAN

The Data team develops infrastructure, statistical models, and products using IoT data. Our Scientists and Engineers work together to make data—and insights derived from data—a core asset across the company. Our work is ingrained in Tractian’s decision-making process, in the efficiency of our operations and insights, and in... the industry-leading experience we provide our consumers.

What You'll Do

As a DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible for acting on tools and methodologies to balance needs throughout the software development life-cycle, from coding and deployment to maintenance and updates, for our Internal Developer Platform (IDP), built by a platform team to build golden paths and enable developer self-service. The right candidate will also be a highly self-motivated individual with the ability to work autonomously.

Responsibilities

Design, develop and maintain robust and reliable infrastructures that enables rapid and continuous delivery of software applications

Apply DevOps engineering practices that will generate security, speed, and quality on software deliveries

Select and deploy appropriate CI/CD tools

Diagnose complex problems that affect the performance of our solutions

Ensure reliability and scalability of our product

Translate functional requirements into technical specifications and perform hands-on development

Perform technical design and code reviews to maintain high-quality and secure software

Prepare technical project documentation

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Information Systems, or equivalent professional experience

+5 years experience with container orchestration (AWS ECS and others)

Advanced level on any of the scripting languages: Python, Bash, etc

Experience in Continuous Delivery & Continuous Integration (Github Actions)

Prior exposure to IaC Infrastructure as a Code using Terraform

Cloud Computing proximity (AWS)

Contact with observability tools, such as Grafana, Datadog, AWS Cloudwatch

Expertise with Scylla, Cassandra and/or Kafka

Microservices environments in a Kubernetes ecosystem

Bonus Points

Fluent English proficiency

Compensation

Competitive salary and stock options

R$800/mo for you to use with food in supermarkets, restaurants and delivery

GymPass so you don't sit/work all day

Optional fully funded English / Spanish courses

30 days of paid annual leave

Education and courses stipend

Earn a trip anywhere in the world every 4 years

Day off during the week of your birthday

R$200 a month for remote work allowance

Mental health support: we cover 40% of the cost of your therapy

Health plan with national coverage and without coparticipation

Dental Insurance: we help you with dental treatment for a better quality of life.

Sports Incentive: R$300/mo extra if you practice activities

Up to R$5.000 bonus for referring new Blue Caps

Dental Insurance: we help you with dental treatment for a better quality of life.

Sports Incentive: R$300/mo extra if you practice activities

Up to R$5.000 bonus for referring new Blue Caps"]}]
description_normalized: Why join us TRACTIAN is reimagining industrial systems so that every frontline maintenance worker can realize their full potential We're building software and hardware in one place—disrupting long-standing institutions with products and experiences that better serve the ambitions of our clients Working at TRACTIAN allows you to push your limits challenge the status quo and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry Our team members have the autonomy needed to accomplish challenging goals We are a growth-stage startup and you will work directly with the founders helping to define the vision product and user experience Data at TRACTIAN The Data team develops infrastructure statistical models and products using IoT data Our Scientists and Engineers work together to make data—and insights derived from data—a core asset across the company Our work is ingrained in Tractian’s decision-making process in the efficiency of our operations and insights and in the industry-leading experience we provide our consumers What You'll Do As a DevOps Engineer you will be responsible for acting on tools and methodologies to balance needs throughout the software development life-cycle from coding and deployment to maintenance and updates for our Internal Developer Platform (IDP) built by a platform team to build golden paths and enable developer self-service The right candidate will also be a highly self-motivated individual with the ability to work autonomously Responsibilities Design develop and maintain robust and reliable infrastructures that enables rapid and continuous delivery of software applications Apply DevOps engineering practices that will generate security speed and quality on software deliveries Select and deploy appropriate CI/CD tools Diagnose complex problems that affect the performance of our solutions Ensure reliability and scalability of our product Translate functional requirements into technical specifications and perform hands-on development Perform technical design and code reviews to maintain high-quality and secure software Prepare technical project documentation Requirements Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering Information Systems or equivalent professional experience +5 years experience with container orchestration (AWS ECS and others) Advanced level on any of the scripting languages Python Bash etc Experience in Continuous Delivery & Continuous Integration (Github Actions) Prior exposure to IaC Infrastructure as a Code using Terraform Cloud Computing proximity (AWS) Contact with observability tools such as Grafana Datadog AWS Cloudwatch Expertise with Scylla Cassandra and/or Kafka Microservices environments in a Kubernetes ecosystem Bonus Points Fluent English proficiency Compensation Competitive salary and stock options R$800/mo for you to use with food in supermarkets restaurants and delivery GymPass so you don't sit/work all day Optional fully funded English / Spanish courses 30 days of paid annual leave Education and courses stipend Earn a trip anywhere in the world every 4 years Day off during the week of your birthday R$200 a month for remote work allowance Mental health support we cover 40% of the cost of your therapy Health plan with national coverage and without coparticipation Dental Insurance we help you with dental treatment for a better quality of life Sports Incentive R$300/mo extra if you practice activities Up to R$5000 bonus for referring new Blue Caps

title: Vaga Engenheiro de DevOps Ruby on Rails | Trabalho Online | Julho...
description:
Na Turing, ajudamos desenvolvedores a construírem a carreira de seus sonhos e encontrar as melhores vagas de trabalho online, com salário em dólar, em empresas de tecnologia dos EUA. Mais de 400 empresas, incluindo Johnson & Johnson, Dell, Disney, Volvo, etc., já contrataram desenvolvedores com a Turing.

A U.S.-based company that is helping businesses to create interactive product demos in a cost-effective and quick manner, is looking for a Ruby on Rails DevOps Engineer. The engineer will be in charge of managing and scaling applications while working in close collaboration with a team of professionals. The company helps sales and marketing teams to turn their products into growth engines. The company has successfully secured more than $1.8mn during their Seed round of funding.

Job Responsibilities:
• Design, develop, implement, and maintain software components
• Occasionally manage some back-end infrastructure
• Design robust, secure and scalable features and code
• Identify and... fix application bottlenecks to improve performance

Job Requirements:
• Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
• At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a software engineer
• Demonstrable experience with back-end development and DevOps
• Prolific knowledge of AWS, Ruby on Rails, and API Design
• Prior experience with Infrastructure Operations and building systems
• Excellent English communication skills

description_normalized: A Unico é a primeira e maior IDtech brasileira desenvolvendo soluções inovadoras para a proteção da identidade dos brasileiros nas relações com empresas privadas Queremos colocar o Brasil no mapa global da inovação a partir do desenvolvimento de tecnologias que possam trazer segurança e transparência para as pessoas Para chegar lá investimos acima de tudo nas nossas pessoas que formam um time incrível e comprometido com esse grande objetivo E aí vem com a gente? 🚀 Nossa cultura Nossos valores são a base para tudo que fazemos Aqui na Unico agimos sem fronteiras; impactamos sem rodeios; somos transparentes mesmo em situações difíceis; resilientes e adaptáveis para evoluir; fazemos a coisa certa do jeito certo e somos ousados ao liderar a construção do futuro Nosso ambiente de trabalho é descontraído e colaborativo cheio de oportunidades de aprendizado e possibilidades para você desenvolver sua carreira com autonomia e apoio de líderes e colegas Você será responsável por • Compreender as necessidades das áreas clientes realizando a tradução entre o negócio e o técnico; • Atuar diretamente com nossa base de dados de produtos e negócios gerar insumos indicadores e automatizar tarefas; • Construir e manter dashboards/relatórios gerenciais; • Realizar mapeamentos de dados e indicadores; • Conduzir estudos e projetos de média/alta complexidade; • Estruturar consultas em dados estruturados semi-estruturados APIs e outros; • Ser referência técnica contribuindo/acompanhando o desenvolvimento de outros colaboradores com senioridade menor dentro do time e disseminando conhecimento de dados para áreas parceiras; • Trabalhar em proximidade com times de Eng de Dados Ciência de Dados e áreas de negócios O que precisamos que você conheça • SQL avançado; • Excel Google Sheets e Ferramentas de visualização (PowerBI Looker Tableau ou Qlik) avançado; • Experiência anterior com Data Analytics Será um diferencial se você também tiver • Liderança em iniciativas de análises; • Linguagem Python (intermediário/avançado) Local de trabalho Adotamos o modelo de trabalho que prioriza o remoto o nosso #tetounico Isso significa que os Seres têm a opção de frequentar os escritórios caso queiram e de acordo com as necessidades de cada área Temos escritórios nas cidades de São Paulo e Londrina Conheça os benefícios de se tornar um Ser Unico Benefício flexível R$150000 por mês que podem ser distribuídos nas modalidades VA/VR Cultura Mobilidade e Flex Férias; Auxílio home office valor mensal de R$ 12000 para pagamento de contas e consumo; Auxílio ergonomia valor de R$100000 creditado em uma parcela única para compra de equipamentos para home office como cadeira materiais de escritório itens de papelaria entre outros; PPR possibilidade de obtenção de até 4 salários por ano apurado trimestralmente e pago semestralmente condicionado ao percentual das metas coletivas atingidas e performance individual; Crédito educacional valor anual de R$ 400000 disponível para todos os Seres com mais de 3 meses além de possibilidade de subsídio para cursos mais robustos que excedam o budget anual; Saúde assistência médica e odontológica premium; Bem-estar acesso à plataformas como Gympass e Totalpass; Licença parental estendida 180 dias para gestantes e cuidadores principais do processo de adoção e 60 dias para não gestantes e cuidados secundários do processo de adoção com salário e benefícios pagos integralmente ao longo de todo o período E mais… Oferecemos um plano de carreira estruturado de acordo com suas competências e interesses com oportunidade de crescimento como especialista ou líder incentivando o seu desenvolvimento pessoal e profissional através de ciclos de avaliação de performance semestrais (com feedback estruturado e plano de desenvolvimento individual); Para completar a sua experiência por aqui temos palestras meetups workshops treinamentos day off no aniversário reunioff às quartas-feiras festas e celebrações internas/externas happy hour presencial quinzenal grupos de afinidade e ginástica laboral Diversidade & Inclusão Na Unico estamos empenhados em construir uma cultura inclusiva valorizando em todas as nossas posições a candidatura de todas as pessoas independentemente de sua etnia gênero orientação sexual política religião deficiência naturalidade ou qualquer outro tipo de característica Estamos construindo um ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e para nos apoiar em melhores práticas criamos o formulário de Diversidade & Inclusão Te convidamos a respondê-lo pra nos ajudar nesse processo mas deixamos claro que você pode optar por não fazer isso sem impacto na sua avaliação O compartilhamento desses dados não irá afetar o seu desempenho no processo seletivo e será usado somente para fins de criação de estratégias de inclusão Quer conhecer mais sobre a Unico? Assista nosso manifesto; Conheça nosso Medium de Tecnologia; E nosso canal no Youtube com os Meetups de Tecnologia; Acompanhe nossas redes sociais LinkedIn Twitter Instagram Facebook Reconheço que antes de me candidatar li e aceitei a Política de Privacidade para candidatos que está disponível em https//unicoio/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/Aviso-de-privacidade-candidatospdf

title: Data Analyst
description:
Paleovalley & Wild Pastures are revolutionising health for both customers and the planet. They offer high-quality, sustainably-sourced products through our e-commerce platforms. Paleovalley provides customers with premium ingredients, and Wild Pastures collaborates with family farmers to supply grass-fed and pasture-raised meats at unbeatable prices. The two companies have seen rapid annual growth (60% to 100%) and aim to extend this momentum to maximise their positive global impact.

The diverse team of 85, spread across multiple U.S. states and, very soon, internationally, encompasses roles in marketing, media buying, design, operations, logistics, and more. As a family-owned business, Paleovalley strives for a work environment that's fun, challenging, and rewarding, promoting physical and mental well-being.

The company culture thrives on unity, respect, and empowerment. Here are a few words from the team members:

"Working at Paleovalley, I've found a mission-driven company that... aligns with my values and cultivates an exceptional work environment."

"Paleovalley is a company that truly cares about its employees. The atmosphere is kind and supportive."

"Since day one, I've felt an incredible level of support and positivity from the team."

Sounds like your dream workplace? Then keep on reading

Your Future Role: Data Analyst - Shape the Future of Paleo Valley with your Insights

Ready to make a massive impact? At Paleovalley, the team is on the hunt for a driven Data Analyst to help them revolutionize their marketing strategies by making data-backed decisions. This isn't just another data job. You'll be the Sherlock Holmes of data, translating complex information into actionable insights that directly influence the business' growth and success.

Here's why you should be excited about this role:

You'll collaborate with an incredible team, including the CEO, CFO, Director of Marketing, Director of Retention, Conversion Rate Optimization Expert, and the Director of Paid Media. Your work will be front and center in the strategic decision-making, and you'll report to the Director of Marketing.

You'll be Paleovalley's Mixpanel maestro, digging deep into the data, creating reports, and interpreting results to optimize marketing efforts across the company.

You'll have the opportunity to unleash your creativity, contributing to the growth strategies daily with your innovative ideas.

Your Key Responsibilities:

Be the resident expert in Mixpanel, mastering the platform and its capabilities.

Transform data into insights that drive marketing optimization across each department.

Generate targeted reports for each department based on their data needs.

More specifically, in this role, you will:
• Analyze and interpret data related to marketing campaigns, website traffic, customer behavior, and sales trends.
• Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data by creating and maintaining data quality control processes.
• Work closely with the marketing team to identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide ongoing analysis and insights to inform marketing strategy and decision-making.
• Collaborate with go-to-market leadership to identify their teams' data and reporting needs.
• Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track KPIs and key metrics.
• Identify areas of opportunity and improvement based on data insights.
• Partner with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities to improve data collection and analysis processes.
• Design and implement data-driven solutions that optimize Paleovalley's e-commerce platform and enhance customer experience.
• Stay up-to-date on industry trends and best practices in data analysis.
• Keep abreast of all Mixpanel functionalities and updates.
• Work closely with the product development team to ensure that new products meet customer needs and preferences.

First Weeks Snapshot:

Jump right in and familiarize yourself with Paleovalley's data structure, events in Mixpanel, and how to generate new reports. Understand the unique data needs of its departments and how they could benefit from your analysis.

What Paleovalley Offers:

While the team hopes you bring Mixpanel experience, they are committed to setting you up for success. If needed, you'll receive extensive training on Mixpanel, learn about the various departments, and understand what data they consider most crucial.

Paleovalley is looking for an analytical powerhouse, someone who relishes diving into complex data sets, translating the numbers into actionable insights, and driving results. Collaboration, adaptability, and self-motivation are at the heart of who you are.

Therefore, in order to succeed in your role, you need to have:
• A minimum of 4 years of data analyst experience, preferably with a focus on marketing analytics, and customer or business applications.
• A proven track record of working with big data; building and optimizing 'big data' data pipelines, architectures, and data sets.
• Ideally, at least 1 year of experience with Mixpanel.
• Bonus points for experience in e-commerce companies.

While the above are must-haves, we'd be especially excited if you also have:
• Extended Mixpanel experience (1+ years) and a history of working within e-commerce companies.

Remember, Paleovalley's after someone with a strong analytical mindset, self-motivated drive, adaptability to new situations, and a collaborative approach to achieving results.

What's in it for you?
• A competitive salary ranging from $3,000 to $4,500* per month.
• Robust professional growth opportunities within a dynamic and growing company.
• Full-time long-term position, with a flexible schedule (Mon - Fri)
• Please note that this is a gross salary and that you are responsible for any tax-related procedures in your country of residence. We kindly ask you to apply only if you are happy to work remotely as an independent contractor.

This position will be closed as soon as we find the perfect match . So, make sure to read the description carefully and take your time to submit a high-quality application that stands out.

JobRack has been contracted by Paleovalley to support them in their hiring process on their behalf.

As part of this, the JobRack team has gained a full understanding of the needs of Paleovalley and will review, filter, screen and test candidates in line with this.

Candidates that best meet the needs of Paleovalley will be submitted as part of a final short list. Feedback will be provided throughout the process.

At the request of Paleovalley, applications for this position must be submitted through JobRack and direct contact with the employer is not desired. If you have any questions, please contact JobRack at:

If you apply, JobRack will respond promptly and keep you updated throughout the process.

Please expect the hiring process to include:

1 - Filling in the application form once you click "Apply"

2 - Upload your CV

3 - Short interview with a technical recruiter

4 - Coding test, if short-listed

5 - Attending video interviews with the hiring company where you will have the opportunity to talk more about your previous experience and the new role

Please note that this is a full-time position as part of the team, requiring 100% commitment, this is not a side job/freelance/part-time and therefore you should be intending this to be your primary and only full-time job/commitment.

If you are found to be attempting to work multiple full-time roles without the knowledge of your employer your employment is likely to be terminated and you will be banned from applying to other jobs from our site.

– Only candidates from Eastern Europe are eligible to apply –

To make sure you receive updates on your application please add to your email address book.

Got questions about working remotely? Check out JobRack's FAQ for answers to everything you might want to know

optimize marketing efforts across the company You'll have the opportunity to unleash your creativity contributing to the growth strategies daily with your innovative ideas Your Key Responsibilities Be the resident expert in Mixpanel mastering the platform and its capabilities Transform data into insights that drive marketing optimization across each department Generate targeted reports for each department based on their data needs More specifically in this role you will • Analyze and interpret data related to marketing campaigns website traffic customer behavior and sales trends • Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data by creating and maintaining data quality control processes • Work closely with the marketing team to identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide ongoing analysis and insights to inform marketing strategy and decision-making • Collaborate with go-to-market leadership to identify their teams' data and reporting needs • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track KPIs and key metrics • Identify areas of opportunity and improvement based on data insights • Partner with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities to improve data collection and analysis processes • Design and implement data-driven solutions that optimize Paleovalley's e-commerce platform and enhance customer experience • Stay up-to-date on industry trends and best practices in data analysis • Keep abreast of all Mixpanel functionalities and updates • Work closely with the product development team to ensure that new products meet customer needs and preferences First Weeks Snapshot Jump right in and familiarize yourself with Paleovalley's data structure events in Mixpanel and how to generate new reports Understand the unique data needs of its departments and how they could benefit from your analysis What Paleovalley Offers While the team hopes you bring Mixpanel experience they are committed to setting you up for success If needed you'll receive extensive training on Mixpanel learn about the various departments and understand what data they consider most crucial Paleovalley is looking for an analytical powerhouse someone who relishes diving into complex data sets translating the numbers into actionable insights and driving results Collaboration adaptability and self-motivation are at the heart of who you are Therefore in order to succeed in your role you need to have • A minimum of 4 years of data analyst experience preferably with a focus on marketing analytics and customer or business applications • A proven track record of working with big data; building and optimizing 'big data' data pipelines architectures and data sets • Ideally at least 1 year of experience with Mixpanel • Bonus points for experience in e-commerce companies While the above are must-haves we'd be especially excited if you also have • Extended Mixpanel experience (1+ years) and a history of working within e-commerce companies Remember Paleovalley's after someone with a strong analytical mindset self-motivated drive adaptability to new situations and a collaborative approach to achieving results What's in it for you? • A competitive salary ranging from $3000 to $4500* per month • Robust professional growth opportunities within a dynamic and growing company • Full-time long-term position with a flexible schedule (Mon - Fri) • Please note that this is a gross salary and that you are responsible for any tax-related procedures in your country of residence We kindly ask you to apply only if you are happy to work remotely as an independent contractor This position will be closed as soon as we find the perfect match So make sure to read the description carefully and take your time to submit a high-quality application that stands out JobRack has been contracted by Paleovalley to support them in their hiring process on their behalf As part of this the JobRack team has gained a full understanding of the needs of Paleovalley and will review filter screen and test candidates in line with this Candidates that best meet the needs of Paleovalley will be submitted as part of a final short list Feedback will be provided throughout the process At the request of Paleovalley applications for this position must be submitted through JobRack and direct contact with the employer is not desired If you have any questions please contact JobRack at If you apply JobRack will respond promptly and keep you updated throughout the process Please expect the hiring process to include 1 - Filling in the application form once you click "Apply" 2 - Upload your CV 3 - Short interview with a technical recruiter 4 - Coding test if short-listed 5 - Attending video interviews with the hiring company where you will have the opportunity to talk more about your previous experience and the new role Please note that this is a full-time position as part of the team requiring 100% commitment this is not a side job/freelance/part-time and therefore you should be intending this to be your primary and only full-time job/commitment If you are found to be attempting to work multiple full-time roles without the title: Global Clinic Agenda Analyst (Data Analyst)
description: Company DescriptionWhere we are today: Docplanner is the world's biggest healthcare platform, a global company present in 13 countries. We want patients to find the perfect doctor and book an appointment most easily. The patient journey should be enjoyable, and that's why we are always next to them: to help them find the best possible care. Anytime, anywhere. We also help doctors and clinics to better manage their practice and build their online reputation. With our integrated end-to-end solution, doctors are able not only to improve their online presence but also to devote their time to what really matters: their patients. We built medical Practice Management Software as a SaaS. We help 250,000 doctors and clinics focus on treating patients and delivering an exceptional patient experience. We also run a service that allows 80 million patients monthly to easily find the right doctor and book an appointment.Our mission is to make the healthcare experience more human :)Where we come... from: Docplanner was founded in 2012 in Poland. Today, we're a team of 2,700 super passionate people all over the globe. We are backed by leading venture capital funds including Point Nine Capital, Goldman Sachs Private Capital and One Peak Partners. We’ve raised a total of 300 million EUR to date.Job DescriptionWhat will you be doing with us?During the past few years, our company has grown like crazy - we grew from a small startup to a global company. During this fast growth, small local teams developed highly personalized solutions for their local operations, but now the time has come to standardize and scale our processes to a global level with quick and easy access to data and insights for all of our stakeholders.To do this, we are…Focusing on the expansion of the Clinics segment becoming the leading one in the companyWorking with local structures across all countries, we have operations to ensure the achievement of KPIs with a focus on analyzing customer outcomesAnalysing, in real time, how the customer cohorts are performing and making necessary correctionsEnsuring clear, concise and constant reporting on how customer cohorts are performing, and the reasons behind their performance.In this role, you’re working super closely with - and reporting directly to - Sado, our Global VP Customer Success :) and is based in Brazil, Poland or Spain (remote first). You’ll have an impact by…Leading the analytical side of strategic projects in the Clinics segment to ensure their success and maximize business impactWorking together with the business owners to create a set of operational metrics correlated with customer outcomesInvestigating and providing solutions about the biggest business challenges across the globeAnalyzing local performance and spotting irregularities, improvements and challenges, plus identifying the best practices we have locallyHandling data through its lifecycle (Extract to Publish)Discovering new areas we should focus onCollaborating with other departments to ensure we have a unified reporting scheme across all business unitsBeing a storyteller: you’re able to transmit data towards all types of audiences in a clear way, bringing it to life and making it actionableQualificationsYou have 3+ years of experience in data analytics, ideally in a scale-up settingYou’d like to know a SaaS business inside-out and learn A LOTYou love crunching numbers, investigating correlations and transmitting them to direct business impactYou’re a doer, not afraid of extracting data. You’re not afraid to dig in :)You know what customer cohorts are, and how to analyze themYou have GREAT communication skills and are GREAT with peopleYou know Excel and SQL like a proYou think analytically and like creating reportsYou have experience with CRMs (Salesforce, HubSpot would be a plus)You easily learn new tools and skillsYou have a problem-solving mindset and are proactiveSpeak English fluently; and maybe even Spanish or Portuguese! :)Additional InformationThe processIntro call with Flore (Head of Talent Acquisition for Global hires), followed by feedback from both sides regarding role fit :)SHL assessment (20 min online verbal+numerical reasoning assessment)Business exercise incl. a few days’ preparation time, and a 60 min working meeting with Sado & Mateus to discuss your thoughts and findingsFinal interview with Maria and Sado - also 60 minOffer!The maximum budget for this role is EUR 40,000 annual gross salary (paid respectively in your local currency). Of course, compensation packages are individually tailored to your experiences and how they match up with the role. Please note that we cannot currently offer sponsorship or visas for this role, so if you'd like to apply, please make sure you already have the legal right to be working and living in either Poland, Brazil or Spain. Thank you!

title: Market Data Analyst with ChatGPT Expertise
description:
Everboots is a company that designs and sells work boots on Amazon, offering premium quality at an affordable price. They focus on customer service and quality products, with the core values of honesty, experience and thoughtfulness.

While many boots out there are glued together to save costs, Everboots are welt-stitched, making them water-resistant and harder-wearing day after day. Some may call it craftsmanship, they just call it – the way boots should be .

Their core values are:

→ Do what you say & get it done no matter what

→ Do the right thing for your teammates and customers

→ Be positive

The company is looking for an Market Data Analyst to leverage ChatGPT expertise and market research to analyze customer data and create targeted marketing content

In this role, you will:
• Analyze bulk Amazon customer reviews using ChatGPT to extract valuable information and insights.
• Develop customer avatars by leveraging ChatGPT and market research data to create detailed profiles of... target customers.
• Create marketing content based on customer avatars, utilizing ChatGPT to generate compelling and relevant copy.
• Conduct market research to identify market trends, competitor analysis, and potential opportunities for business growth.
• Collaborate with stakeholders to find ways to improve Amazon business processes using insights from ChatGPT.

To be successful in this role, you need:
• Strong expertise in working with ChatGPT prompts, with a good understanding of its capabilities and limitations.
• Passion for working with ChatGPT and a genuine interest in exploring its potential applications in various domains.
• Demonstrated experience in market research, including conducting surveys, analyzing market trends, and gathering consumer insights.
• Experience in eCommerce, including familiarity with online marketplaces and understanding of customer behaviour in the digital retail space.

This is a full-time position and the working hours are from 11:30 AM to 7:30 PM GMT.

What’s in it for you?
• $2000 - $2500* per month
• Full-time & fully remote
• Semi-flexible working hours with a 4-hour overlap with PST hours
• American holidays off
• Please note that this is a gross salary and that you are responsible for any tax-related procedures in your country of residence. We kindly ask you to apply only if you are happy to work remotely as an independent contractor.

This position will be closed as soon as we find the perfect match . So, make sure to read the description carefully and take your time to submit a high-quality application that stands out.

If you apply, JobRack will respond promptly and keep you updated throughout the process.

As part of the hiring process, please then expect the process to include:

1 - Filling in the application form once you click “Apply”

2 - Being invited to record a short video to introduce yourself

3 - Completing test tasks, if short-listed

4 - Attending video interviews where you will have the opportunity to talk more about your previous experience and the new role

Applications are only accepted through JobRack . Everboots has specifically requested that you do not contact them directly. If you have any questions please contact us using Ver o e-mail no jobrack.eu

To make sure you receive updates on your application please add Ver o e-mail no jobrack.eu to your email address book. Got questions about working remotely? Check out JobRack’s FAQ for answers to everything you might want to know

title: Azure Data Engineer
description:
- 36 000 USD - 48 000 USD/year
- 100% remote work
- Full time
- B2B contract
- Direct employment by the company

Do you want to do impactful work in a company where communication is like a startup, but has the numbers of a big company? Do you want to focus on your development and work in an environment that can provide it for you? Apply and create your future with us!
We’re looking for an Azure Data Engineer for a specialist supply chain, data and software engineering solutions company with over 380 employees, development centers in the USA and India within 3 years of starting operations.

Requirements
- 5+ years of Hands-on experience with data modeling, database design, data mining, and segmentation techniques
- 5+ years of experience in SQL database and TSQL
- 3+ years of experience on ETL frameworks – Informatica or SSIS
- Experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SSIS, SAS, etc.)
- Professional experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst
... Experience dealing with structured & unstructured data
- Strong command of English and good communication skills
- A bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent

Nice to have
- EDW experience – Azure Databricks, RedShift, Azure Synapse, etc.
- Python, Spark experience
- Experience with designing and developing automation solutions utilizing Python

Responsibilities
- Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
- Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize efficiency and quality
- Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
- Work with business stakeholders, project managers, business analysts, and other IT teams to understand the business needs and their requirements.
- Responsible for designing, developing, implementing, and managing distributed applications and systems on Azure Cloud platform.
- Responsible for ETL development, data analysis, technical design, and testing.
- You would be an individual contributor and/or oversee a small work effort and/or team.
- Able to shift between priorities as needed throughout the workday.

What do we offer?
- 100% Remote work
- Long-term cooperation
- Direct impact on the product
- Career development and professional growth

Why work with us?
- We are a technology consulting company and a recruitment agency, delivering software solutions to clients from Europe and the US. We work 100% remotely, in an international team, including people from Asia, London, or San Francisco. We employ people with experience in international corporations as well as students of the best technical and business universities.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: R$14,000.00 - R$19,000.00 per month

Work Location: Remote

Apply and create your future with us We’re looking for an Azure Data Engineer for a specialist supply chain data and software engineering solutions company with over 380 employees development centers in the USA and India within 3 years of starting operations Requirements - 5+ years of Hands-on experience with data modeling database design data mining and segmentation techniques - 5+ years of experience in SQL database and TSQL - 3+ years of experience on ETL frameworks – Informatica or SSIS - Experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel SSIS SAS etc) - Professional experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst Experience dealing with structured & unstructured data - Strong command of English and good communication skills - A bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent Nice to have - EDW experience – Azure Databricks RedShift Azure Synapse etc - Python Spark experience - Experience with designing and developing automation solutions utilizing Python Responsibilities - Interpret data analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports - Develop and implement databases data collection systems data analytics and other strategies that optimize efficiency and quality - Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems - Work with business stakeholders project managers business analysts and other IT teams to understand the business needs and their requirements - Responsible for designing developing implementing and managing distributed applications and systems on Azure Cloud platform - Responsible for ETL development data analysis technical design and testing - You would be an individual contributor and/or oversee a small work effort and/or team - Able to shift between priorities as needed throughout the workday What do we offer? - 100% Remote work - Long-term cooperation - Direct impact on the product - Career development and professional growth Why work with us? - We are a technology consulting company and a recruitment agency delivering software solutions to clients from Europe and the US We work 100% remotely in an international team including people from Asia London or San Francisco We employ people with experience in international corporations as well as students of the best technical and business universities Job Type Full-time Pay R$1400000 - R$1900000 per month Work Location Remote

title: QA Tester (Automação) Sênior Especialista
description:
Buscando projetos inovadores? Então vem com a Mollica IT e encontre a oportunidade certa pra dar match! Estamos em busca de profissionais inovadores e criativos, que tenham paixão em crescer, evoluir e aprender. Qual será a sua missão? Liderar o tema de Governança de Qualidade em todas as etapas do ciclo de vida de software, definindo padrões, pilotando e implementando com os times as boas práticas; Liderar o planejamento das demandas do ambiente de homologação (sandbox) e efetuar a execução dos Testes; Alinhar o cronograma de execução juntos aos PO's e organizar e orientar o usuário final nos testes de aceite, participando do Processo de Homologação das soluções, dentro do ciclo de vida dos Projetos; Validar documentações funcionais e técnicas, modelar os casos de testes em Gherkin e executá-los gerando suas respectivas evidências, monitorando e controlando o andamento das demandas para atender as datas acordadas, considerando os requisitos de negócio e de segurança da informação... Promover uma cultura evolutiva/melhorias e de inovação de Ferramentas/Metodologia/Boas práticas de codificação no que tange a disciplina de testes em ambiente de homologação; Compilar relatórios de qualidade, metrificando para melhoria contínua; Mapeamento do caminho critico das aplicações, para automatização de testes regressivos; Analisar e controlar os indicadores de QA; Reportar divergências encontradas entre as especificações e o software durante os ciclos de testes junto aos Desenvolvedores; Manter atualizado o repositório dos artefatos de testes gerados; Apoiar POs/Analistas na definição de testes e critérios de aceitação. A Cielo promove a inclusão e valoriza a diversidade em toda a sua multiplicidade. Aqui você pode ser quem você é independente de raça, gênero, orientação sexual, deficiência, estado civil, religião, idade, origem, condição social - você é bem-vindo em todas as oportunidades. Dúvidas? Entre em contato através do e-mail squad.techmollicait.com Requisitos O que você precisa ter: Vivência com ferramenta de automação de testes (preferencialmente cucumber); Vivência com a ferramenta Jira; Dominar técnicas de testes funcionais e não funcionais; Sólidos conhecimentos em estratégias de testes. Benefícios Assistência Médica Bradesco (sem mensalidade, apenas com co-participação estendido a dependentes) Assistência Odontológica Remuneração variável anual (PPR) – (2,5 salários podendo chegar a 4,0 salários anual) Vale Refeição/Vale Alimentação (R$ 1.197,00 mensal) Previdência Privada Auxílio Creche GymPass (Auxílio Academia e Bem-estar) EduPass (Plataforma de estudo e desconto em instituições parceiras) Seguro de Vida Programa de Qualidade de Vida Programa de Gestação Saudável Licença Maternidade e Paternidade estendida Treinamentos (Universidade Corporativa) Estacionamento gratuito no local Fretado da empresa de algumas regiões de São Paulo Contratação: CLT Prazo: Indeterminado Local: Você pode escolher pelas seguintes opções: Atuação presencial na Sede da Empresa em Alphaville, SP Atuação híbrida na Sede da Empresa em Alphaville, SP (com visitas ao escritório 2x/semana) Atuação Home Office - Aceitamos Pessoas Candidatas de todo o Brasil Sobre a empresa Importante empresa de tecnologia e serviços para o varejo, lideramos o segmento de pagamentos eletrônicos na América Latina. Sua crença é mover o mercado, e a ponta de pagamento é a porta de entrada para diversos serviços inteligentes e conectados entre si: oferecemos um portfólio de soluções para atender às necessidades dos mais de 1,2 milhão de clientes ativos, desde os empreendedores individuais até os grandes varejistas espalhados por todo o país.

Beneficios

Formação Acadêmica:

Não informado

Experiência

Salário:

A combinar

Cargo

Analista de QA

Empresa

MOLLICA IT

Seleção e agenciamento de mão-de-obra

Ramo

Serviços

title: Slovenian Localization Qa Tester/Proofreader In Cupertino, Ca
description:
Job Description Summary Welocalize is offering a unique opportunity for those who enjoy a combination of linguistic and technical work. We are seekingSlovenianLocalization QA Testers / Proofreaders for a project in Cupertino, California. We need your native-level fluency skills combined with strong technical skills. If you are looking for a long-term(no end date)role this is a great opportunity for you!

The tester will conduct test cases, identify localization bugs, report them via an internal bug tracking system as well as verify the fixes once implemented.
The perfect candidate will possess strong linguistic skills.

Job Details:
Location: Onsite in Cupertino, CA (100% onsite attendance, no remote work) - client's shuttle available!
Workweek: Mon-Fri 8:30am-4:30pm (1 hour unpaid break from 12-1) = 35 hours a week
Hourly Rate: $35
Duration: Project-based
W-2 employee, eligible for benefits based on hours worked
Must have a US work permit

Benefits:
??Accident, Critical Illness... Hospital Indemnity Insurance
??Telemedicine Benefit
??Paid Sick Time - Employees accrue 1 hour of paid sick leave every 30 worked hours
??Paid Holiday: 2 days
??Employee Assistance Program

Following eligibility requirements:
??Medical Insurance
??Dental Insurance
??Vision Insurance
??FSA and HSA
??Voluntary Life Insurance
??401(k) Retirement Plan- After 1000 hours worked
Requirements

Native-level fluency in their respective language (grammar, vocabulary, composition, punctuation)
Fluency in English (written and spoken)
Experience working in translation
Tech savvy, with experience testing web-based systems and applications on Mac OS X and iOS
Ability to prioritize linguistic issues and distinguish between a true must-fix and a nice-to-have
Experience working with test cases and test scripts
Experience with bug tracking systems
Ability to clearly articulate reproduction steps for a given issue and communicate critical information
Strong problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Ability to work with very diverse teams
Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment
Strong team ethic

title: SAP FI Consultant
location: sao paulo state sao paulo brazil
description:
Job ID: 25505

SAP FI Consultant

Permanent contract

USA - Princeton, NJ, USBrazil - São Paulo, BRBelgium - Brussels, BEPortugal - Lisbon, PT

Jul 20, 2023

Eco

Solvay is a science company whose technologies bring benefits to many aspects of daily life. Our purpose—we bond people, ideas and elements to reinvent progress—is a call to go beyond, to reinvent future forms of progress and create sustainable shared value for all through the power of science. In a world facing an ever-growing population and quest for resources, we aim to be the driving force triggering the next breakthroughs to enable humanity to advance while protecting the planet we all share.

We bond with customers and partners to address today and tomorrow’s megatrends. As a global leader in Materials, Chemicals and Solutions, Solvay brings advancements in planes, cars, batteries, smart and medical devices, water and air treatment, to solve critical industrial, social and environmental challenges. You can count on our... innovative solutions to contribute to safer, cleaner and more sustainable future.

We are looking for:
• A highly skilled and experienced SAP FI Consultant to join our team. In this role, we are looking for an individual who can bring expertise in SAP FI and TAX configuration/implementation and support, specifically in ERP 6.0 or above. Your knowledge of financial consolidation, account reconciliation processes, and tax compliance will be crucial in designing and building IS solutions aligned with our finance processes.
• The ability to provide top-level support and contribute to improvement projects will significantly impact our finance and treasury processes' effectiveness, efficiency, and compliance. Join us as we transform and reinvent progress in the digital age.

We count on you for:
• Collecting and analyzing functional requirements related to Finance applications
• Designing, testing, and building IS solutions linked to the Finance process
• Providing support to customers and improving the quality of support
• Contributing to deployment and development projects

You will bring:
• University degree in business management or economics
• Minimum of 10 years of SAP FI and TAX configuration/implementation and support experience
• Good experience with consolidation and account reconciliation processes
• Fluent in financial accounting and tax concepts
• Solid experience with SAP/FI and SAP/AA
• Knowledge of interfaces between FI and other SAP modules
• Ability to analyze functional and technical needs and propose alternative solutions
• Strong problem-solving skills and ability to multitask
• Effective communication and interpersonal skills
• Fluency in English, both written and oral
• Nice-to-have:
• Knowledge about countries like Brazil, Chile, Peru, and Mexico
• Experience in an international project environment
• SAP/CO knowledge
• Understanding Spanish or Portuguese spoken language is a plus

You will get:
• The United States base salary range reasonably expected to be paid for this position is $ 90,000 to $130,00 per year. Since actual compensation packages are based on a variety of factors unique to each candidate we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted base salary range. Total compensation for this role also includes bonuses and other incentives.
• 16, or more, weeks of maternity/paternity and co-parenting leave, according to local regulations.
• Training platform for all employees
• Free language courses (24 languages available)
• Free well-being sessions (physical and psychological)

Additional information:
• Location: USA - Princeton, NJ, Belgium - Brussels, Portugal - Lisbon, Brazil - São Paulo

#LI-MC2

#LI-Hybrid

After 50 years, we are going back to the Moon... Solvay Materials are making it possible once again for Humans to return to the Moon. Check here (https://www.solvay.com/en/article/solvay-materials-have-been-traveling-outer-space-more-50-years) our Artemis missions with NASA: we will land the first woman and first person of color on the Moon.

Solvay’s purpose is to bond people, ideas and elements to reinvent progress. We can only fulfill this purpose with a diverse workforce that feels respected and appreciated, and has equal opportunities to work, grow and thrive. Our differences, visible or not, are valued. As Solvay seeks to promote unity and not uniformity, we invite you - regardless of background, age, gender, race, national origin, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, ability or identity - to consider a future with us.

Solvay is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristics. Click on the links to read "The EEO is the Law" poster and the “EEO is the Law” poster Supplement
