title: SAP Fi/co Consultant
location: sao paulo state sao paulo brazil
description:
Qualification A Bachelors or masters degree within a Business IT or Computer Science related discipline or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience is required

Industry Private

Employment Type Full Time

Work Hours 8 Hours
Salary BRL 8000 To BRL 9000 Per Month

Location So Paulo, Brazil 01311-000

Main Responsibilities:
This individual will be part of the Cash and Financial Operations team responsible for supporting Accounting, Accounts Receivable, Treasury, and Tax in North America and Latin America. Our IT & Data team for Americas is designed using an Agile framework and therefore will manage various products for the Finance & Accounting stakeholders. The position will be based in Sao Paulo (city), Brazil.

Objectives of the role RequiredBusiness Strategy / Strategic Vision:
The Product Analyst understands the value of the Product and how it fits in the overall strategy of the organization:
Assist the accounting department through the month, quarter, and... year-end closing processes.
Keeps an accurate backlog of open projects, incidents, and enhancements and can articulate major roadblocks related to solution delivery.
Optimizes the product development, minimizing the amount of effort required to maximize the value delivered to end-users
Process & Projects:
Manage projects via product roadmap, using theagile framework for delivery
Understands the SAP FICO module in detail and can troubleshoot level 1 incidents
Lead projects by managing design, development, testing, and deployment phases of finance tools.
Troubleshoot and solve critical production issues.
Knowledge of Jira Software will be a plus.
Co-build long/mid-term roadmap and the actual delivery of products and services within Finance.
Provide Level 1 analysis, troubleshooting, testing, and resolution executions to meet defined SLAs
Coordinate Level 2 support with Local and Central teams when necessary. Test and implement solutions as delivered to meet defined SLAs
Builds community for sharing best practices, skills, and competencies for FICO and associated knowledge areas (HighRadius, Integrity, etc.).
Sprint delivery and continuous improvement
Targeted profile Required About you:
A Bachelors or masters degree within a Business IT or Computer Science related discipline or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience is required
5+ years of experience in the technology-related field (or experience as a FICO key user combined with at least 3 years of technical experience:
customizing, writing functional designs, testing)
Demonstrated experience in the main Digital Finance technologies (SAP ECC 6 or S/4 HANA, FP&A tools and processes, best-of-breed tools such as Tagetik, HighRadius, FIS Integrity, Thompson Reuters Tax, Lockbox, etc.)
Experience with Easyway will be a plus.
Experience working in a multicultural, remote team environment
Experience with CPG and working agile are desired
Fluent in English and Portuguese
Innovation Skills and Competencies:
Passion for technology innovation
Ability to manage high-intensity problems
Technology market expertise in FICO and other SAP add-ons for Finance
Ability to lead different delivery models, with a preferable experience of Agile frameworks

title: Basis Consultant
location: sao paulo state sao paulo brazil
description:
*Responsibilities*:
• Providing technical support for SAP systems run on AWS
• Responding to customer tickets in a timely manner, owning basis issues to resolution
• Proactively identifying the root cause of issues and recommending and implementing solutions
• On projects supporting the build and migration of SAP systems on AWS
• Liaising with infrastructure, security and other team members to support a customer’s requirements
• Providing out of hours support cover when scheduled to the support rota
• Qualifications*:
• Minimum of 5 years SAP basis experience across multiple SAP components
• Experience with SAP Basis and NetWeaver Administration.
• Hands on experience in supporting customer SAP systems and/or implementing and/or migrating SAP systems preferably to AWS
• Experience in SAP Installation, SAP Sizing, SAP Backup and Recovery, SAP Basis Monitoring, SAP Patch Management, Router Configuration, SAP Kernal Administration
• Experience in working in multiple customer environments... each directly for the customer or as a 3rd party provider
• Excellent English language written and oral communication skills
• Ability to work collaboratively as part of a global team
• Job Type*: Contract
Contract length: 12 months
• Salary*: R$35.00 - R$50.00 per hour

Application Question(s):
• How many years of experience in AWS?
• How many years of experience in SAP?
• How many years of experience in Basis Consultant?
• How many years of experience in Netweaver Administration?
• Are you Brazil citizen?
• What is your expected hourly rate?
• What is your working visa status

description_normalized: WE ARE THE BRIDGE The Bridge is the largest network of digital professionals in LATAM with more than 230 thousand rockstars Startups scale-ups large companies and consultancies from all over the world work with us to achieve the most challenging and impactful projects Are you ready to participate in the challenge? 🔧 The Position We are looking for the next game changer to join the team as SR Full Stack Developer To consider this role you must be located in Brazil We are looking for a highly skilled mission-driven individual with unlimited drive and enthusiasm for digital transformation Requirements ✨ You will be responsible • Design develop and modify systems taking into account the service architecture; • Analyze user needs to determine how software should be built or if existing software should be modified; • Transform requirements and specifications into software; • Participate in design and code reviews; • Contribute to the development of both backend and front-end systems; • Implement cloud systems following the Serverless philosophy whenever possible; • Document planned and implemented resources in order to optimize communication between team members; • Implement automatic mechanisms to ensure that what has been implemented complies with what has been specified ✅ It is important that you have knowledge and/or experience in • Knowledge of algorithms and data structures; • Experience in full stack development using React Nodejs Typescript and Python; • Proven development experience using AWS Azure or GCloud providers; • Implementation experience using Docker and/or FaaS; • Familiarity with different types of databases including SQL NoSQL ElasticSearch and Cache; • Knowledge of version control using Git; • Knowledge of CI/CD; • Experience writing unit and integration tests; • Excellent writing and communication skills; • Ability to collaborate with high-functioning teams and individuals to achieve common goals 🚀 It's a plus if you know/experience in • Well-Architected Framework; • Candidates with one or more AWS certificates 📌 This process will be conducted considering the following steps • Application Evaluation; • Chat with the People and Culture team; • Chat with the Team Manager • The steps mentioned above may change according to the progress of the selection process But don't worry we will always be updating you ) Do you think this challenge is for you? Click on "Apply for Vacancy" we are waiting for you 🤩🚀💙

reduce_description: english; r$ 661,00 mensais de de vale-refeicao/alimentacao; r$130,00 de reembolso desenvolvimento educacional); r$125,00 mensais de auxilio internet; r$264,00 de vale estamos desde 2015 mudando a anywhere
title: Full-stack Developer Pleno a Sênior (Remoto)
description:
Você quer construir e influenciar a visão de um produto que impacta centenas de milhares de pessoas? Quer participar ativamente da construção da cultura de desenvolvimento de uma organização? Então a GeekHunter é o local certo para você.
• Ok. Mas quem é a GeekHunter?

A GeekHunter é uma startup que atua para conectar as melhores empresas com as melhores pessoas da área tech. Nosso principal produto é um marketplace entre empresas com vagas e pessoas candidatas.
• E como é o dia a dia?

Somos uma startup. E como tal, temos um ambiente de constantes mudanças, experimentações e agilidade. Temos uma cultura que preza pelo desenvolvimento, transparência e foco nas pessoas.

Para conhecer um pouco mais sobre o nosso contexto, visite o nosso github onde detalhamos nossa cultura e o que esperamos dos nossos software engineers.

Responsabilidades e atribuições

RESPONSABILIDADES E ATRIBUIÇÕES

Como Software Engineer, esperamos que você:
• Proponha o como fazer em conjunto com demais... engenheiros e liderança técnica: que solução de design e arquitetura utilizaremos para o problema em mãos? E por quê? Quais as implicações em termos de esforço e valor de produto? Quais ponderações são importantes de serem feitas? Quais os riscos tecnológicos dessa implementação? Quão escalável é a solução e qual nível de escalabilidade é desejável dada a estratégia de produto?
• Seja responsável pela execução, junto aos demais engenheiros do time, da solução acordada com Product Managers e demais stakeholders.
• Seja responsável pelo ciclo completo de entrega de software/produto: scope hammering com Designers/PMs; desenvolvimento das tasks; deployment em ambientes de Staging/Production; validação do valor entregue em produção; e construção, em conjunto com a liderança técnica, de mecanismos de observabilidade/monitoramento do software entregue em produção.
• Apresente, em conjunto com Product Managers, os rituais do time de produto (reviews, plannings, story shaping, etc). A audiência pode ser tanto interna (próprio time) quanto externa (C-Levels da empresa, lideranças funcionais, etc).
• Ajude no desenvolvimento de uma cultura de:
• DevOps, com foco tanto na agilidade da entrega de valor quanto na qualidade do produto, através de uso extensivo de TDD e frequent deployments.
• compartilhamento de conhecimento com demais engenheiros, através de Pair Programmings e Code Reviews.
• melhoria contínua dos processos de desenvolvimento: quais os gargalos no processo produtivo? Como podemos melhorar a produtividade do time como um todo? Como podemos medir nossa produtividade enquanto time?

Requisitos e qualificações
• Orientação a resultados
• Capacidade de resolver problemas técnicos e de produto
• Comunicação para o trabalho em time
• Inglês avançado
• Fluência em orientação à objetos
• Fluência em linguagens de script
• Fluência em git
• Experiência em tecnologias front-end web (React, NextJS, VueJS ou Angular)
• Experiência em tecnologias back-end
• Experiência shipping software em produção
• Experiência em cultura ágil
• Experiência em delivery contínuo e integração contínua (CI/CD)
• Experiência em TDD

Informações adicionais

INFORMAÇÕES ADICIONAIS

Dá uma olhada no que oferecemos aos Geeks!
• Plano de saúde (Bradesco Saúde Nacional);
• Assistência odontológica (Porto Seguro);
• Gogood - plano de academia;
• Telemedicina, psicólogos e nutricionistas - benefício Nav da Gogood;
• Conquer Plus e Conquer English;
• R$ 661,00 mensais de Vale-refeição/Alimentação;
• R$130,00 de reembolso do Vale Padawan (benefício precioso para você utilizar no seu desenvolvimento educacional);
• R$125,00 mensais de Auxílio Internet;
• R$264,00 de Vale Eletrônico, em uma parcela única na entrada, para a compra dos equipamentos periféricos que você preferir (mouse, teclado, headset...);
• Meu bem pet - plano de saúde para pets;
• Geek Academy (acesso às nossas formações, cursos e conteúdos);
• Consultoria Financeira da Leve;
• Convênio para empréstimos - Leve;
• Day Off Aniversário;
• Parceria com o SESC;
• Aconselhamento Jurídico (consultas gratuitas com nosso conselho jurídico);
• Um ambiente flexível e descontraído. Queremos que você se sinta motivado(a) para trabalhar até mesmo nas segundas de manhã :)

Aqui na GeekHunter temos um propósito transformador massivo. Acreditamos que tecnologia é o meio pelo qual será possível resolver os maiores problemas da humanidade.

Somos especialistas em recrutamento tech! Estamos desde 2015 mudando a forma como se contrata profissionais na área de tecnologia, garantindo uma excelente experiência a empresas e pessoas candidatas, através de contratações pela nossa plataforma e de serviços como Tech Recruiter as a Service; Geek Salary e Formação Tech Recruiter.

Somos um produto para pessoas, feito por pessoas.

Ser geek é ser alguém que adora mergulhar em diversos assuntos, é ser curioso, levantar hipóteses, buscar respostas, experimentar, errar e aprender.

﻿QUER NOS CONHECER MAIS?

Dá uma olhada nos materiais que separamos e conheça mais sobre mim!

Meu código cultural!

FAQ (Perguntas Frequentes sobre Processos Seletivos)!

Motivos para se trabalhar em nosso time de produto!

GitHub (documentação de boas práticas e styleguide do nosso desenvolvimento

• R$130,00 de reembolso do Vale Padawan (benefício precioso para você utilizar no seu desenvolvimento educacional);
• R$125,00 mensais de Auxílio Internet;
• R$264,00 de Vale Eletrônico, em uma parcela única na entrada, para a compra dos equipamentos periféricos que você preferir (mouse, teclado, headset...);
• Meu bem pet - plano de saúde para pets;
• Geek Academy (acesso às nossas formações, cursos e conteúdos);
• Consultoria Financeira da Leve;
• Convênio para empréstimos - Leve;
• Day Off Aniversário;
• Parceria com o SESC;
• Aconselhamento Jurídico (consultas gratuitas com nosso conselho jurídico);
• Um ambiente flexível e descontraído. Queremos que você se sinta motivado(a) para trabalhar até mesmo nas segundas de manhã :)

Aqui na GeekHunter temos um propósito transformador massivo. Acreditamos que tecnologia é o meio pelo qual será possível resolver os maiores problemas da humanidade.

Somos especialistas em recrutamento tech! Estamos desde 2015 mudando a forma como se contrata profissionais na área de tecnologia, garantindo uma excelente experiência a empresas e pessoas candidatas, através de contratações pela nossa plataforma e de serviços como Tech Recruiter as a Service; Geek Salary e Formação Tech Recruiter.

Somos um produto para pessoas, feito por pessoas.

Ser geek é ser alguém que adora mergulhar em diversos assuntos, é ser curioso, levantar hipóteses, buscar respostas, experimentar, errar e aprender.

﻿QUER NOS CONHECER MAIS?

Dá uma olhada nos materiais que separamos e conheça mais sobre mim!

Meu código cultural!

FAQ (Perguntas Frequentes sobre Processos Seletivos)!

Motivos para se trabalhar em nosso time de produto!

title: Senior Graphic Designer
description:
The world is changing faster than ever before. Evercoach works on empowering the next generation of coaches and leaders who are being called to adapt and thrive in the new global landscape. Established in 2015, they are now leading the industry with cutting-edge coaching and business training that create a massive impact in the lives of their clients

Their team of 15 core team members is spread across India, Malaysia, Israel, Tallinn, Canada and Costa Rica.

Evercoach is looking for a Senior Graphic Designer to lead and manage the visual design aspects of the company's branding and marketing efforts. You will be responsible for creating and maintaining a consistent visual identity across all of the company's materials, including websites, advertisements, social media, packaging, and product design.

In this role, you will:
• Design and develop graphic elements for websites, social media, advertisements, packaging, and product design
• Collaborate with other members of the marketing... branding, and product development teams to ensure that design elements align with overall company goals and strategies
• Manage and mentor junior designers and freelancers, providing feedback, support and guidance to help them grow and develop their skills
• Stay up-to-date with current design trends and technologies, and use this knowledge to improve the company's visual identity and design efforts
• Communicate with stakeholders to understand their needs and goals and ensure that design projects meet their requirements
• Present design concepts and ideas to stakeholders, working with them to make revisions and adjustments as needed
• Manage budgets and timelines for design projects, ensuring that projects are completed on time and within budget
• Manage and maintain design files, ensuring that all assets are organised and easily accessible for future use
• Continuously research, learn and experiment with new design software, tools, and techniques to improve the work and the design process

The first few weeks on the role will consist of:

→ Introduction to the company : You will be introduced to the company's culture, mission and values, as well as the entire team.

→ Technical training : You will receive training on the company's design software, tools, and platforms, as well as any company-specific design guidelines and processes.

→ Brand and Style Guidelines : You will get an overview of the company's brand and style guidelines, and will learn about the design elements that should be incorporated into your work.

→ Collaboration and Communication : You will learn about the company's communication and collaboration processes.

→ Review of company's portfolio and history : You will review the company's portfolio and history to get a sense of the company's design style and to see examples of what you can expect to work on.

This is a full-time role, and you'll be expected to work from 9 AM to 5 PM within your local time zone, with some flexibility based on your requirements.

To be successful in this role, you need:
• 5+ years of experience working in a similar role
• Strong portfolio of work that demonstrates your skills and expertise
• Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite, such as Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign, as well as a basic/intermediate understanding of other software such as Adobe After Effects, Premiere Pro or Final Cut Pro)
• The ability to collaborate with different stakeholders and consistently produce high-quality content
• Good understanding of branding and marketing concepts
• Strong creative skills, including an eye for typography, colour, composition, and visual hierarchy
• Ability to communicate effectively with clients, stakeholders, and other team members to understand their needs and goals, and to ensure that design projects meet their requirements
• Adaptability and flexibility: You should be adaptable and flexible, able to work on a variety of projects and mediums and adjust to changing needs and design trends.
• Understanding of UI/UX design principles, as you may be required to design elements that are user-friendly and easy to navigate.

The perfect candidate is someone adaptable and imaginative, with strong collaboration skills and a genuine concern for the well-being of the team

Here are the benefits:
• $2000 - $2500* per month
• Full-time & fully remote
• Paid trips to company events based on performance
• Salary bonuses & increases based on performance
• Opportunity to join a pool of profit share
• Please note that this is a gross salary and that you are responsible for any tax-related procedures in your country of residence. We kindly ask you to apply only if you are happy to work remotely as an independent contractor.

This position will be closed as soon as we find the perfect match . So, make sure to read the description carefully, apply promptly, and take your time to submit a high-quality application that stands out.

If you apply, JobRack will respond promptly and keep you updated throughout the process.

Please expect the hiring process to include:

1 - Filling in the application form once you click "Apply"

2 - Being invited to record a short video to introduce yourself

3 - Completing test tasks, if short-listed

4 - Attending video interviews where you will have the opportunity to talk more about your previous experience and the new role

Please note that this is a full-time position as part of the team, requiring 100% commitment, this is not a side job/freelance/part-time and therefore you should be intending this to be your primary and only full-time job/commitment.

If you are found to be attempting to work multiple full-time roles without the knowledge of your employer your employment is likely to be terminated and you will be banned from applying to other jobs from our site.

Applications are only accepted through JobRack . Evercoach has specifically requested that you do not contact them directly. If you have any questions please contact us using

– Only candidates from Eastern Europe are eligible to apply –

To make sure you receive updates on your application please add to your email address book. Got questions about working remotely? Check out JobRack's FAQ for answers to everything you might want to know

title: Data Scientist
description:
At Pruvo (Permanent / Contractor), in Multiple Locations
Salary: €30.000 - €90.000
Expires at: 2023-08-04
Remote policy: Full remote

We are expanding our data science team!
We are looking for a brilliant NLP expert / Data Scientist to join our team and work on solving the most challenging issues in the travel industry.

In this position, you will be part of building machine-learning models that identify relations within the data and identify the relation between them.

Responsibilities
• Create new ML & NLP Models and improve the current models
• Pre/processing of un/structured data and identifying patterns and identifying valuable insights.
• Thinking of new ideas on how to improve the company's performance

What is Pruvo?
Hotel prices tend to drop after reservations are made.

Pruvo is an innovative, award-winning hotel price monitoring service that helps travellers & travel companies reduce hotel booking prices by rebooking when the hotel price drops.

Main requirements

The... following requirements are a must:
• NLP EXPERT!!!
• VertexAI
• Python
• ML, and other models
• Proven experience as a data scientist and data mining with strong mathematical skills
• Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering or similar

title: Senior Data Scientist - Vibration Analysis
description:
Why join us

TRACTIAN is reimagining industrial systems so that every frontline maintenance worker can realize their full potential. We're building software and hardware in one place—disrupting long-standing institutions with products and experiences that better serve the ambitions of our clients.

Working at TRACTIAN allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Our team members have the autonomy needed to accomplish challenging goals. We are a growth-stage startup and you will work directly with the founders, helping to define the vision, product and user experience.

Data at TRACTIAN

The Data team develops infrastructure, statistical models, and products using IoT data. Our Scientists and Engineers work together to make data—and insights derived from data—a core asset across the company. Our work is ingrained in Tractian’s decision-making process, in the efficiency of our operations and insights, and in... the industry-leading experience we provide our consumers.

What You'll Do

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be responsible for conducting in-depth data analysis, developing advanced statistical and machine learning models, and providing strategic guidance based on data-driven insights. Your role will involve collaborating with cross-functional teams and leading scientific research to develop cutting-edge data science solutions. The ideal candidate will have a strong scientific background, exceptional analytical skills, and a deep understanding of statistical modeling and machine learning algorithms.

Responsibilities

Develop advanced statistical and machine learning models, and lead scientific research for cutting-edge data science solutions.

Utilize vibration data to detect and predict failures in machinery and equipment.

Develop and implement predictive models for failure probabilities and remaining useful life.

Perform data analysis, preprocessing, and feature extraction on vibration data.

Design and validate machine learning models for failure classification and prediction.

Create informative reports and visualizations to communicate findings and insights.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams and provide mentorship to junior data scientists.

Ensure data governance compliance and stay updated on advancements in failure detection techniques.

Requirements

5+ years in Data Science related fields

Advanced degree (Master's or Ph.D.) in a quantitative field such as computer science, mechanical engineering, or a related scientific discipline.

Proven experience as a Data Scientist with a focus on failure detection and vibration analysis.

Strong expertise in signal processing techniques and vibration analysis methodologies.

Proficiency in statistical analysis, machine learning algorithms, and predictive modeling.

Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, R, or MATLAB.

Experience with feature extraction and preprocessing of vibration data.

Familiarity with relevant tools and libraries for data analysis and machine learning.

Bonus Points

Fluent English proficiency

Compensation

Competitive salary and stock options

R$800/mo for you to use with food in supermarkets, restaurants and delivery

GymPass so you don't sit/work all day

Optional fully funded English / Spanish courses

30 days of paid annual leave

Education and courses stipend

Earn a trip anywhere in the world every 4 years

Day off during the week of your birthday

R$200 a month for remote work allowance

Mental health support: we cover 40% of the cost of your therapy

Health plan with national coverage and without coparticipation

Dental Insurance: we help you with dental treatment for a better quality of life.

Sports Incentive: R$300/mo extra if you practice activities

Up to R$5.000 bonus for referring new Blue Caps

Our work is ingrained in Tractian’s decision-making process, in the efficiency of our operations and insights, and in... the industry-leading experience we provide our consumers.

What You'll Do

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be responsible for conducting in-depth data analysis, developing advanced statistical and machine learning models, and providing strategic guidance based on data-driven insights. Your role will involve collaborating with cross-functional teams and leading scientific research to develop cutting-edge data science solutions. The ideal candidate will have a strong scientific background, exceptional analytical skills, and a deep understanding of statistical modeling and machine learning algorithms.

Responsibilities

Develop advanced statistical and machine learning models, and lead scientific research for cutting-edge data science solutions.

Utilize vibration data to detect and predict failures in machinery and equipment.

Develop and implement predictive models for failure probabilities and remaining useful life.

Perform data analysis, preprocessing, and feature extraction on vibration data.

Design and validate machine learning models for failure classification and prediction.

Create informative reports and visualizations to communicate findings and insights.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams and provide mentorship to junior data scientists.

Ensure data governance compliance and stay updated on advancements in failure detection techniques.

Requirements

5+ years in Data Science related fields

Advanced degree (Master's or Ph.D.) in a quantitative field such as computer science, mechanical engineering, or a related scientific discipline.

Proven experience as a Data Scientist with a focus on failure detection and vibration analysis.

Strong expertise in signal processing techniques and vibration analysis methodologies.

Proficiency in statistical analysis, machine learning algorithms, and predictive modeling.

Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, R, or MATLAB.

Experience with feature extraction and preprocessing of vibration data.

Familiarity with relevant tools and libraries for data analysis and machine learning.

Bonus Points

Fluent English proficiency

Compensation

Competitive salary and stock options

R$800/mo for you to use with food in supermarkets, restaurants and delivery

GymPass so you don't sit/work all day

Optional fully funded English / Spanish courses

30 days of paid annual leave

Education and courses stipend

Earn a trip anywhere in the world every 4 years

Day off during the week of your birthday

R$200 a month for remote work allowance

Mental health support: we cover 40% of the cost of your therapy

Health plan with national coverage and without coparticipation

Dental Insurance: we help you with dental treatment for a better quality of life.

Sports Incentive: R$300/mo extra if you practice activities

Up to R$5.000 bonus for referring new Blue Caps"]}]

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Tremendous is the simplest way for businesses to send people rewards and payouts. It’s fast, free, and global.

We have just one product, yet we work with a wide variety of industries. Some use cases include research incentives, employee recognition, purchase rebates, and non-profit cash grants.

The dashboard makes it as easy as sending an email; the API and integrations make it truly hands-free. 10,000+ organizations, from mom-and-pops to Google, Harvard, Visa, and the United Way, have sent more than 10 million payments to over 220 countries and territories.

Our customers rave about how quick and easy it is to use — check the ratings on G2. Yet there’s a lot of complexity under the hood, including hundreds of redemption options and plenty of banking infrastructure. This duality makes working on Tremendous a fun challenge.

We're ~80 people, highly profitable without any investors, and have been doubling our revenue and headcount for a few years and counting. Come help us!

You... will
• Own the development of product features end-to-end including scoping, architecting, coding, testing, and rolling out features
• Work closely with other engineers and designers to ideate solutions to user problems
• Make improvements to developer productivity through process / code improvements and mentorship
• Work on a distributed team

You have
• Experience building complex web products end-to-end.
• Expertise working on all parts of the stack (frontend, backend, anything in between).
• Proficiency with Ruby on Rails and React (or similar Javascript-based framework).
• Strong verbal and written communication skills. We have a document-first culture.
• Desire to work autonomously / like an owner.
• High empathy. You care about your teammates and our users. You can put yourself in their shoes.

What's cool about the role
• You'll get to work with a top-notch team at Tremendous
• You'll work on a fast growing team. Revenue has tripled over the last year, and the team size has grown quickly too. Growth means more opportunities to learn and advance
• Competitive pay, equity and benefits. The base salary for this role is $100,000 - $240,000
• We're a remote company. Work from wherever you want

Tremendous focuses on Payments, Incentives, and Fin Tech. Their company has offices in New York City, San Francisco, and Remote. They have a mid-size team that's between 51-200 employees.

You can view their website at https://www.tremendous.com or find them on Twitter and LinkedIn

title: Senior Fullstack Software Engineer
description:
Based in Washington, D.C., Quorum is a fast-growing software company and is the leading provider of workflow software and information services for government affairs professionals across the corporations, non-profits, associations, and governmental end-markets. Quorum allows users to manage stakeholder engagement, launch grassroots advocacy campaigns, and track legislative activity at all levels of government, including federal, state and local.

Quorum provides mission-critical solutions to public affairs professionals for their work in Congress, all 50 state legislatures, major U.S. cities, the European Union, and 30+ countries around the globe. Quorum serves over 2,000 customers globally including over 50% of the Fortune 100, and has over 350 team members across the globe. The company recently acquired Capitol Canary, a market leader in grassroots advocacy software.

The Software Engineering team develops high quality datasets, operates data pipelines, develops data models, and... builds services and APIs to support server-side application logic, monitor for and improve performance and integrate with the front-end. The engineer will collaborate with the rest of the engineering and product teams to design and launch new product features.

As a Fullstack Software Engineer, you will be part of the NGG development team and report to an Engineering Manager and work the full-stack using tools like React/Redux, Python, Django, PostgreSQL, AWS and much more. The NGG team supports Quorum’s mission of providing our users with best-in-class software tools by owning the end-to-end feature development and maintenance of Grassroots products along with maintaining Grassroots Actions dataset.

What You'll Do
• First Week: You'll ship new code to production
• First Month: You'll write code at several levels of the stack, from infrastructure to the API to the UI
• First Six Months: You'll take ownership of an entire set of features and make decisions that impact many clients
• First Year: You'll help guide our team as we make broad technical decisions impacting our stack, our products, and the growth of the entire company

About You
• You care deeply about the code you write and either have significant technical skills solving real-world problems or the drive to quickly develop them
• You have an interest in learning new development languages and platforms used by the wider team
• You're a highly-motivated self-starter who wants to make valuable contributions to a team from day 1
• You're an engaged learner—you want to expand your skills, get your hands dirty, and find solutions to challenging problems that require tradeoffs
• You want to work in a fun environment where you can form real friendships with other professionals and where you have a strong sense of belonging at a growing startup
• You're excited to pitch in where ever needed, from helping in recruiting to supporting customers
• You are looking to join a dynamic team immediately

What would we like to see in You
• 5+ years of work experience at a company that produces software for end users as it primary function
• Professional experience in JavaScript and FE technologies like React is a must
• Professional experience writing application code in backend languages like Python, Java, Go or Node.js
• Professional experience with any relational database such as PostgreSQL, MySQL or Oracle
• Familiarity with SQL queries and performant use of Object Relational Mapping frameworks like Django.
• You not only the care about the quality of code you write but also has a strong desire to build skills of those around through code review and mentorship

About the Software Development Team
• We’re a fast-growing team that is dedicated to improving our people, processes, and platform. The multi-cultural team is composed of a DevOps team, the software engineering team, the Product Management team, the Product Design team, and an Information Security team.
• We support many different products but internally think of them as one system with a single unified codebase. Our goal is to build centralized systems that handle complex problems for multiple features and products.
• We’re focused on doing the important things the right way -- we write solid documentation, test our code well, design for scale, and follow defined software development processes.
• We follow best-in-class security practices to safeguard our data and application against bad actors. We regularly test and update processes and technology to fight complacency, because we know good security is a continuous effort.
• We curate high-quality datasets that are essential for effective mapping and tracking of the government and public affairs spaces. Our datasets underpin our promise to give users the information necessary to make smart decisions that influence policy.
• We set rigorous quality standards and monitor them with a mix of programmatic and manual verifications to ensure users maintain a high degree of trust in our systems.
• We’re very close as a team and invest not only in each others’ skills and careers but also in building real relationships with one another: product development is a team sport and we believe that it’s better (and more fun) to work on a team of people that you know well and care about.

Our Work Environment
• We are a remote-first team with flexible work options: work remotely, or you may choose to come into our office in Belo Horizonte.

Our team loves to spend time doing fun things outside of the office - both together and remote, which we call Quorum Fun events. Past Quorum Fun events have included apple picking, yoga, virtual art classes and wine tasting.

If you'd like to learn what it's like to have a real impact at a fast-growing company that is changing the way the advocacy process works, drop us a line. We'd love to talk to you!

Compensation Structure
• This is a full time CLT Opportunity. Salary range: R$9000 - R$20000 (Commensurate with experience)

Benefits
• Standard Brazil Holidays
• Monthly Work from Home Stipend
• Mental and Dental Care by SulAmérica
• Monthly Professional Development/Mental Health stipend
• Subscription to Alura learning platform
• Alelo Food Voucher
• Incompany English classes with a native speaker teacher
• Free Subscription to the Calm app
• Invest in Yourself Days - one Friday per quarter is dedicated to your professional development!
• Bi-annual Hackathons
• Unlimited Paid Time Off
• Virtual and in-person team events
• Bright sunlit open office concept with your dedicated desk (if you want it)
• Inclusion & Diversity Affinity Groups to support belonging
• 12 weeks of paid parental leave
• CLT Working Contract.

For any questions regarding any open roles on our team, please reach out to recruiting@quorum.us.

Quorum Is Working to Advance Pay Equity: What Does That Mean For You?

In an effort to continue to build a diverse and inclusive work environment that advances pay equity, Quorum has implemented a “No Negotiation” policy for base salary for new hires for roles that are currently staffed by three or more team members. This means that candidates for the Full Stack Software Engineering role cannot negotiate Quorum’s base salary offer.

Here’s our promise to you:
• We will not ask you what you are currently earning.
• We will consider years of relevant experience, relevant professional certifications/education, and performance expectations in setting what we believe is a competitive, fair base salary offer.
• We will be transparent about our compensation structure (see above) so that all candidates have equal access to compensation information and can make an informed decision about whether or not Quorum is the right workplace for them.

If you are interested in learning more about how negotiation impacts pay equity and/or why other start-ups have decided to implement a “No Negotiation” policy of some type, here are a few resources: Project Include, AAUW, Ministry for Women, Magoosh.

Note: Quorum does not endorse or verify any of the information provided in the resources on the impact of negotiation on pay equity. We provide these resources simply to increase awareness of a topic we believe is important for both employers and candidates to consider.

We comply with all requirements for US government federal contractors issued by the OFCCP, IFR, and the terms of our government contracts.

Quorum focuses on Analytics, CRM, Governments, Politics, and Data Visualization. Their company has offices in Washington DC and Washington. They have a mid-size team that's between 51-200 employees.

You can view their website at http://www.quorum.us or find them on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn

line We'd love to talk to you Compensation Structure • This is a full time CLT Opportunity Salary range R$9000 - R$20000 (Commensurate with experience) Benefits • Standard Brazil Holidays • Monthly Work from Home Stipend • Mental and Dental Care by SulAmérica • Monthly Professional Development/Mental Health stipend • Subscription to Alura learning platform • Alelo Food Voucher • Incompany English classes with a native speaker teacher • Free Subscription to the Calm app • Invest in Yourself Days - one Friday per quarter is dedicated to your professional development • Bi-annual Hackathons • Unlimited Paid Time Off • Virtual and in-person team events • Bright sunlit open office concept with your dedicated desk (if you want it) • Inclusion & Diversity Affinity Groups to support belonging • 12 weeks of paid parental leave • CLT Working Contract For any questions regarding any open roles on our team please reach out to recruiting@quorumus Quorum Is Working to Advance Pay Equity What Does That Mean For You? In an effort to continue to build a diverse and inclusive work environment that advances pay equity Quorum has implemented a “No Negotiation” policy for base salary for new hires for roles that are currently staffed by three or more team members This means that candidates for the Full Stack Software Engineering role cannot negotiate Quorum’s base salary offer Here’s our promise to you • We will not ask you what you are currently earning • We will consider years of relevant experience relevant professional certifications/education and performance expectations in setting what we believe is a competitive fair base salary offer • We will be transparent about our compensation structure (see above) so that all candidates have equal access to compensation information and can make an informed decision about whether or not Quorum is the right workplace for them If you are interested in learning more about how negotiation impacts pay equity and/or why other start-ups have decided to implement a “No Negotiation” policy of some type here are a few resources Project Include AAUW Ministry for Women Magoosh Note Quorum does not endorse or verify any of the information provided in the resources on the impact of negotiation on pay equity We provide these resources simply to increase awareness of a topic we believe is important for both employers and candidates to consider We comply with all requirements for US government federal contractors issued by the OFCCP IFR and the terms of our government contracts Quorum focuses on Analytics CRM Governments Politics and Data Visualization Their company has offices in Washington DC and Washington They have a mid-size team that's between 51-200 employees You can view their website at http//wwwquorumus or find them on Twitter Facebook and LinkedIn

title: Staff Backend Engineer
description:
Here at Shippo, we are the shipping layer of the internet and we consider ourselves to be one of the core building blocks of e-commerce.

Our mission is to make merchants successful through world class shipping. With our products and solutions, we level the playing field by providing our customers with best-in-class solutions that otherwise wouldn’t be available to them. Through Shippo, e-commerce businesses, marketplaces, platforms and a variety of logistics infrastructure providers are able to connect to shipping carriers around the world from one API and dashboard. We provide our customers with the most competitive shipping rates, print labels, automated international documents, shipment tracking, facilitate the returns process and more.

How we’ll deliver success:

We are looking for a Staff Backend Engineer to join our Carriers team! Businesses, partners, customers, and users worldwide rely on Shippo’s integration to a global network of carriers to streamline their fulfillment... workflow. You can look forward to expanding our Shipping Carrier Library for both domestic and international shipments. The Carriers team is responsible for developing new features, building infrastructure and maintaining current services. As a Senior Engineer, you will provide leadership and oversight in technical design, systems architecture, and coding for your team as well as the Engineering team as a whole.

Shipping & handling responsibilities
• Design, implement, test, and deploy software services with high SLAs and that can handle millions of requests a day
• Ensure scalability and maintainability through microservices adoption, decoupling of concerns and data model, queuing of jobs and application layering and container-based software distribution.
• Continue to build out and enhance our CI/CD pipeline for smooth and safe production releases via automated testing and verification.
• Verify and ensure performance and correctness of systems in response time and throughput.
• Design and maintain database schema for large scale and performant services
• Architect systems and refactor existing systems for optimal performance and reuse
• Participate in peer reviews and testing and contribute to automated test suites and in design reviews for new features, products, and systems
• Collaborate with business teams and provide early input to new product ideas and functionality
• Experience being on-call and able to respond quickly to system incidents (AWS, Redis)
• Define scalable business logic
• Define, implement, and monitor operational metrics for the Carriers Library to ensure performance and quality.
• Champion testing procedures and automation in support of vertical and horizontal scale.
• Assist with hands-on work in gathering business requirements, development, and verification.

Do you tick the boxes?
• 8+ years of experience in software development
• Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work with all levels of the organization.
• Past experience and success building and supporting scalable APIs, services, or applications
• Solid understanding of object-oriented programming and familiarity with various design and architectural patterns.
• Exceptional verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills. You are adept at communicating relevant information clearly and concisely.
• Deep understanding of customer needs and passion for customer success.
• Ability to look ahead to identify opportunities, foster a culture of innovation, and build for scale.
• Coding experience in server-side programming languages (e.g. Go, Python, Java, Ruby) as well as database languages (SQL)
• Experience working with server-side MVC frameworks (e.g. Django, .NET, Spring, Rails, Phoenix)
• Solid understanding of object-oriented programming and familiarity with various design and architectural patterns
• Deep understanding of customer needs and passion for customer success
• Exhibit core behaviors focused on craftsmanship, continuous improvement, and team success
• BS or MS degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience

Bonus if you have:
• Prior experience working or interacting with shipping and/or postal carriers
• Experience using GoLang and Python in production
• Familiarity with microservices architectures
• Experience integrating with APIs that use REST, SOAP, gRPC and other technologies
• Interest and experience in performance tuning, concurrency, microservices, security, data analytics, and web stack
• Experience with Django
• Past experience and success in building scalable APIs or services
• Interest and experience in performance tuning, concurrency, microservices, security, data pipelines, and web stack
• Experience with DevOps tooling such as Docker, Terraform, CircleCI, SumoLogic, PagerDuty, etc
• Experience with AWS/Cloud services such as EC2, S3, Lambda, Route 53, Cloud Formation, Cloudflare, Elastic Beanstalk, IAM, etc.

What's in the Shippo package?
• Healthcare coverage for medical, dental, and vision (90% covered by the company, incl. dependents). Pets coverage is also available!
• Take-as-much-as-you-need vacation policy & flexible work hours
• Two week-long company wide shutdowns during summer and winter
• 3 Volunteer Days Off (VTOs)
• WFH stipend to set up your home office
• Charity donation match up to $100
• Dedicated programs, coaching, tools, and resources for your professional and career growth as well as an individual learning stipend for your personal and focused growth
• Fun team meetups through our Shippos everywhere program that includes regular team and company off-sites throughout the year as well as gatherings with your local Shippos

Our Compensation Shippolicy:

Here at Shippo, we believe compensation is a custom experience and we are committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The standard base pay range for this role is min $72,250 to a max $97,750 annual salary. We tend to anchor our pay in the middle of this range ($85,000). Since we are focused on hiring Shippos Everywhere, we have different pay ranges for different geographies (the United States, Europe, LatAm, etc.).

The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: financial budgets, work experience, training, transferable skills, business needs, and market value. The base pay salary ranges are subject to change and may be modified in the future. Total compensation for this role will include, equity, medical, dental, vision and other benefits noted in our Shippos “package” section.

\Sail through the process:

Here at Shippo, we celebrate inclusivity and are committed to creating equal access to opportunities for people from all backgrounds, perspectives and geographies. These values define who we are and everything we do. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply. If you need assistance, or a reasonable accommodation during the application and recruiting process, please contact us at accommodations@goshippo.com

Shippos in the wild:

Our people, much like the packages we help ship, are all over the world. This means, through our remote-first program, “Shippos Everywhere”, our roles can be based anywhere in the US with the exception of Delaware, Nevada, Ohio, Oregon, Hawaii, New Mexico and West Virginia and many roles can be based internationally. For locations outside of the US and Ireland, the employment contracts are powered by Remote.com (all Shippo perks still apply - including equity!). What we want to emphasize is that you can be successful at Shippo regardless of location

title: AI Machine Learning Engineer - Remote - Latin America
description:
FullStack is the fastest-growing software consultancy in the Americas. We help organizations like Uber, GoDaddy, MGM, Siemens, Stanford University, and the State of California, build distributed software development teams, and deliver transformational digital solutions. As an employee-first company, we focus on hiring the most talented software designers and developers in the western hemisphere, by creating a positive, respectful, and supportive work environment where they can achieve their greatest potential.

We’re most proud of:
• Offering life-changing career opportunities to talented software professionals across the Americas.
• Building highly-skilled software development teams for hundreds of the world’s greatest companies.
• Having delivered hundreds of successful custom software solutions, which have positively impacted the lives and careers of millions of users.
• Our 4.5-star rating on GlassDoor.
• Our client Net Promoter Score of 68, twice the industry average.

Job... Summary:

FullStack is seeking a highly motivated Artificial Intelligence Machine Learning Engineer to join our team. As an AI Machine Learning Engineer, you will be responsible for developing, testing, and implementing machine learning algorithms and models to solve complex problems and improve business outcomes. In this role, you will work closely with cross-functional teams and executive leadership to design and deploy scalable and efficient AI models.

Responsibilities:
• Design, develop, and test machine learning algorithms and models.
• Analyze and interpret large amounts of data to identify patterns and trends.
• Implement and optimize models in production environments.
• Develop and maintain documentation on machine learning models and processes.
• Stay current with new developments in machine learning techniques and frameworks.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into AI solutions.
• Identify and address issues that may arise during development and deployment.

Requirements:
• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.
• 3+ years of experience in designing and implementing machine learning algorithms.
• Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, R, or Java.
• Experience with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
• Experience with data analysis and visualization tools such as Pandas, NumPy, or Matplotlib.
• Knowledge of statistical modeling and inference techniques.

Benefits:
• Competitive pay in your local currency.
• 100% remote work.
• The ability to work with leading startups and Fortune 500 companies.
• English Classes.
• Virtual company events each month.
• Ample opportunity for career advancement.
• Continuing education opportunities.
• Depending on your location other benefits may apply.

FullStack is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form, which can be provided upon request during our hiring and interview process

title: Senior Full Stack Developer
description:
High-level Criteria:

Skills:
Node JS, Rust, Java, ReactJS, Lightning Web Component
Level:
Senior
Approx wage:
~50-60K USD / year
Key aspects:
Must have previously played a Team Lead and/or Engineering Manager role
Keyword Search:

Senior Full Stack Developer, Full Stack Software Engineer, Software Engineer, Software Developer, Senior-level Developer Titles including Senior, Full Stack, Backend, Frontend, SQL, UI Production Support, technical business analysis, MongoDB knowledge, Lightning Web Component, Salesforce development (Apex, SOQL, SOSL, VisualForce, Lightning Web Components, etc.)
Job Overview:

Gistia helps organizations deliver high-quality healthcare enterprise solutions in a timely manner through our internal processes and methods.
And this is an opportunity to join our team of talented individuals focused on using innovative technologies to address complex real-world problems currently impacting our clients.
We are looking for a seasoned Full Stack Developer to be... responsible for solving complex engineering challenges and for designing and developing critical and innovative applications.
You’ll need to be proficient in these common programming skills:
Javascript, TypeScript, Node.js, Rust, Java, SQL and NoSQL databases, React.js, Lightning Web Component, Express, automated unit and integration tests, code versioning, background job processing, experience with systems design, run peer code reviews and understand the best practices for all.
This is a remote, full-time position and you will work with an internationally distributed project team and client, so good communication skills are required.
Responsibilities and Duties:

Ability to hear and translate business requirements into technical terms or architecture designRigorously develop, test, and document code.Enhance existing solutions to improve performanceBe curious to explore and quickly react to emerging technologiesProactively foster a respectful workplace culture within the teamAvailability to work remotely and available during US Business hoursPossess own equipment, with high-speed internet access and high-quality camera/headset

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
As part of our rapid growth we are looking for a Senior software engineer to join our performance and stability team!

At Axonius, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We count on our performance and stability engineers to empower our users with a rich feature set, high availability, and stellar performance level to pursue their missions. As we expand our customer deployments, we are currently seeking experienced stability and performance engineers to deliver insights from massive scale data in real time. Specifically, we are searching for someone who brings fresh ideas, demonstrates a unique and informed viewpoint, and enjoys collaborating with a cross-functional team to develop real-world solutions and positive user experiences at every interaction.

Objectives of this Role:
• Ensure the smooth operation of the production environment by continuously monitoring system availability and taking a comprehensive approach to assess overall system health.
• Develop... infrastructure and systems to effectively monitor and analyze complex issues, enabling proactive identification and resolution of potential problems.
• Enhance the reliability, quality, and time-to-market of our software solutions by implementing strategies to improve their overall performance and stability.
• Continuously measure and optimize system performance, proactively identifying areas for improvement and pushing the boundaries of our capabilities to anticipate customer needs and drive innovation.
• Take responsibility for primary operational support and engineering duties, overseeing multiple large distributed software applications to ensure their seamless functioning.

Requirements :
• Programing experience for at least 5 years (structured and OO) with one or more high level languages, such as Python, Java, C/C++, Ruby, and JavaScript
• Proven experience in managing and troubleshooting Linux-based systems for performance and stability
• Hands-on experience in creating, managing, and optimizing Docker containers for deployment and scalability.
• Research skills and strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex performance and stability issues.
• A proactive approach to spotting problems, areas for improvement, and performance bottlenecks
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.

Advantages:
• Familiarity with performance monitoring and profiling tools to identify and optimize system performance. like Grafana, Prometheus, APM, py-spy...
• Experience in designing, optimizing, and managing NoSQL Databases. MongoDB experience is preferred.
• Bachelor’s degree in computer science or other highly technical, scientific discipline. Alternatively, military unit experience in a relevant technology role can be considered.
• Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform is a plus

reduce_description: to eur 130,000 annually after goiania state goias brazil
title: Reverse engineer in Berlin (130 000 euro per year)
description:
Join us as a reverse engineer

Location : Berlin, Germany

Do you have experience with binary code analysis? Using tools like IDA is your second nature? Do you enjoy analyzing malware or finding security vulnerabilities?

Then analyzing a large application like Office will give you a whole new set of challenges!

You need to understand data structures and algorithms involving dozens of functions all from nothing but binary. Do you belong to the few people in the world who have these skills?

Then we are looking for you.

Here is what we offer in a nutshell :
• A wide array of extremely challenging tasks
• An international team of brilliant minds
• A working environment that makes this team stay and grow
• Enough time to make sure that every detail of your solution is perfect
• A flat organization and plenty of room for your ideas
• No scheduled meetings
• Family-friendly working hours, no deadlines, no overtime
• Support for relocation
• A competitive salary from the start and a raise... to EUR 130,000 annually after only one year

About our reverse engineering

think-cell distinguishes itself from other Microsoft Office add-ins by having an intuitive user interface, smart algorithms that automate many tasks and, not least, a deep integration into its Office host application.

To achieve this deep integration, we use the public APIs offered by Office and Windows whenever we can, but unfortunately, they do not let us do everything we want to do.

So we add our own customization hooks into the Office and Windows binaries. When think-cell loads, it finds the code locations and installs its hooks.

Instead of using fixed addresses, we find code locations using machine code patterns to be robust against minor changes. If an update to Office or Windows still breaks some of the patterns, think-cell will automatically download and install any available version with updated patterns.

Finding ways to achieve a desired customization is a truly zen-like activity. It requires deep analytical skills, the ability to juggle vast amounts of information in the head and quickly separate promising from less promising approaches.

Interested?

If you are the one missing from our team then please send us your electronic application

title: Senior Python Software Engineer - from Brazil up to R$250K
description:
BE A CAVER!

We’re growing fast and we're looking for folks that want to work with peers and clients that enjoy and build great products together.

SNOWCAVE is a community of IT professionals created from Developers to Developers. Our culture is based on the principles of respect, empathy, diversity and productivity. If you are tired of being just a number in other consultancy companies, you're in the right place. Be a Caver!

THE RULE

As a Senior Python Software Engineer, you will be a key member of our software development team, responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining high-quality and scalable software solutions using Python. Your expertise in Python programming and software engineering principles will be crucial in driving the success of our projects and ensuring the delivery of exceptional products.

THE OFFER

We encourage you to have an amazing quality of life. We believe it's fundamental to you to do your best in your job. To achieve this, we motivate our... Cavers. It's not only a beautiful speech, but actions. So let's go straight to the point:
• You work 100% remotely.
• An open-mind community vision.
• You can count on us to support you during your journey.
• You get a very competitive salary up to R$ 20K (R$ 250K per year) (DOE).
• You get a Welcome Bonus up to R$ 5K if you are hired.
• You get at least 2 extra bonuses in one year.

We are working to create more and more benefits for you!

THE REQUIREMENTS

Proven track record (5+ years) of hands-on experience as a Python developer, with a deep understanding of the language and its ecosystem.

Proficiency in working with relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and NoSQL databases (e.g MongoDB, Redis).

Experience with API development & integration.

Experience with popular Python frameworks, such as Flask or Django.

Strong understanding of software design patterns, data structures, and algorithms.

Experience with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization technologies (e.g Docker) is highly desirable.

Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and version control systems (e.g., Git) for collaborative development.

Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with a keen eye for detail and a drive for delivering high-quality code.

Experience monitoring and alerting.

THE RESPONSIBILITIES

Speak and write English fluently.

Building APIs making sure they are properly designed and scale according to the business needs.

Creating data pipelines to pull data from production services into our data warehouse - powering reporting, data analytics and data science.

Writing event consumers to build new data models in order to provide this data to new flows and processes.

Are enthusiastic about modern technologies, services and platforms.

Enjoy developing a project in the cloud and like to think outside the box.

Communicate actively and openly in the team and contribute your ideas.

THE PROCESS

Our process is clear and straightforward:

1. Introduction Interview (1h)

2. Technical Challenge (3d)

3. Technical Challenge Review (1h)

4. Cultural Interview (1h)

5. Onboarding Meeting (1h)

OUR CULTURE

RESPECT - Treat everyone respectfully. This is the base of our culture.

EMPATHY - Hear, understand and walk in the other's shoes.

DIVERSITY - Treat everyone the same, regardless of belief, color, religion or sexual orientation.

PRODUCTIVITY - Evolve, focused on results and problem-solving.

We prioritize creating an environment driven by innovation, collaboration, and growth. Our team is built on a flat hierarchy, which means that everyone's ideas and opinions are valued.

We are constantly supporting and valuing our community members to make them feel motivated to do their best, rewarding them based on achievements and goals

title: Cloud Specialist 3
location: sao paulo state sao paulo brazil
description:
Cloud Specialist 3-22000C5D

Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English

Preferred Qualifications

Oracle is making huge global investments to deliver the most open, secure, reliable and progressive Cloud platform to help our customers through their generational shift to the cloud.
We are reengineering our vast array of software and hardware assets and retooling our sales and engineering practices.

With Oracle's deeply innovative culture; outstanding track record of delivering most popular software platforms and its unparalleled ability to maintain a pulse of the enterprise customers - we are the only company in the world that is delivering the most compelling services at every layer of the cloud.

Inside Oracle - we are fast-growing; fast moving engineering and product group passionate about delivering Oracle's next generation infrastructure-as-a-service platform.

We are on a mission to deliver a massively scalable global infrastructure cloud... platform that is a hallmark of innovation, reliability, and efficiency.

This platform will show our customers the promise of infinite, on-demand, globally scalable infrastructure capacity that they can use to deliver efficient and productive services to their customers.

The Oracle Cloud organization is looking for a Cloud Specialist to be customers advisor, guiding trough the standard methodologies and supporting customer in different situations: Adoption, Crisis, Knowledge Exchange, Customer Advocate inside Oracle.

The Technical skill are just one part of the role, the need is also having customer centric, behavior like owner and always putting the customer at the center.

Skills:
• Experience in operational parameters and troubleshooting of the following: Compute / Storage / Networking / Databases / DevOps / Big Data and Analytics / Security / Applications Development in a distributed systems environment and Cloud Computing
• Experience in Cloud projects (migration and adoption)
• Experience in Troubleshoot: Network, Operational Systems, and others
• Experience in sophisticated and critical Projects
• Experience in a 24x7 operational services or support environment
• Positive problemsolving skills, with ability to identify issues, addressing them quickly and thoroughly, using peers and internal resources as applicable
• Must have customer service proficiency and maintain customer focus
• Deep technical savvy, interpersonal skills.
• Good Communication, Presentation, and speaking skills.
• Strong Data Center, Infrastructure, and IT Operations Exposure
• Fluency in English is required Spanish is a differential (written and spoken)
• Fluency in English is required Spanish is a differential (written and spoken)

Main Activities:
• Be a Technical Advisor for the customers
• Driving customers trough the Oracle Cloud Best Practices
• Help customers in identify technical improvements
• Help customer adoption new Oracle Technologies
• Customer Centric, behavior like owner
• Support customer in troubleshoot (different scenarios)
• Support in communication with Oracle Support Team
• Lead critical Situations
• Communication: Tech and Executive Level
• Meetings and Cadence with clients
• Must have customer service proficiency and maintain customer focus
• Deep technical competence, communication and interpersonal skills

Detailed Description and Job Requirements

Partners with customers, sales, engineering and product teams to design, demonstrate and deploy Oracle Cloud architectures that address customer business problems.
Drives Oracle Cloud customer consumption by accelerating the adoption of Oracle cloud services including discovery, design and deployment.

Oracle is an Affirmative Action-Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job:
Pre Sales

Location:
BR-BR,Brazil-Sao Paulo

Job Type:
Regular Employee Hire

Organization:
Oracle

title: Senior Java Developer
description:
About the company

Bonfire is transforming the way people buy and sell high-quality custom apparel. We are a free online platform where anyone can design, sell, and buy custom products. Weve helped thousands of individuals, groups, and nonprofits raise money for the causes they care about, and also serve the worlds top creators as their premiere custom merch platform. Were a passionate, creative, and data-driven team constantly pursuing our vision: to strengthen communities that inspire a kinder world. We bring this vision to life by hiring passionate, smart people who celebrate and respect others, are committed to a life of curiosity, are never satisfied with good enough, are eager to co-create the future, and who thrive through teamwork. Have we been looking for you?

Bonfire employees are expected to embrace the Mission and Values , we live together and apart.

Humble Ingenuity, Trusting Partnerships, Inclusive Cooperation, Moral Courage, Healthy Dissatisfaction
About the role

Our... Engineering team is searching for their future Senior Java Developer who is a critical thinker, fast learner, and SQL natural who enjoys being a problem solver.

The Senior Java Developer will be responsible for implementing new features, fixing bugs, and improving and refactoring code. Most of what you will do is web-related, so many tasks will ask you to implement REST endpoints to help achieve business objectives and connect the dots on the web. However, much of the teams tasks are also not strictly web-related and may challenge you in other ways (e.g. data analytics, network communication, database optimization, etc.). You will have a lot of independence and agency while working, but will communicate with other colleagues daily and often work with them directly to solve coding issues.

This role requires the ability to work on a feature from start to finish, communicate about it, and ask the right questions along the way. Being comfortable with Java and confidently writing code to be deployed to production servers are key functions of this role as well. In addition, the ideal candidate will need to be able to tinker with Javascript code and wont be afraid to SSH into a server and change configuration files.

This role lies within our Engineering department and reports to the Engineering Manager.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES

include but are not limited to:
• Discuss and provide feedback to feature ideas
• Code, test and document features following the A/C (acceptance criteria) provided by the Product team
• Debug and optimize new and existing code
• Discuss and provide feedback for development processes (be active during process retrospective meetings)
• Write automated unit, integration and end-to-end tests
• Work independently and collaboratively with other team members
• Conduct code reviews for yourself and your peers
• Work on confirming bugs with the QA team
• Attend daily standup meetings and provide feedback about the progress youre making
• Attend meetings with the product team and the rest of the squad and discuss new features and way to develop them
About you

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
• High School Graduate
• Minimum 5 years of dev experience (regardless of the tech stack)
• Minimum 3 years experience with Spring, Java and PostgreSQL
• Consistent access to a reasonably distraction free home work space, with reliable access to high-speed internet and use of a smart phone/mobile device.
• Technologically savvy, with strong computer skills and the ability to embrace and adapt to changes to technology that is critical to how we work.
• Reside in European & South American time zones.

ADDITIONAL DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS
• Experience with JOOQ
• Experience with AngularJS and/or Angular
• Experience with AWS
• Experience with Terraform
What's in it for you?

When team members all around the world were asked to find three words theyd use to describe Bonfire, the most commonly shared values were: kind, inclusive, charitable, supportive, collaborative, and passionate. Work here and help us guide people toward their full potential and possibility in support of a company thats trying to infuse the world with more of those values.

In addition to leading purposeful work, you will also benefit from our team member offerings:
• Competitive compensation - $4,810USD / month
• Remote work environment (We are a fully distributed team)
• Flexible scheduling
• Year-round swag giveaways
• A positive culture and dynamic team environment
• The ability to help create a kinder planet
• An environment to grow your skills, learn new technologies, and to challenge yourself
How to apply?

If you find yourself a good fit for this job, please use the link to the application form to apply. Thank you

title: Pessoa Desenvolvedora Java Fullstack Júnior
description:
Buscando projetos inovadores? Então vem com a Mollica IT e encontre a oportunidade certa pra dar match! Estamos em busca de profissionais inovadores e criativos, que tenham paixão em crescer, evoluir e aprender. Dúvidas? Entre em contato com squad.devsmollicait.com Requisitos O que você precisa ter? Experiência profissional com Java, Spring Boot e APIs web; Experiência em Angular/AngularJS, JavaScript, TypeScript, JSP, Jquery, HTML, CSS; Conhecimento em JSP, Microserviços, JasperReports e JPA/Hibernate; Vivência com banco de dados Oracle e PL/SQL; Metodologias ágeis, Scrum; Versionamento (GIT); Graduação completa: Ter Ensino superior completo na área de tecnologia da informação ou graduação em qualquer curso de não tecnologia, desde que tenha pós completa em TI; Diferenciais: Struts; Gitflow. Benefícios Vale Alimentação/Vale Refeição de R$ 2.000,00/mês - cartão Flash Benefícios Plano de saúde de sua escolha: Unimed ou Notre Dame (sem custo de mensalidade para o colaborador, apenas 50... de coparticipação quando utilizar de algum procedimento) Plano odontológico da Uniodonto: totalmente gratuito para o colaborador Seguro de vida gratuito Aulas de inglês gratuitas Incentivo aos estudos (Graduação/Pós/MBA) – reembolso de 50% do valor da mensalidade em folha para o colaborador Incentivo ao desenvolvimento profissional – certificações, reembolso de 100% em caso de aprovação Investimento em capacitação profissional - treinamentos e patrocínio para participação em eventos como TDC Day-off no mês de aniversário – esse dia é todo seu! Horário flexível Modalidade de trabalho 100% home-office com auxílio de R$ 70,00 por mês Licença paternidade estendida de 10 dias Programa de indicação premiada – R$1.000,00 para profissionais indicados por você e que venham a ser contratados Premiação por tempo de casa – aqui celebramos sua trajetória conosco 1, 3, 5, 7, 10, 15 e 20 anos Convênios com universidades Plataforma Feedz - voltada para comunicação, estruturação do seu PDI e feedbacks Plano de cargos e salários PLR Contratação: CLT Prazo: Indeterminado Local: Florianópolis - SC, Atuação em modelo híbrido Observação: Atuação presencial 3x/semana no escritório do cliente em Florianópolis. No período da manhã o profissional atua home-office e apenas à tarde nesses 3 dias comparece presencialmente no escritório. Sobre a empresa A AMcom atua no mercado de tecnologia da informação há mais de 20 anos e fornecemos soluções inovadoras para empresas de diversos segmentos. Inovamos com tecnologias emergentes e metodologias e práticas ágeis, cocriando produtos que atendem às demandas específicas de cada negócio, impulsionando a eficiência operacional desde a produção até o pós-venda. Com destaque para a certificação GPTW em 2022 pelo terceiro ano consecutivo, e da entrada para o ranking das 150 Melhores Empresas para Trabalhar em TI e das 150 Melhores Empresas do Brasil, ocupando a 26 posição. Além disso, o nosso time de R&S está entre os 100 RHs mais inspiradores do Brasil, com destaque na categoria encantamento.

Beneficios

Formação Acadêmica:

Não informado

Experiência

Salário:

A combinar

Cargo

Desenvolvedor Java

Empresa

MOLLICA IT

Seleção e agenciamento de mão-de-obra

Ramo

Serviços
